name: Caroline Thompson
text: Seriously, love Dr. Renfroe and his staff. My dogs are always able to be seen quickly and don't have to spend a bunch of time in the waiting room. He also spends time answering my questions and is extremely affordable.

name: Charley Corbin
text: My husband & I had a senior pit bull who had a good bit of health problems. We took him to Dr. Renfroe after our vet passed away & he was so good to our Gotti. Unfortunately,  last Saturday we had to have Gotti put to sleep. There was nothing more that could be done for him. He took a really bad turn for the worse on Friday so I called Dr. Renfroe's office at 9:30 Saturday morning to see if he would squeeze us in & help end our baby's suffering. They had us up there at 11. Dr. Renfroe & his staff were so amazing through our tragic loss. They were by far the cheapest we found for euthanizing & were so understanding. They never rushed us at all & let us stay as long as we wanted to with our boy. Dr. Renfroe was even so kind to carry his body out to my car for us. I'm so thankful for everyone in that office, they truly are the best. Thank you from the bottom of our hearts, Dustin, Charley, & Gotti Corbin.

name: Susan Rush
text: Very disappointed I paid $200 cause my dog is sick the medicine I was given didn't work now they want $175 to check her out again what a rip off do they really care about our family pets

text: We took off work alittle early my wife called to make an appointment, surprisingly we were seen the same day. We had our African gray parrot checked out, clipped and trimmed. And our kitten recieved his first shots, trimmed nails and flea treated in just a matter of minutes. Good caring service.

text: Love the staff here!! They were great with all my furbabies! Also, have great price on 3 yr rabies shot.

text: Great place, they gave me a same day appt for 1:30 but because my fur baby took a turn for the worse I called the office and they made room for us at 10am. Very reasonable price!

name: Lori Hepfner
text:
I went today for a first visit and what a disappointment!

I had read the poor reviews and thought you can't make everyone happy.  I am 55 and had pets all my life and this is the worst/burnt out veterinary hospital I have been to.  I moved here from out of state and needed a rabies vaccination/new Vet so I googled vets and saw some prices and chose Dr. Renfroe.   I had a appointment and waited 30 minutes to be seen.  I told the assistant about a sore on the tip of my dogs tail from wagging and hitting items she said the doctor would look at it.  They both returned I mentioned the tail again & he said it was common (which I knew), listened to her chest, gave vaccination and preceded to leave.  I asks what about her tail he replied to put some tape on it, then left.  I go to pay for the shot and it was 2x the amount I saw on the internet.  The office clerk stated they did not have a website, she got Dr. Renfroe and he stated the same, then ducked back behind the lobby door.  While paying I told the clerk that they should address the incorrect information along with all the negative reviews that were posted.  She said "IT DOES NOT MATTER--HE DOES NOT CARE" I told her it was obvious and I would not be returning with any of my pets.
The building looks as if maintenance has been deferred for many years and seeing the pics in side from patients it nice long ago.  You definitely feel they have one foot out the door.....SAD!!!  Save your time & money.

name: Shea D
text: Was told by a receptionist that a pet is a luxury!!!! That my 64 year old mother should have money before having a pet... So obviously animals do not matter here just money...

name: Susi Johnson
text: We adopted a Greenwing Macaw that was approx 7-9 years old & the poor thing had never saw a vet. His foot started swelling badly from the band that was put on him as a baby, so I called Dr.Renfroe's office. They were able to get Frankie in the next business day. Dr.Renfroe checked Frankie out & told us that the skin on poor Frankie's foot was growing around the band. I already wanted the band removed because it appeared that was the reason for the swelling. Dr.Renfroe agreed and removed the band so that Frankie could get some relief. He told me that the swelling should go down & that Frankie would have a so foot for a few days. That was 3 weeks ago, the swelling is completely gone & Frankie is walking on his cage better than before. I would recommend Dr.Renfroe, he was great with Frankie & not to mention he is one of the very very few that will even touch one of these large birds. I mean seriously, these birds can crush a knukle easily when they want to so I understand why some Dr's dont want to treat them. :)

I appreciate her so much for doing that. My dog is like my child. So far he’s doing okay and I pray he has a speedy recovery.

name: JAMES GULLATTE
text: Such a small space to describe the wonderful people at this clinic.  The care, professionalism, and treatment of both humans and pets can never be fully exclaimed enough.  These people from the front desk to the back kennel give their up most attention and care to your pet.  I have been with this group since my little one was a puppy and seen their playful side.  I have also stood next to my aunt while her dog who was very old died on the table.  I then saw the compassion and sensitivity of the staff.  When you bring your pet into their care you are bring your pet to the next best place that could be called home.  I know I am stranger to those that read this but I promise you these people are the best!

text: The best veterinarian in town.

name: Shelby Gaubatz
text: The doctor is amazing.  He is friendly and he actually cares about you and your pets.

name: Christine Raines
text: Had to rate one star because nothing less was offered!!! I entrusted Dr. Leslie with my English bulldog....in which I thought he specialized in this breed. How I was wrong and we paid a price in the worse way!!! We recently breed my eb and after all the details given Dr. Leslie choose the csection date!! 2 days before scheduled csection I brought her in for constant panting. Panting being a very strong sign of labor starting. Her temp had dropped and had told him this. He didn’t check her temp and dismissed the panting. Still against my better judgement I trusted him more and took her home. Less than 8 hours later she was delivering pups. Litter of 9. The 2 she delivered naturally survived but the 7 he took by csection died. After talking to other vets it has been decided that he didn’t take the pups early enough. No compassion or sympathy was shown what so ever!! Please people don’t be a victim of this carelessness. We lost 7 puppies not too mention we found out today that a few things that he overlooked or dismissed were serious issues.

She has been struggling and with prayers is pulling through.She has a wonderful Dr.Findlay and a great staff. They make an awesome team!

text:
Dr Finlay is the most competent, caring general-practice veterinarian I have ever had the opportunity to use for my pets. He  is attentive to both his patients and their humans alike. He will stay with you until he answers every question you have, even if he has to answer it 3 or 4 ways to be sure you understand what's happening with your 4-legged friend. I highly recommend him as a physician for your pet(s). And lucky you, as a bonus, you also get an extremely compassionate human being who understands just how stressful your day has been!
Does that paint the picture you need? LOL

name: Jean T Kiwiet
text: Great visit. They went above and beyond to ensure my pets health and explained everything clearly to us.

name: Jackie Hawkins
text: The staff was extremely helpful and understanding with everything.  They helped me clean up the accident my pet had when traveling to the vet and reassured me that for his next visit we could plan ahead to keep him calm for his visit. The facilities were welcoming, clean, and organized. I would definitely recommend Dr. Boudreau and his staff to feline parents. As for charges and the bill everything was on par with what my research had shown for an annual visit, shots, and 6 months of revolution. I also bought some food that cost the same as at Pet Supermarket. Worth the visit and worth your consideration.

name: lawlaur
text: Absolutely love this place! Not only do my babies come here for their regular needs, but they also stay with them when we are on vacation. They take great care of them and the staff is amazing!

name: lisa Berry
text:
I started going to Dr. Boudreau after bad experiences with large veterinary practices in town (yah know that HMO Feeling). I have been a client for the last 2 years and have not regretted the change. Boudreau provides an old time, family doctor experience but for my pets. I am greeted by name as I walk in the door. That’s right, his staff remembers, along with the names of my pets – WOW how refreshing! Dr. Boudreau and his staff are very knowledgeable. I have had a couple of “emergency” issues, he and his staff have always made great effort to be as accommodating as possible.

If you need a break from the big (HMO Style) veterinary practices and are looking for more individualized care, please give Dr. Boudreau and his staff a try… you won’t regret it.

name: Billy McLeod
text: Very friendly and knowledgeable staff. Dr Boudreau is awesome.

name: Elizabeth Friedl
text: By far one of the worst vet experiences. Dr Boudreau not only misdiagnosed my cat, treating her with anti-anxiety meds when he should have been treating her with antibiotics, but he wouldn't return phone calls or listen to my concerns about her health. When he did finally call back 3 days later (!!)  he treated me like I was being dramatic. However, because of his lack of care and negligence we ended up in the ER vet spending $1000 when it would have been a much cheaper fix in his office had he just taken the time to run the appropriate tests.  Even when I called to tell him about the ER visit he never called back, which again only shows how little he cares about the health of his patients. My cat was very sick and in pain the whole time he was ignoring us, and I would never suggest anyone bother with this clinic. Go somewhere that cares, like Rehm. You'll pay more but you'll get legitimate care and your pets will be much safer.

name: Vivian Delobelle
text: This doctor and staff have true compassion.

name: Ryan Williams
text: Great, friendly staff and Dr. Boudreau is the best!

name: Justin Davis
text: Best ever

name: Amy Weiss
text: They are fantastic at the Alabaster Banfield!  The staff took care of my Saint Bernard when she was sick with an unknown illness. They were able to point me in the right direction so that we could get her feeling better.  They are absolutely fantastic there!

name: Michele W
text: Our normal vet was booked/short staffed and my cat had an urgent care issue.  I was able to get an appointment at Banfield quickly.  I was greeted by a friendly staff, who politely recommended a few diagnostic items and the cost associated.  I was unable to afford all the recommended ones, but was able to get the ones we really needed to find out what was wrong with my cat.  They were in "drop off" only.  I left my cat and went shopping at some local stores.  Within a couple hours the Doctor called and informed me of the treatment needed and the costs.  While this pet hospital was more expensive than our primary vet, my cat received the treatments necessary for his injury.  The next morning, my cat was being his typical self.  The hospital did a follow up call the next day to check on how my cat was doing.  They were very friendly on the phone and shared sincere concern for my pet's well-being.  I will return to this animal hospital in the future if my normal vet is unable to see any of my animals.

resp.text: Hi Michele - Thank you for taking the time to share your experience. We hope your cat is feeling better!

name: Grace Earwood
text: The facility and workers are so kind and go above and beyond to take care of our furry friends. However, I feel like I leave my dog here for a really long time each time he has a check-up; the process is lengthy. They did not get full rating because of this; and because their prices are through the roof. They are so expensive. The prices have gone up substantially since we first started going years ago. We have since left and are finding a new vet.

resp.text: Hi Grace, our aim is to provide a positive experience to everyone coming to our hospitals. We are sorry to hear you were not satisfied and would like to follow up on your experience with us. Please reach out to our Client Advocate Team at BanfieldCares@banfield.com at your convenience so we can try to address your concerns.

name: Hannah Pennington
text: I cannot say how grateful I was for Banfield today.  Our 14 year old border aussie has been battling cancer, but she quickly took a turn for the worse this weekend.  Banfield not only made it possible for us to be seen the day we called, but were exceptionally gentle,  respectful,  and helpful through the entire process of helping our sweet girl transition.  Dr. Kendrick was thorough, but also straightforward, a quality I value greatly.  The vet tech was so patient with her, even when she couldn't make it on the scale, and loss control of her bladder.  Akaya never had accidents! So this was just further evidence she was tired, her body was shutting down, and I refused to deny her the right to die with dignity.  Banfield made that possible! On a Sunday! With hardly any notice. Thank you.  From the bottom of my heart, thank you.  You wrapped her with grace and allowed us to lie her to rest peacefully on our land ❤

resp.text: Hello Hannah - We're so sorry for your family's loss and want you to know we are thinking about you during this difficult time. Thank you for taking the time to share your kind words about our staff. We're glad to hear Dr. Kendrick and the Alabaster team were there for both you and Akaya to help through a tough situation. We are thinking about you all.

name: Candis Threatt
text: Dr. Byrd and her staff are phenomenal! My sweet fur baby, Midnight Bella was seen by them on Monday for the first time. They are thorough, a lot of shots, scrapes, and tests done at a very reasonable price. We are now apart of the Banfield family as long as this great staff is there! Thank you so much for helping our fur baby!

resp.text: Hi Candis - We're so glad to have you and Midnight Bella as part of the Banfield family! Thank you for taking the time to share your positive feedback and experience. We're delighted to read that you had such a great first visit with Dr. Byrd and the rest of the staff and we will be sure to pass on your kind words to the Alabaster team.

name: FolaShade Thompkins
text: My experience was great. The staff was very friendly and thorough in explaining everything concerning my pet.

resp.text: Hi there - We are happy to hear that you had a good experience with our staff at our Alabaster location. Thank you for partnering with us.

name: Nicole Davis-Bryant
text: I love bringing my dogs here. They really care about your pets at the Alabaster Banfield Pet Hospital. They will even call and check on your babies the day after their visit, that shows me they care. ;-)

name: Karyn Hagan
text: The veterinarians and Techs are the best. They all take a personal stake in taking care of your precious fur babies..never a bad experience!!!

name: Marti Daniels
text: Love this place. They take excellent care of Beau kitty

name: Anessa Osborn
text: They are always so pleasant to us humans and take very good care of our dog.

name: Tammy Jones
text: I took my dog in Saturday after showing signs of UTI.  Andy was oh so nice and even took him out to make collecting a urine sample easier. I usually prefer a private vet, but was really impressed with the service and follow up I received. The vetenarian on duty was personable and patient.

name: Anthony Welshans
text: This is one of the best places to take your puppies too! They have the most amazing plans to help spread out the cost of the taking care of you new best friends

resp.text: Hi Anthony - We're so happy that you enjoy visiting our Alabaster hospital and that our Wellness Plan has been a good fit for you and your pet. Thank you for sharing your positive experience and for partnering with us for your pet's needs.

name: tcarr442
text: I have been taking my two dogs to Banfield Pet Hospital in Alabaster for 5 years. I have never had a problem and found that they will always work in a sick or hurt animal that does not have an appointment. Dr. Byrd and former Dr. Hamiliton have always been personable to me and I have never left feeling like I was rushed out and not taken care of. I have also recommended Banfield to a friend and he is also satisfied with their service. I would recommend Banfield Pet Hospital in Alabaster.

resp.text: Hi - Thank you so much for sharing your positive experience with Dr. Byrd, Dr. Hamilton and our Alabaster hospital! We're so happy to hear about the amazing care our staff has been able to provide. We'll be sure to pass along your kind words to the team!

name: Erica Robinson
text:
Although an employee of the Lake Mary, Fl location, I would like to take my time to thank the Alabaster, AL team for outstanding care with my boyfriends dog, Copper!

Prior to joining Banfields Optimum Wellness Plan, Copper had never been to a vet before. As an associate, I knew this had to change!

While on vacation I brought Copper in and he was diagnosed with Heart-worm Disease at his first visit and has now started his treatment.

Many times, clients do not understand the importance of preventive care, I didn’t even fully until become an associate. I try to stress the importance of these “basic” items daily during my workday, but just like my boyfriend, some people just don’t imagine it will strike home!

My advice as an associate and “person”, do preventive care! Get a wellness plan! The cost and your pets health will both benefit compared to the cost of treatment! Just as with Copper, this could all of been avoided with preventive care services covered under the plan!

name: Temika Carter
text: Every thing and everyone PERFECT

name: Andrea Jackson
text: I have been using the alabaster Banfield location for a few years now. Both my dogs see doctor Byrd, she is wonderful and so very caring! Always taking the time to explain everything, and treating my pets wonderfully. All of the receptionists I have encountered are always very friendly even when it is busy there and slammed. I defiantly feel welcome everyone I visit!

name: Katie McCombs
text: Always kind staff and knowledgeable.

name: Lauren Crase
text: Our dogs had been in for their well visits and 2 weeks later our puppy passed away due to unknown causes. I called Banfield to ask if we could bring her in to be cremated, and was shown absolutely no emotion whatsoever. My husband and I, along with our two small children, had to walk through the front doors carrying our sweet girl in a box. The vet saw us through the doors and never once came out from the back to acknowledge us. The receptionist was cold and barely said a word as I tried to compose myself. The most she said was asking for my credit card. We received no condolences at all. Most respectful vets do a paw print in clay or some sort of remembrance, but Banfield could obviously care less. When we took our one dog in for her next well visit, there was also never a word said about our other dog. Just surprising since most family vets are very personal and treat pets like people because that's their job. We will not return nor recommend them.

name: B L
text: They are a pretty good vet for check ups and whatnot. Usually pretty good about getting you a same day appointment

name: Katherine Pennell
text: I love the location in Hoover, but this weekend, my dog was supposed to get his stitches out and they flooded and we needed to reschedule for the Alabaster location. My husband and I both called separately at different times and the receptionist took our phone numbers and said she would call us back in 5 minutes... well it's now the day our dog was supposed to get his stitches out. It's been a day and a half and she never called us back. Not to mention, she was very rude on the phone and seemed like she couldn't wait to hang up. She had no intention of reaching back out to us. So now we have to wait until our location opens back up to get our dogs stitches out. I do not recommend this location as it seems they do not care about their customers... Which is the only reason they have a job; it's to care about/for customers. Imagine if we had an emergency and needed to bring our pet in. This location is not dependable and just simply doesn't care.

name: Bailey Lantrip
text: I would not recommend this vet!  NIKKI HAMILTON COX is a vet there that has a dog that belongs to someone else and refuses to return it.  They lied and said they had reached out to Kurt but they had not.  When we posted on facebook about this they lied multiple times then called him (finally) but instead of offering to give him the dog back they said "if he drops it they will buy him a new dog."  After they realized this was not going away they deleted all the comments and reviews about the situation.  GOOD LUCK DELETING THIS!

name: William Darden
text: My pet died. The lady at the desk was very nice. Dr Byrd was also very helpful and nice. They waved my Office visit under the circumstances that one of my dogs had just passed. I'll be going back from now on.

name: LJ Prevo
text: Staff is super friendly and helpful

name: witchysheep
text: Dr. Byrd takes a significant amount of time with each of our cats and is always mindful of their needs (as they're picky cats!). Not every receptionist is the best, but I usually end up working with one of the nicer ones (whose name escapes me). Our cats are on Banfield's wellness plan so we can take them in for free checkups whenever we please - we are always recommended to buy more expensive medicines, but aren't required to buy them through Banfield, which is nice.

name: Naomi Robinson
text: This is the only place I trust to take care of  my fur babies and do a awesome job. They are very loving and caring to the animals and are very helpful to the owners.

name: Lisa Dale
text: Friendly,short visit but seem very nice

name: Maribel Talamantes
text: Outstanding service

name: TheRealBamaChris 1
text:
I would never think of carrying any of my 7 dogs or 18 cats to Banfield Pet Hospital in Alabaster, Al.
Dr. Nicki Hamilton who is a veterinarian there has had a friend's dog that was lost from right across the street from Petsmart 10 months ago and now she will not return his dog. He's shown her pictures and videos of the dog but she says she needs to talk it over with her husband. Well that's almost been a week so he had a police officer who go with him to retrieve the dog but Mrs. Hamilton is now playing hardball so the police said it's a civil matter and now he must take her to court to get his dog back. Biggest problem is 2 days after the dog went missing, they posted a "Lost Dog" with reward on Petsmart's bulletin board and this employee never even looked or she just didnt care and wanted the dog for herself from day 1. This kinda thing should never happened and Petsmart/Banfield Pet Hospital Hospital in Alabaster should never employ anyone with such actions as this lady is pulling.

This will be shared and shared again all over social media.

name: Nikolai Krestinksky
text: Staff is disrepctful and just plain rude. All they care about is racking up your bill they dont care about your animals at all. Wouldnt trust them to take care of a pet rock.

resp.text: Hello Nikolai, We’re sorry to hear that you found some of the staff to be rude and disrespectful. We would like the opportunity to learn more about what happened. Please reach out to our Client Advocate Team at 877-500-2288 or email internet.inquiries@banfield.com at your convenience so we can try to address your concerns.

name: James Morris
text:
If I was able to give more stars,  I would! I really can’t thank the staff enough.

My baby was spayed on Saturday and did great. She started getting nausea and diarrhea a few days later, and not really wanting to eat. She did fine the first 3-4 days..but I took her back in and Dr. Byrd wasn’t in, so we seen the vet that was..he wrote some meds, and dog food. She still wouldn’t eat or take her meds so I  had to take her back.

Each time we have had to go in has been close to closing..and they’ve still given her the quality care needed.  I’ve never experienced any negative visit.  The front desk is always amazing and very polite, vet techs are super sweet (even if my auddie wants to fight the one), the Drs I’ve encountered have been above amazing. Each person that works here..treats my girl, as if they were her own. thank you Banfield Alabaster Staff!!

resp.text: Thank you so much for the positive feedback about our stadd, James! We’re happy you have enjoyed your experiences, and we’ll be sure to pass on your kind words to the Alabaster team!

name: Ashley Shearer
text: Great customer service

name: Chris Martin
text: Do not bring your pets here. They are unethical. One of their vets refuses to return a little girls dog that was lost. Despicable.

name: Fred Daniel
text: Our Boomer passed away, we had already been in a week before, gotten all the expensive x-rays, etc. Then he passed away a week later, took him in to be put to sleep.  THEY CHARGED AN OFFICE VISIT FEE. Plus the cost for the cremation in addition to the keepsake urn. When I asked why the office visit fee, they said it was a corporate policy. Then I complained to the vet that saw Boomer and she said it was because it was a different vet who saw him and had to examine him. Really? That is a bunch of s=====!

name: Harley Rowell
text: They we so helpful and friendly

resp.text: Hi Harley - Thanks for your feedback!  We're happy to hear that the South Colonial staff was helpful and friendly.  We look forward to seeing you and yours again.

name: K K
text: I will not return. The receptionist was wonderful, great customer service very personable the reason I picked this clinc over others. But that's where it stopped. The vetinarian had very few people skills at all.. Maybe that's why she works with animals but they have owners -hello! We had to euthanize our cat.. the vet showed no emotion at all. Atleast show some to my 3 crying kids. We all have to do what we have to do... but please let's be human. I guess our cat was just another cat. Will never return.

name: Larry Robinson
text: I have an issue with this location of Banfield.   I cannot recommend them at this time.

name: Matt Trumbly
text: The prices are rediculous andnthe emotion the doctor haf was sickening will never go back do not recommend to anyone go to ur local vet a real vets office

name: Cashus Edwin
text: All I can say is this place will turn a sick animal away without seeing them. This place is sad

name: chris Kimbro
text: I would give zero stars if it were possible. Expensive, cold hearted, and evil.

name: PandS Lawncare and Maintenance
text: Awesome service Rachel is the best!

name: Amanda McGough
text: We trust Dr. Johnston and his staff with all of our fur babies and are so thankful to have them close to home. Dr. Johnston goes beyond most and takes the time to explain and educate clients. He is fair and just in his pricing and does not perform unnecessary tests/procedures. Dr. Johnston is a caring human being who will treat your pets as if they were his own. I strongly admire his love and passion for animals and am very happy we chose his hospital. You will be too.

name: Kat Paay
text: Absolutely wonderful vet. All of my dogs go here and will for the rest of my life. Doc is absolutely wonderful and treats the animals with the compassion and respect that they deserve. He is a no nonsense kind of guy that will tell you like it is and get your fur babies feeling better in no time

name: Curtis Bush
text: Very caring and knowledgable!  Had my Katybug up and going in no time.

name: Cody Burgamy
text: I very highly recommended that you DO NOT use Pike Animal Hospital. This disrespectful vet had our Lab, who had been our family pet for 12 years, for the entire day. Somehow between keeping our dog for 8 hours, charging us 400$ just for bloodwork and X-rays, he failed to notice the 5 pound tumor on our dogs spleen. The tumor caused our dogs spleen to rupture in which we took to another vet in town, who was amazing and their entire staff treated us with the upmost respect and professionalism. They had to do emergency surgery for which our pup didn’t make it. Aside from overcharging us, and missing the key diagnoses for the situation, he was extremely disrespectful and unprofessional to my wife and I. His passive aggressive, sarcastic remarks all of which regarding money, were almost overwhelming. Not to mention that he didn’t even send any meds home with us to help my dog. Neither myself nor anyone I know in our community will be using this vet ever again. He really needs to do some self reflection and learn how to be respectful and professional all the way around.

resp.text:
Mr. Burgamy,
We were perplexed by your scathing review because as you left our office on Monday, Nov. 30th you thanked us repeatedly for all we had done and assured Dr. Johnston and the rest of the staff that Cooper would be returning the next day for the free treatment that had been offered. We were even more surprised by the hostile text from your father that was sent to Dr. Johnston after hours. Thankfully, your father was willing to answer our phone calls and understood our position. It has come to my attention that you may have heard a briefing between the vet and staff, which is often much blunter than the conversation between a vet and the client by necessity. Unfortunately, I believe that this misunderstanding may be the source of this perplexing review. Our staff would never speak to a client in the same manner as they do to each other as we understand that clients do not handle these situations on a regular basis. All conversation that has taken place between you and the staff at Pike Animal has been compassionate and courteous up to this point.
I would like to assure you that our staff does not bring up money unless asked to do so by the client. We did everything in our power to help you and Cooper. I would like to remind you that we did not only offer ICU care for Cooper, which was declined, we also offered 7 days of free out-patient treatment which was also declined. We highly doubt that your other vet offered any free treatment for Cooper.
In veterinary medicine, there are many variables. Cooper presented as a 12-year-old Lab who could not walk; therefore, we were searching for hip dysplasia. Dr. Johnston informed you gently that as we ran more tests more health issues would be found due to Cooper’s age and pre-existing health conditions. Once initial diagnostic testing had been run, Dr. Johnston did inform you that Cooper’s prognosis for recovery was poor. Pike Animal Hospital and Dr. Johnston do not make these calls lightly and run every diagnostic test necessary before coming to this kind of conclusion.
Our heart goes out to you for the loss of your beloved pet. It is unfortunate that you cannot find it in your heart to see things clearly at this time and have chosen to accuse Pike Animal Hospital of any form of neglect or misdiagnoses when so much was offered to you in kindness. We have attempted to reach out and extend our condolences as well as hear your feedback and try to put to rest any miscommunications, however, we have been met with no response. It is regrettable that you misunderstand the situation and this review is all the more disappointing. Each case presented to us is different and as such we must customize treatment accordingly, which we attempted to do for Cooper and would have been able to do better had he returned for further treatment. Please bear in mind that Pike Animal Hospital did everything we could for Cooper. Cooper was a fine dog who the staff here at Pike Animal Hospital, especially Dr. Johnston, grew to love in his short time here. We would like to offer our condolences and hope that you will be grateful for the love and memories Cooper bestowed instead of looking for someone to blame for his loss.

name: Fat Antobelly
text: Best vet I have ever met. He is honest, passionate, and excellent at his craft. Very straightforward and won’t BS you. I know he and the staff are going to put the health of the animal above everything else. Much thanks to all of the staff at Pike Animal Hospital. Only place I’ll ever take my pets.

name: Brandon Grantham
text: I have been Amazed by Dr. Johnston. I’ve never had a vet like Dr. Johnston. He is the most caring Vet that I know and you can see that whenever you talk to him. He loves the animals and treats them as his own. The staff is the best staff I have ever encountered every time I’ve ever needed something they answer my call and are the most polite and kind. They will adjust to your wants whenever you ASK. My last pet to bring them was my female cat who was urinating blood. From the first minute on, Dr. Johnston was completely honest and upfront about her diagnosis. He tried the least invasive treatment first Antibiotics. Which we did for about a month. Me and my Fiancé  thought they worked at different points and eventually we had to have surgery. In 30 YEARS of being a vet he has never done surgery on a female cat with kidney stones. Before her surgery he did not know what she had and told us that it could be a tumor or kidney stone we just didn’t know but he narrowed it down to the 2. Dr. Johnston was truly over the top in his care of our baby who’s surgery was a great Success!!! Removal of 2 Kidney stones.  He treats your baby as his own by not doing extra procedures like sending off blood for testing because he knows treatment is expensive. If needed he will do whatever is necessary because he treats them as his own!!

name: Jonah Magnus Hate Account
text: Absolutely phenomenal. Was an emergency visit. My dog was hit by a car and the Dr and staff were awesome with him. Very professional and caring st the same time. Will recommend to anyone I see. Will also be changing vets for my other dogs.

name: Joshua Whitson
text: They treated our little puppy like their own.  Took him there for parvo.  They saved the little guy.  Now if we have to board him we go there.  The puppy gets excited if you mention the vet or the names of the people that work there.  Highly recommended

name: Laura Dove
text:
Dr. Johnston and his team are absolutely wonderful. They have been caring for my dogs for the last six years and we board our dogs with them when we go out of town. Everyone there genuinely loves the animals they see. They are also very accessible in emergencies. I have had to reach out to Dr. Johnston on a Sunday before, and he returned my call within an hour.

One of my dogs became ill, and Dr. Johnston did everything he could, but we sadly ended up having to make the decision to put him to sleep last year. It was a horrible thing to go through, but because we had been working with Dr. Johnston, I at least had the confidence that it was the right decision. When it was time, the support I got from everyone there was unbelievable. It was comforting to be surrounded by people who truly knew and loved my dog.

name: Hannah Styron
text: I honestly could not say enough great things about the staff at Pike Animal Hospital! From the moment we walked through the door they were so friendly. Our sweet baby had to unexpectedly stay the weekend with them. Every time I called they ensured me that I wasn't bothering them and gave her the best care while she was there. Even after bringing her home they were so friendly when I called with questions. I would so highly recommend them.

name: Andrew “Foster” Reeves
text: Great vet! They have always treated my dog like she was one of their pets.

name: Audra Weaver
text: I used to work here, but even before and after, I still take my pets here. Dr. Johnston loves his animals, his staff, and what they do. He will do everything he can to help you and your furry friends. No large animal practice. Emergency services. Boarding services with great kennels and yards.

name: Laura Thompson
text: The nicest & most honest people. They actually care about you & your precious babies! Always been so hopefully! Thank you for caring about ME!

name: Jordan Sutton
text: Absolutely love Dr. Johnson! Has such a heart for animals. I've been bringing my fur baby here and he's always so sympathetic and compassionate towards even the smallest problem we've had. Tells you just how it is and is very eager to work with you. Staff loves the animals and I've always felt very comfortable leaving my cat over night because I know they go in and check on her and take care of her and even update me on her conditions. Very reasonable prices! Best place in troy to go!

name: Stephanie Caldwell
text: Our dog got attacked and Dr. Johnston and his staff were absolutely wonderful with him. After weeks of stitches,surgery,and being in doggy ICU, We finally got to bring Stinky home!!

name: tori mcquagge
text: Best vet around! Our dog ripped her stitches tonight and we met Dr. Johnston within 30 minutes he made sure she was all good! Definitely recommend him!!!!

name: Jason Sulliman
text:
I am not sure what was more frustrating. It might be that time our cat was attacked by a dog so we called their emergency line and never received a call back (we found another animal hospital- unfortunately our cat did not survive).

Then again, it might be the reminder we got in the mail 6 months later about his vaccinations. But when I think about it, I think the most frustrating part was speaking to their employee about the incident. They were very sorry about mailing the reminder. Completely missed the point...

I'm sure they are fine for basic services etc. and many people seem to be happy with them. But for me, the time I really needed them they were not helpful and it was completely mishandled. I get that our pet's death is not their fault per say, but I will never take my animals to them again.

name: Robyn E
text:
Unfortunately, I lost 2 pets in their care. I lost a Toy Poodle that I was told had pyometra and needed to be spayed immediately. I took her in and she was extremely sick. I went to visit her, and they had her in the boarding runs, surrounded by barking dogs. I asked for her to be moved to a more quiet place, so they moved her to the cat room. A couple of days later, I came to visit her again, and they had her in a "parvo" kennel that was being used for storage. She died shortly after that visit.

A couple of years later, I brought a Heeler in because she was throwing up. Same scenario--pyometra. They spayed her and her health continued to decline. After a few days, she was stable enough to come home. When my husband got there to pick her up, Dr Johnston said she "crashed" when he took her IV out. A couple of days later, the doctor recommended that we euthanize her.

I came in to pay my $1200 bill and pick up my dog's ashes,  and the doctor didn't even bother to talk to me. The young man at the desk apologized and hugged me. Then he handed me a stained pillowcase with a plastic bag full of ashes. I couldn't even get a list of procedures that they did on my Heeler.

It has taken me a long time to be able to write this review. Look around the clinic when you go in. There are used needles laying on counters and the place needs to be deep cleaned. The exam rooms are full of junk, so he uses the exam table in the middle, where the public has no business going.

I've been to a lot of vet clinics, and have worked at a couple. This one is sad.  Yes, Dr Johnston is nice, but that only goes so far.

resp.text:
Hi Robyn, first I would like to say we are so sorry for your loss. Since you have chosen to remain anonymous and this event occurred years ago, I have little recollection of the specific details. I do, however, remember you said you previously worked in vet clinics before. You were shown that my equipment is constantly upgraded and all approved treatment protocols were followed. You must still be grieving to write a scathing one star review so long after the event occurred. My heart goes out to you. I would have met you at the door with your ashes had I known you were here.
I am also very sorry that you did not have your dogs spayed. That would have prevented the deadly pyometra, not the lack of a "deep cleaning" which all but brand new clinics require. To ensure transparency, we do encourage clients to watch us work on their pets in our treatment area. All treatment areas have surgical instruments and needles in them. If a client does not care to watch, they always have the option to wait in the lobby. Since the time of your visit we have an entire new staff. I have shown them your review in an effort to reemphasize the importance of client communication, compassion, cleanliness, and grief management. Sometimes during upgrades to our facility, we regrettably must utilizes all the storage space including the exam room and isolation ward. Sounds like you caught us at a very busy time and we made some mistakes in those areas, but unfortunately those things could not have prevented the tragic outcome. All animals I see get the best care I can provide. Tragically, they do not all survive and I have as much trouble accepting that as you  do.
I have been practicing for 30 years now. Losing a patient gets hard every year. Online reviews are new to me. I take them all personally and would much rather speak in person. I am very accepting and open to constructive criticism.  As you can tell by the vast majority of my reviews, that my cherished clients are pleased. I know it is impossible to please everyone and save every pet, but I do try my hardest. It breaks my heart to know how you must feel to write this review after a loss so long ago. Again, I am sincerely sorry you are still grieving and I am hurting too.
My very best regards.

name: Matt Ezell
text:
My wife and I have been bringing our dogs here for years.  When we lived in Troy, we wrestled for years trying to find a vet we were truly comfortable with...  After being recommended here by friends, we have never looked again.  The people here not only do this for a 'job', but they do this because it is important to them and because they truly care for our animals...

Since, we have moved nearly 3 hours away from Troy, but still often drive our dogs back down for their shots and checkups when we can just because we love the care and value of the Pike Animal Hospital.

name: Theresa Frakes
text: Dr. Johnston is dedicated to his patients and treats each animal as if it were his own!

name: Jeff H (Tandom)
text: Just started taking my dog here after trying out a few of the other places. Johnson is a good vet who tells you like it is. He takes care your dog like one of his.

name: Amy Copeland
text: Wonderful place for your pets. Excellent care and compassion.

name: Vickie Roberts
text: Wonderful clinic to work with.

name: Ronda M
text: I have to give them a 5 star.  A friends baby boy Louie became very ill, due to being bit.  They weren't sure at first what had bitten him.  He didn't get any better with the treatment he was receiving so, they started an antivenom thinking that maybe he was bitten by a baby snake.  He has started to improve, but has a long road to recover.  Robin is extremely grateful for all that they are doing for Louie....  Thank you for all your care.

name: Rebecca Walters
text: The employees and doc says very friendly

name: Latasha Smith
text: Lost my dear Della but the vet and his staff was very compassionate towards my family thank you so much

name: Angel Tillery
text: Biggest, bestest heart! Such caring staff.

name: kevin heil
text:
I'm a truck driver who takes my dog everywhere i go.
Dr Johnson is a very good at what he does and will take care of your pet without unnecessary and expensive treatments.
I really thought the week of April 1st my dog got very sick on the road she wasn't looking good i thought i was going to lose her when we arrived back home.
She was treated and found out just bad allergies.
I can't thank him enough for what they do there at Pike Animal Hospital i have been there for as long as i can remember.
Agian THANK YOU ALL for all you did for my baby she is trucking again and healthy as a 10 year trucker can be.

name: Cathy Engwall
text: Great place, everyone is wonderful and will answer any questions that you might have !

name: tr3b0r85
text: They know me and my pets. If I bump into them away from the office they still inquire about how they are.

name: April Mooney
text: I will not ever take my animal to this vet ever again.  My regerstered service dog had been possessed and about dead.  We sat in their office for an hour and he had a accident in the waiting room they told us to get that thing outside and for us to find another vet.  Far worning people u may wanna find another vet to go to instead of this one. If you go to this one your little one may die.

name: Alice Jones
text: There great

name: Robin palisades
text: Saved my dogs life....

name: Christine Henley
text: I am glad I did not read the negative reviews before I went, I probably would not have gone! This place is AMAZING!! From the moment I walked in EVERYONE from Dr. Hinton  to the staff were so nice, caring and considerate! They took Trixie back as soon as I walked in. I had called ahead of time. It was 11:30 pm on Christmas day 2018 when vets are closed. Including ones that are listed on Google that say Emergency. I guess it is only for emergencies that happen during business hours only!  BUT NOT HERE!!! . At ER Specialty Animal Medical Center there is ALWAYS someone there to help when no other vet is!! Be assured they are there to help your baby!! I had ( keyword had ) a vet for 25 years or more that I kept telling them something was wrong. I kept asking questions wanting answers! We tend to know when things go wrong with our babies  or when something just isn't right but I kept getting told by my regular vet " she is just old " . Well it was more than just old!! She should NOT have had to suffer like she did for as long as she did!! A year!! My mistake was trusting my vet and not trusting my gut instinct and taking her here a long time ago !  IF ever you need a GREAT doctor who is knowledgeable and caring or if you have a gut feeling something is wrong and you do not get the right answer from your regular vet THIS IS THE PLACE TO GO DO NOT DO AS I DID JUST GO!! I appreciate EVERYONE who tried to save my baby girl Trixie!   Thank you ALL for making a very hard and painful situation a little easier and giving me the truth so that my baby did not have to suffer anymore! Believe me I will be back to have my other baby Zeno who is also 15 years old checked out because I know you all are the best! They have more equipment than most vets! I see many negative comments about price. All I can say is I have paid way more to save a my baby only to be told after wards that I need to put him to sleep which then added more cost!! These people care about your baby not money! It is my vet of over 25 years who is in it for the money! My heart is shattered to pieces but I know my baby is no longer suffering! Dr. Hinton explained every thing and answer all my questions no matter how many or how long it took!, They do not rush me into anything! Thank you does not seem like enough! I appreciate you all more than I could express or than you know!  Love you all! Thanks again! ((HUGS))

name: Rachel Tucker
text:
Many thanks to Dr. Birk and Carl. They were amazing with my greyhound, Maybelle. Her lip was torn late this afternoon (Sunday) when she got into a tiff with another dog while playing. Dr. Birk did a thorough exam and then perfectly stapled the area closed, all without sedation. This is no small accomplishment because Maybelle has limited patience when she's uncomfortable.
Everyone was so nice, from my initial phone call to the end of the appointment. They were clear about pricing from the beginning and I left with all my questions answered. Our time was managed well, too. It only took about an hour from arrival to departure.

Bonus: She was prescribed a half tablet of an anti-inflammatory twice a day. I just gave her her first dose and found that they split all the tablets for me! Now I don't have to dig for a pill cutter in my kitchen.

You guys could not have done anything better. A solid five stars earned. Maybelle is comfortable now, enjoying a post-dinner nap on her bed as I type this.

name: Bayron Baggett
text: Horrible place to take a pet. We had one vet there care more about his little airplane that he didn’t take care of his patients and another vet that performed surgery without our permission after he found out he couldn’t get all of a cancerous tumor. He just made our dog suffer for some money. There are two other 24hrs vets that have opened that look like the reviews are much better. Primarily b/c of this Emergency Vet. If you really need the best, Auburn Univ. Emergency Vet was incredible.

name: Mike Barker
text: Our beloved dog of 18 years was dying in the middle of the night of old age and we contacted this clinic at 1:30 am. They were immediately caring and sympathetic on the phone and when we arrived at the clinic. They quickly walked us through the process while being very sensitive to our emotions. A big thank you to the night shift staff for taking such good care of our dog and us!

name: Wendy Plash
text: All about money. Stay away. Staff is extremely rude and and uncaring. Long wait when there isn't even anyone else there. Ran tests even though I stated to call first. Beware they are moving to 280 and changing their name. Not surprised. All the other bad reviews are just like I experienced. The same horrible female ER doctor is still with them. Please take your pet somewhere else!!!

name: Breck Hennessy
text: We had a scare with our small dog around 10pm and we took her here because they were open and our vet was not. It was so comforting to know she was in good hands all night staying hydrated until we could get her to our normal vet. It is pretty expensive and the wait was a little long, but overall I think our dog got good care and the staff was informative and friendly.

name: Stacie Irwin
text: The facilities are clean and easy to find.  They did everything they could for our dog.  It is regrettable that the costs are as high as they are, but having paid for emergency medical care for humans, I have no doubt they have little control over their prices.  They communicated procedures and prices to us carefully and thoroughly before they performed them.  The staff was professional, knowledgeable, and compassionate with us in a difficult time.

name: Jeremiah Blackmon
text: Terrible experience.  We called 5x before successfully getting an update on our dog’s medical status.    They didn’t provide any instructions on food or medical diagnosis when we picked up our schnauzer.   We immediately took him to our Primary vet....thankfully they now have him on the mend.

name: Chris Turner
text:
These folks are as good as it gets. My first experience with the staff was 4 years ago when our boxer, Lucy, suddenly seized. They were extremely caring and efficient.
Last weekend, my wife found a lost and starving dog near her office. With our regular vet closed, she took the dog here. Despite being so busy, they took the dog in, checked her out, and contacted the owner that had her chipped. The owner had given the dog away, but gave contact info. These folks tried to reach the owners and kept, fed, and cared for the dog for 3 days, though they were busy as heck. They even all owed us to visit the dog when they weren't completely tied up.
Ultimately, the owners never returned calls and despite posting the found dog on social media and all of the lost dog websites, we never found the owner family.
They released the dog into our care so that we could continue looking for the owners.
These folks are awesome!

name: Jeremy Grindle
text: We had to have our 13 y/o put to sleep this morning and this was the only place open today. The staff and Dr were very sympathetic and professional to my wife, children, and myself. The Dr reassured me after looking at her that I had made the right decision. A very hard but the right decision! Thank you guys so very much for helping us with our beloved pet!

name: Robert Cerfolio
text: Our beloved 15 year-old golden retriever Sugar - finally came to the end of her long life after she developed acute pain. The staff and MD at 3 AM in the morning were kind, caring and gracious and put her to eternal sleep with love. As a surgeon who deals with end-of life issues, I can say that they made a difficult emotional family experince as positive as possible.

name: Theresa Williams
text: We took our 15 year old golden in due to nasal bleeding. We saw Dr. David Dismukes. He was thorough and honest with what we would be facing including treatment options. I completely trust we made the correct decision based on this diagnosis.

name: Mrs. Anderson
text: They saved our dog from intestinal cancer.  I had a great experience with the emergency vet, the surgeon and the internist.  Yes, it's expensive.  Yes, in the middle of the night or on the weekend, they might be very busy, but they gave our sweet girl wonderful care and four months later, it's like it never happened.  I really can't believe our dog is still alive but I'm so happy she is!

name: Regina Kellenberger
text: I am grateful for the kindness they showed my dying cat.  They made the arrangements for her cremation.  They are amazing vets!

name: Megan Jones
text: Obviously atleast some of the good reviews are fake on here. They gave my dog pain medicine that the next day she still can barely move. I have to hold her up so she can drink water then she collapses back down. Opened her two prescriptions today and the bottles were switched - could be dangerous!  I only noticed because the dosage didn't make sense.  After googling what the pills look like I confirmed they put wrong prescriptions in wrong bottles!   If you go here, make sure you read paperwork.  Wasn't aware the # they gave me was an estimate which they should tell you and not just have it in tiny writing! When I went to pay the price had jumped a good bit.  People are pretty rude here too and the wait is long.  If I could have waited to go to my regular vet I would have because they're much quicker and nicer and don't just want your money.

name: Brian W. Kittrell
text: I have had to come here a couple of times with a couple of different pets. Each time it was because it was my only option. The pricing is extremely high and I do get the distinct feeling that that this is a money generating machine (with unnecessary, exorbitantly-priced tests) rather than a caring clinic. The waits do seem a bit long. The staff is friendly but they could do a much better job with communication.

name: Erin Walton
text:
Our dog spent the night vomiting, so we brought him in. We were at the clinic 3.5 hours start to finish. The ladies at the front desk were friendly and helpful. We had a lot of waiting time between staff seeing us. We had three vet techs and the vet, so we kept seeing new people without introductions. We were displeased with Dr. Shuessler. She seemed tired, irritated, and did not show the friendliness or compassion you'd expect from a vet. (Especially at an emergency center.)

We were recommended an overnight stay with IV to monitor our dog, which would estimate $600. He hadn't thrown up since we arrived, so we decided to decline. We received an outpatient estimate, and we declined one of the procedures, to which a tech seemed slightly frustrated that a new estimate would have to be written up. Overall, it was unfriendly service, a lot of waiting time, and expensive. We will look elsewhere for weekend/emergency care in the future.

name: Kaylee Frankhouse
text: just recently took my puppy here. spent lots of money and felt very confused. after a stressful day of not knowing if he needs surgery I go to pick him up and the first thing the lady told me was he needed training and begins complaining about the trouble my dog gave them. I don’t know why any of them (aside from ONE friendly person there) work where they do. I’ve never left a review for a business but as a young (and very broke) adult, I do not want anyone else to make the mistake I did coming here. I would not recommend spending your money here unless is the only option available.

name: Charles Shirah
text:
Our dog had a serious reaction to something, and of course it was on Sunday evening, when her regular clinic was closed. We were promptly seen by obviously caring folks who kept us informed constantly on what was being done. Dr. Schuessler and all of the staff were very attentive and thorough. They took plenty of time to discuss the treatment and kept us only long enough to make sure her condition was resolved. I thought the charges were very fair and well explained.
I am glad we have a facility that is available for emergencies for the four legged part of our family.

name: Christy Holt
text: PLEASE READ ALL THE WAY TO THE END IF YOU VALUE YOUR PETS LIFE!  Last night I called ahead to let them know we were bringing in a critical older dog who had been in a dog fight, had extreme blood loss and  was in severe shock.  We had been gone for the day so didn’t know exactly when the fight happened.  Right from our arrival, I had to ask for help to get him out of the car.  They wouldn’t even do that until we checked in and they got a copy of drivers license.  The “Dr” didn’t introduce us.  She unwrapped him and tried to make him stand.  She said he was too far gone and offered to put him down.  Didn’t even want to treat him! Upon insisting she finally gave us an estimate for over night treatment... over $1000. And wouldn’t start treatment until they received payment.  3 hours later we made the decision to put him out of his pain while we were there to give him comfort as he passed in stead of locking him in a kennel to wait and see if he survived the night.  Dr put him down (3re dog that night) while we were mourning his passing she went back to her desk sat her fat butt down and continued to stuff her face, calling her 2 nasty looking little dogs over and fed them scraps all right there in the room with us and our dead dog.  Never use this clinic!  They do not care about your pet nor your feelings!  They only want your money!  Please find another ER!  There are several in the Birmingham area!

name: Bham Bio
text: Took our puppy here around 11:30pm the women that work the front desk were very sweet and understanding, it didn’t take long to get back and see the Doctor which was nice, He was very explanatory and took very good care of our dog and let us know step by step what they were doing and how to continue treatment. All in all it was a very nice experience.

name: Amanda Denaburg
text: Thank you for your sensitivity, your kindness, and your professionalism this evening. Your team made one of the worst experiences as bearable as possible. Your compassion made a real difference.

name: S. Crawford
text:
Terrible experience. I regret ever coming here. The lack of empathy and/or compassion is embarrassingly evident and I feel ashamed for leaving my sweet cat here to suffer overnight. Not only did she end up having to be euthanized the next morning at her regular veterinarian, she suffered for almost 12 hours overnight in organ failure and it was never mentioned to me that there was a simple blood test to check for ethelyne glycol in her blood (common cause of poisoning in cats and she had been stuck in the garage inadvertently). I paid a significant amount of money for “intensive care” so she should have been offered the diagnostic test that could have ended her suffering if I would have known. The doctor specifically discussed with me the possibility of our cat ingesting a toxin, but failed to offer this simple but easy way to determine that. Even if there is a slight chance that they do not perform this simple 20 minute test, it should have been mentioned. By the time we discovered the truth, the window of time to take interventions had passed. My pet was offered no chance at survival. Although I do not blame this establishment for the original cause of our misfortune, they caused undue suffering and prolonged an extremely painful death. My heart is heavy for those who bring their pets here and have to deal with the indifference and lack of overall concern for not only the pet and their suffering, but the emotional trauma and heaviness of watching a pet struggle in pain. The ONLY thing I am grateful for is that my cat had a peaceful death in the comfort of the office of our vet instead of here. If I would have had been faced with the choice to euthanize my baby here, I would never have forgiven myself. The front desk staff was kind and understanding as I sat and sobbed with my animal who is now no longer with us. Four days before Christmas, I am left with only a huge dent in my bank account, a few tufts of her fur, and an empty pet carrier. Although this review might seem emotionally motivated, a little compassion goes a long way guys. You may have all of the surgical skills in the world, but if you don’t love animals- find another career.
Please- GO ANYWHERE ELSE BUT HERE.

name: Jordan Virciglio
text: The women that work the night shift here were so so so spectacular, they saved my poor kitties life; after a tragic accidental switch of dog and cat feal medication. The staff, doctor, front desk women, nurses... All of them were outstandingly kind and sweet!! I can't even thank them enough for their support and swift action!! The front desk women even help me calm down from my histarical state. This place is truly a blessing and I am beyond grateful!!!

name: Leanna McCann
text: Came here when we first got our puppy with an emergency. It was fantastic service, great vet. We are back again, believing she may have ingested some roach poison. I am writing this from the waiting room.  The vet told us to call Pet Poison Control, and that she would come back in and take our case number. It alarmed us that she did not have the knowledge to tell us, instead we had to call someone else and pay a fee. It is now been 3 hours since that call, and nobody has seen us. Very, very disappointed in this clinic, will NOT be back.

name: Merin Graves
text: Our Great Dane had a leg laceration requiring stitches. We call for an idea of the office visit cost and we are told $92 plus the cost of stitches. Meanwhile it's several hours later, the dog still isn't stitched up, and suddenly it's going to be at least $500. I called and was lied to. "Oh your dog is being stitched up now" by the girl answering the phone. Hours later, she hasn't been touched yet. No explanation; just rudeness and incompetence.  A total rip off with terrible communication. We will not be back again. You are an embarrassment to veterinary medicine & total crooks. Birmingham folks there are other options for urgent vet care. I say go elsewhere!!

name: Monika Singletary
text: Everyone here was absolutely wonderful with our doggie! She was well cared for no matter what. I would recommend this vet to anyone.

name: Michelle Clark
text: Last night our 3 year old dog died suddenly on the way to this clinic. We pull up, both squalling our eyes out. The vet techs take us in and I vaguely recall them being somewhat comforting, and asking if we need a minute. So we walk outside, try to compose ourselves and go back into the front lobby area. The receptionist (who I distinctly remember being back there with us when we arrived) started asking us our dogs weight, medical history, etc. I finally said "what does it matter, she's gone!! It's too late" and the lady said "oh she dead? I mean, she passed?" Completely unsympathetic tone. She was rude about wanting a copy of our license, neither of us had it on us. We finally were like "what do you need from us. We just want to go home" she came back to say "it's going to be awhile they have to put it all in the computer before I can register it" We asked her to just tell them to speed up whatever they needed to process a dog that had died before we even arrived. The dog was given no medical treatment from the clinic besides checking for a pulse. Finally, we paid $60 to leave our dog there because we couldn't bare to take her home. As we are leaving the receptionist told us to "have a good night." I almost lost it. Both of us were clearly beside ourselves the entire time we were there, crying, devastated and were given virtually no guidance on what we should do or even just a sympathetic tone. It was awful.

name: Sabarika sin Apellido
text:
Brought my dog in when she was bitten by a venomous snake on a Sunday afternoon  They were quick to see her and had several treatment options available.  They warned me up-front that the antivenin was on back order and if my dog needed further treatment they could offer plasma transfusions.  The initial quote was $730 and if plasma was needed it would be $1400. Thankfully the next morning she was much improved, having received fluids, antibiotics, and pain medication through the night - she did not need plasma so the $730 I paid the previous day covered the entire visit.  They left a catheter in and I was to take her as soon as possible to a regular clinic for follow-up treatment which I did (the subsequent 2 visits did total me at $1400 in the end but who puts a price on the love for your pet?).
It really hurt my wallet and was a good 30+ minute drive from where I was living but the building itself was easy to see and in a nice location.  Nice staff if a bit unfriendly. They made me fully aware of all the costs that could be incurred before I was to sign any paperwork and payment did have to be up front.  They explained the treatments and assured me of my dog's chances of survival as I had never experienced a venomous snake bite on a dog (copperhead we think).  I'm satisfied, my dog was treated quickly and well and I paid what I had to, I don't expect an ER clinic to come cheap.

name: Grace Manasco
text: Dr. Ballegos is a miracle worker!  I came home from work and my dog Harry was not using his back legs at all... I took him to my vet and they advised me to put him down.  I said that I wasn't going to do that so they referred me to Dr. B who performed back surgery on Harry that same day, and after rest and recovery and exercise, Harry can run with the pack again!  I have a cat who has back leg issues now, and Dr B has given me every option to help her, not just "put her down, quality of life, blah blah blah" like my original vet.  Prices are steep but surgery is what it is, and I have an emergency credit card so it's all good.  After all, my critters are my family, and I wouldn't put down grandma because she couldn't walk, citing "quality of life"!

name: Kellye Blankenship Copas
text: Took my large mix dog, Abbey, because she was just acting like she didn't feel well one weekend. I probably could have waited to go to my vet Monday, but when my dogs hurt, to me it's like when a baby hurts. You don't know and they can't tell you what's wrong. She had pancreatitis. An easy fix. They were crowded that night but we still had great care. I see terrible remarks on here complaining about the cost. It's medical care. What do you people expect? Would you complain about the cost to treat any other family member? Your comments say a lot about the kind of pet owner you are.

name: Jourdan Pocopanni
text: Took my dog after finding a fully engorged tick on her. She was dealing with tick paralysis and basically had no use of her back legs. I got the tick out and took her here and the doctors took care of her immediately. Once in the exam room the doctors came to assure me that she was going to be fine and explained to me how they were treating her. I couldn't have been more pleased with their care. Prices are pretty standard for an emergency vet. But do realize, this is an emergency room so prices will probably be a little higher than your vet. I would definitely recommend if you find yourself in the unfortunate situation of taking your pet to the ER.

name: Min Sun Lee
text:
My dog was having a fever and wasn't eating for few days, so I brought her in. I spend 4 hours. The assistant at the front desk were not friendly and not helpful. They told me to call my local vet to send them the information about my dog 10mins of closing time. Instead, of them calling my local vet themselves.

I saw three vet techs, they didn't introduce themselves at all and they all gave different answers. I finally got to see Dr. Shuessler. I was very unsatisfied with her service. She was confused, inadequate, irritated, tired and no empathy toward my dog! She rushed me into paying for the service without explaining why and would not treat my dog without paying. They charged me least $1000 for the services, which I was not satisfied. I was expecting my dog to get better instead she's not. I asked for refund or negotiate the fee since they didn't provided proper services. They refused to work with me.

I had to take my dog back to my local vet to get a correct diagnosis, explanation, and services. Overall, this place didn't provide the service I expected to get.

name: Tanner Brown
text: I’m usually not one to do this, but I feel like people thinking about going to this vet need to know. We took my 10 year old female dachshund here immediately after I noticed she had been bleeding a lot, clotty blood. Everyone that worked there had the personality of a rock, but that’s beside the point. They got us back to our room very quickly. The vet diagnosed my dog with impacted anal glands. She said you can pay 180 dollars for blood work to make sure that I am right or we can just treat her for what I think it is. She said I am 90 percent sure that this is what it is. So of course, since the vet didn’t seem worried about it, we weren’t worried. They gave my dog a shot and sent her home with an antibiotic. Said everything should go back to normal in a few days. Seemed like they were just trying to get us in and get us out as quickly as possible. The next morning, my dog still wouldn’t eat, move, lay down, etc. She wouldn’t do anything. She had bled a lot during the night, but we weren’t that worried because the doctor at the emergency clinic told us everything would go back to normal that this was very common in dogs. We take her to our normal vet just to be sure, and immediately our normal vet says that she has gastrointestinal colitis. He says that this is very serious and my dog needs to be treated immediately. She stays over night at and ends up passing away in the early morning. Maybe it was inevitable that my dog passed away, but I can’t help to believe that if we could have gotten a correct diagnosis from the emergency vet, we might could have gotten her better. Bad customer service. If it is an emergency, I suggest going somewhere else.

name: John Glenn
text: Had to put our 5 year old great dane down because of outrageous charge of keeping him until morning to at least get a second opinion,.As much money as they charge they should have facilities to accommodate a large dog. We had to leave him dead in the floor when we left.Another large dog was just laying in the floor also.The staff was nice and compassionate so they get the one star..

name: A Robin
text: Excellent medical knowledge and skill.  Now that they've closed, I am concerned about where I will bring them if they need emergency care in the future.

name: Donna McGee
text: I took my 16 year old dachshund to Emergency Animal Medical Center at 12:30 this morning.  She had a large amount of fluid around her heart and an extreme difficult time breathing.  Dr. Schuessler and her assistant were the most kind, professional individuals that I have ever encountered in these kind of circumstances.  I ended up having to have my Sassy put to sleep and it was devastating.  However, with the circle of comfort that these employees exhibited, it helped make the heartbreak bearable.   This clinic is top notch.

name: Kat A
text: While outside for a last potty before bed our dog spotted a cat and got loose trying to get to the cat and was hit by a car. When we arrived at the surprisingly crowded emergency vet we were worried we would have to wait but a tech came immediately to help. Soon after the vet came came out and updated us on our dogs condition and the plan for her care. He kept us informed the whole time she was there and while it didn't take away our worry it was still a huge comfort. As others have mentioned the bill was high but when your dog gets hit by a car on Saturday night and is suffering and in pain....

name: Ben Williams
text:
Tried to charge $1,000 for a one night stay. I complained and they immediately dropped the price by $370. Very suspicious con-like activity is going on in this establishment. Extremely expensive! DO NOT GO HERE!

There is extreme disorganization occurring among the staff. I was left in an exam room for almost an hour and was completely forgotten about until I went outside to the receptionist. There's no telling how my poor dog was treated.

When I came to pick up my dog, they forgot about her in the back. It took around 30 minutes of waiting until I finally asked a nurse about my dog.

Also, they tried to charge me extra when I picked up my dog! I refused payment and they couldn't do anything about it since I did not agree to additional fees. Yes, they tried to charge me more than the $600+ dollars I had already paid. Scam artists!

My dog is now in the Galleria Vet clinic and I will NEVER take her back to this establishment.

name: Lauren Mclaughlin
text:
I was very pleased with the treatment my dog and I recieved! My dog was unfortunatley attacked by another dog and my regular vet was already closed. They were able to see my dog quickly. I was of course a "basket case" and Dr. Edwards was very personable and reassuring. She let me know that my dog was going to be okay.

I am very thankful for the Emergency Clinic!! My dog is back to her "old self" and doing great!! I hope we never have another emergency, but if we do, I will not hesitate to go back!!

name: Melinda Ledford
text: A week ago, we had to make the heartrenching decision to put our 13 year old English Mastiff to sleep. From the moment I walked in the door, I felt comfortable. The lady at the front desk was compassionate and asked minimal questions. She asked delicately if we would like to take our baby home and discussed our other options. They then came and helped Chloe get out of the car and started her IV. They brought her in a room with us and told us to let us know when we were ready. The vet came in and got down on the floor with us. He explained what each medicine was and how Chloe might respond. He then loved on Chloe with us for awhile. Afterwards, they allowed us to stay in the room with her and then helped us back to the car with her. They even called the next day to check on us. They made such a hard moment in our life seem a little more bearable.

name: Savannah williams
text:
Wish I could give this place 0 stars instead of one.
This place is awful!! Had an emergency dog needing immediate attention, and we sat in waiting area for 30 minutes waiting to see vet, then talks to us for 15 minutes about prices and plans of care.. Stays gone another 15 minutes and we finally see him and we agree to do whatever to save our dog, and then he preceeds to tell us they have not started blood work within this hour we have been here and it will be another hour or two before it was started..
within 5 minutes of walking out the room our dog went into a grand mal seizure, and as MY RIGHT i asked to see this because he has never done this, and because i wanted to see it he talked to us like we were so useless and then precced to tell us he refuses to care for our dog anymore.
IF YOU CARE ABOUT YOUR ANIMAL PLEASE DO NOT GO HERE!!!!!!

name: Rebekah Rogers
text:
I called them to ask a few questions about my cat who was running a high fever and hadn’t eaten or drank for a couple of days. I had just taken her temperature and asked the man on the other end of the phone if a temperature of 103 is considered an emergency or if I should wait until morning.

He was completely incompetent. He kept saying “well that’s definitely a fever” like YES. I KNOW. All I wanted to know was whether or not it should be considered an emergency. I had to pry information out of him and finally was quoted $300 just to do bloodwork on her.

Needless to say I was completely dissatisfied with the service. Unprofessional, no manners, incompetent, and way overpriced. Went to my regular vet and paid $250 for bloodwork, flea & tick medicine, antibiotics, subcutaneous fluids, AND a B12 shot.

There are too many emergency clinics in Birmingham to trust this one with the care of your furry family member.

name: Stefanie McKerley
text: Our dog and family had a wonderful surgery experience with Dr. Dismukes.

name: Otis Smith
text:
Took our boxer in for possible foreign object in her pad was seen by three individuals: One taking vitals ,one presented as a vet ,and one attempting to medicate.
The individual claiming to be a vet is listed on the clinic's registrar; first name on the left top, attempted to squeeze and dig out what was described as "nothing that could be seen"  with her fingernails without the use of any magnifying instrument, had to provide the flashlight on my phone to allow for proper lighting, did nothing but increase the discomfort level to the point of our dog  crying in pain.  Only retrieved a magnifying instrument upon my request.  Appeared and  acted as though she had been awakened from a slumber,  and was far too irritated to provide for any animal but herself.  Wanted to administer a shot of Benadryl but had no diagnosis or reason for doing so Was provided absolutely no medical care for my animal, truly a money generating corporate enterprise for the (40 vets who hide behind the liability protection of limited partnerships within their corporate cover)
no compassion, care or the pretense of any type of professionalism  extended
DO NOT EVER under even the most extreme circumstances  consider this facility as an option for medical treatment for your animals in the Birmingham area
This appears to be a façade masquerading as an emergency medical clinic designed to pray on the emotions of individuals who have compassion and care for their pets

name: amy ianniello
text: AVOID THIS PLACE!!  If u don’t care about ur pets health and life then this is the place to take them bc evidentially this  group of insensitive and unprofessional ppl do not either. My daughter took her heeler pup there a few nights ago and the treatment her and her pup received was extremely disturbing. I would never recommend anyone to take their pet to this facilty. These ppl are not concerned about ur pets health or wellbeing they are only concerned with how much $ they can withdrawal from ur bank account.
