text: We just switched from Calera Animal Hospital over to Pelham Animal Clinic and I have to say that the experience and quality is incredibly different between the two places. Calera never kept our animals records on file. We felt as though we had to reintroduce our pets every time we came in. We found out that our cat had a heart murmur once we took him to Pelham. It is a level 5 which means that he could have major issues if he were to go under anesthesia for surgery. Calera never caught this in the time that we were with them ( should have been found during a typical check up with a stethoscope). They also spelled our pets names wrong all the time. I will say, that when we got our cat fixed back in 2016, they were very kind as to call us after her surgery and keep in contact through her recovery. Staff was friendly for the most part, but we definitely did not feel close to our vet while there.

resp.text: We are sorry for your experience and we hope we can be better the next time you come in.

text: Brought my dog here for her excessive coughing, hoping it wasn't heart worm. My pet was given acupuncture therapy, chiropractic care and natural supplements to help get her through the transition. Her symptoms went away by 80% in the first week! She is doing much better and I will continue to bring my pup in as needed.

text: We were very impressed with Nall Daniels and with Dr. Clark in particular. They got us in right away and were very courteous. text: I would never trust anyone with my fur babies but Doctor Daniel's and his wonderful assistant Brandon they are the best.

name: Jennifer van Arcken
text: I can't say enough positive things about Dr. Emily Soto, who we totally credit for saving little Otter's life. After taking Otter to multiple vets when he was ill and not getting better, a friend recommended Nall Daniels. Dr. Soto accomplished emergency surgery on a Saturday that saved his life. She was very concerned not only as a vet but sincere concern for his well being. She provided very clear instructions on how to care for him during the critical days following surgery. She called and checked on him daily.  He is doing great now! Thank you!

name: Douglas Beckham
text:
My wife and I are new to the high powered world of the  “working breed” of German Shepherds.  We recently purchased one, Ramos, from  Germany.  After about  6 weeks here,  he developed a case of bloat that could have killed him.  With bloat, the stomach actually "flips over" and cuts the blood supply off to the stomach, causing a rapid distension, and death if not treated quickly.  Fortunately, Ramos' stomach flipped back without emergency surgery.

Not wanting to go through this again, we researched bloat and found the best “cure” for it is a laparoscopic assisted gastropexy.  In this procedure the dog's stomach is sutured to the abdominal wall. The sutures eventually dissolve but the stomach is held permanently in place by an "adhesion" preventing recurrent "flipping".  Many animal hospitals do not have a laparoscope or the skill to accomplish this procedure.  Dr. Daniels was able to take care of this surgery and Ramos is 99% normal after five days. He has personally checked on Ramos 4 times on his own time since surgery.

Everything about Drs. Daniels and Clark, and their clinic and team  was strictly professional, yet courteous and friendly.  We can't forget Cassidy, the glue and the center of their clinic.  Exceptional personality and warmth!

If you are looking for a superior team to take care of your special “family member”, consider Dr. Daniels and Clark at Nall Daniels Animal Hospital in Homewood.

Not close enough for you? As Joe Biden would say, "Come on man!!"
This is not about closeness!!
It’s about quality !!!!!!!!!

Douglas Beckham, D.M.D.

name: Emma Pacey
text:
When I adopted my dog, the one thing the previous owner recommended is for us to take him to this office since he had been bringing him here his whole life and they "knew him really well". The first time I took him for his annual shots and a check up I asked about the small lumps on his body and they said it was nothing. 6 months ago I took him to this office to get a check up because we had some concerns. After paying hundreds of dollars for tests and x-rays, they assured me that there was nothing usual going on with my dog. This week he started getting very sick, and after a trip to a different vet, we found out he had cancer and it was very prolonged and caused other problems like anemia, kidney failure and lesions on his lungs. This kind of progression doesn't happen in 6 months. It happens over years. He had been coming here for years and they never once said anything about the cancer that was all over my dog's body and covering his organs. At this point, he was in too much pain, couldn't eat or drink, and could hardly breathe. The new vet and I decided it was best to put him down so he wouldn't be hurting anymore. After years of coming to the same office they never said anything remotely close to cancer.

There is nothing I can do for my dog anymore, but there is still something you can do for your's. DO NOT bring your animals to this office. There is no way a cancer this severe goes unnoticed for so long with an office that provides quality care. Find somewhere to take your pets that won't treat them like they treated my dog. I hope this doesn't happen to anyone else.

name: Quentin Collins
text: Always super friendly staff! Prices are comparable. Dr. Clark is awesome! Highly recommended.

name: Della Clark
text: Amazing staff. Only place I'd go.

name: Ryan Halcomb
text: My dog was referred here by my primary vet for a laparoscopic liver biopsy. The staff at Nall-Daniels was outstanding. They kept me updated on every step of the process and laid out a clear plan for the next steps. I was nervous at first taking my pet for a surgery at a place I have never been, but as soon as I started talking to the staff I knew my dog was in good hands. I would definitely recommend this place!

name: Lizzy Dee
text: They were so attentive and helpful. I got my cat groomed and a collar for her to wear when given medicine and they have kept up with us.

name: Jody Poe
text: Nall Daniels Animal Hospital is great! My little dog "Molly" was so well cared for there right up until the very end. She had to be euthanized on December 22nd, and everyone at Nall Daniels was so sweet through all of this. After Molly died, I got the sweetest cards from Dr. Daniels and Dr. Dunaway as well as from other staff. They even had a beautiful plant delivered to my home in memory of Molly. Molly always got excellent medical care at Nall Daniels, and they will definitely be my vets for my new little rescue dog that I adopted. I highly recommend Nall Daniels Animal Hospital.

text: They are awesome people! I have been taking my Pookie dog there for about three years.

name: Leigh Misso
text: Last week my little 10lb Dachshund was bit by  a copper head twice in our yard and Nall Daniels was WONDERFUL. They immediately took him back, got an IV started to counteract the effects of the venom, and monitored him very closely. Thru lots of prayer and the amazing Veterinarians at Nall Daniels, Gus was completely healed in 24 hours!  I would recommend everyone take their pets to them!

name: wendy roberts
text: I rated this place 5 stars at first. They did surgery on my daughter's dog. He ended up dead. They kept telling her he was OK over the phone. She called THREE times. They had 3 chances to say bring him in.

name: Tom Atkins
text:
In the year or so I’ve used Nall-Daniels I found them to be competent veterinarians, but based on exam costs I had begun to wonder if their prices were high.

So when it was time to have my pug spayed, I decided to get quotes from two of the highest rated vets in Homewood. The prices I was quoted by them were very close to each other... $250 and $260.  I then called Nall-Daniels for a quote. I was very surprised to hear an amazing price of $823. When they heard me gasp over the phone they quickly added that this was a worse case estimate.  I quickly thanked them for the estimate and moved my vet account for my 3 dogs to one of the two highly rated vets that gave me more reasonable estimates.

I wondered later what was included in a worst case scenario! A Heart transplant?

name: Nicole Harris
text: The staff was very nice and professional they gladly answered every little question i had

name: Kirk Atkinson
text: I've had four dogs cared for at Nall Daniels - they do an amazing job. Very friendly and knowledgeable techs, the vets keep our dogs in peak health and boarding is very convenient and economical.

name: Corin Thompson
text:
Nall Daniels has always been good to us. I've always been wary of local vets because they all have terrible reviews and it makes a lot of places look sketch. They have been willing and able to give us quotes for treatments so that we can make the best decisions for our cats based on our income.

Our cat Bubbles was diagnosed with bone cancer. The vet did everything she could to get the right diagnosis and give us as many options as available. They could not treat her there but she offered info for treatment elsewhere. We really felt that everything had been done that could be done. I definitely recommend this place 100%

name: Lorraine Donald
text: The dog referred to by Ms. Phillips was a dog that was given up to Adopt A Golden Birmingham with a sense of urgency.   Upon arrival to the clinic the dog had to be carried in and was recumbent the whole time and clearly in medical distress.   The blood panel showed that the dog was in end stage renal failure and to complicate matters was Heart Worm positive.  The medical team at Nall Daniels immediately relayed to Adopt A Golden Bham their findings and indicated that the dog was indeed suffering.  It was their medical opinion that the dog should be euthanized.  Neither Adopt A Golden Birmingham nor Nall Daniels Animal Hospital medical team take these decisions lightly.   We are in the business of rescuing and saving dogs.  Not making this decision and watching the dog suffer was simply not an option, as much as it devastates all of us involved to terminate the life of any of our dogs.   We have the utmost respect for Dr. Daniels and his medical team and are proud to be associated with their clinic and the "above the call of duty care" they give to all the rescue dogs that they have treated for us and will continue to treat.   We are all saddened by this.  Lorraine Donald Founder, Adopt A Golden Birmingham

name: Andy West
text: Nall Daniels has the most knowledgeable staff that we have seen in Birmingham. They are also the most caring group of people you will find and will put the needs of your pet first.

name: April L. Butler
text: Great service and techs that seem passionate about the animals, our pup seemed happy to go and not anxious when we picked up, as she has at other facilities.  Although they are a bit pricier than others, it is worth it for piece of mind.

name: Erin Laney
text: Wonderful Dr and staff all the way around!

name: Susan mcgriff
text: The girls in front are so sweet.. I use Dr Daniels is a very good person,surgeon..

name: Jean Lindquist
text: The service I received at Nall-Daniel Pet Hospital far exceeded my expectations! Nall-Daniel’s provides a variety of veterinary services including well pet check ups, grooming, surgery, and prescriptions. We went there for our yearly check up and vaccinations for our two dogs; a senior Golden Retriever, and a six year old mutt. The entrance was very clean and clam. When we got called back, we were in a decent sized examination room with a vet tech, I can’t remember his name, but he was a very kind and patient young man with brown hair. He was very thorough with us; he listened to and answered all of our questions. He even provided us with a printed out quote of what all the shots, the visit, and the treatment for the ear infection that our Golden had, before performing any procedures. Then, Dr. Dunaway came in to examine them. She immediately got down in the floor and started loving on the boys. You could see her passion for animal care when she came in the room. She was very articulate and detail oriented, laying out all of the treatment options for the ear infection and recommending medication for his arthritis, too. Her bedside manner was impeccable and I felt listened to and informed as she explained everything that she was doing. We never felt rushed, even as it got near closing time. All in all, it was a wonderful experience. I had called fifteen clinic before choosing this one. The reason I chose them in the first place was because they were one of the most affordable. Sometimes, affordability comes at the expense of the quality of care, but not here. I could tell they genuinely cared about the well being of our animals, and I think that we have found a lifelong vet! I can not recommend them enough!

name: Shocklemzoa
text: My little doggie got scratched in her eye by one of our cats. When I got home her eye was puffy and irritated. I immediately too her to Nall Daniels Animal Hospital. There was a major down pour of rain as I pulled in. As I walked in I was warmly greeted and told them what happened. Within a couple of minutes they were looking at my dogs eye and found a little scratch. They gave her some medicine for pain and put some other medicine in there to make sure there wouldn't be an infection. I could see my little precious was already starting to feel better. This is a wonderful place to take your pets. They treated my little doggie like she was one of their own. They even wiped her down with towels to get the rain off as she was shivering a little. Great service. Highly recommended. Thanks NDAH!

name: Keri Cartee
text:
Last week I had to make the difficult decision to put my sweet dog of 15 years to sleep.  I had recently made Nall Daniels my vet and had only needed to bring my dog in a few times before she died.  Although the prices are not low (comparable to other vets, but all are high these days it seems!) the care she received was excellent, the staff was very friendly, and every time I brought her in I received calls to check on her in a day or two.  When I brought her in a week ago, I knew it was probably going to be time to put her down.  She was suffering and could no longer walk.  The staff at Nalls Daniel couldn't have been more kind, caring, gentle, thoughtful, and patient with me and my family.  They made the process as personal and easy as it could be made.  They took good care of my dog and of me until the end.  They were respectful of me and my wishes during this heartbreaking time.
Today I returned from a luncheon to find beautiful flowers waiting on my porch in memory of Mini from the staff at Nalls Daniel.  I am overwhelmed at their kindness.  Thank you, Nalls Daniel, for caring for my sweet furry friend... and for caring for my heart today as I've been missing her so much.  <3

text: Love VIP! They are willing and able to answer your questions whenever you call!! They've been a lifesaver for me and my older kitty!! Highly reccomend!!!

name: John Graham
text:
We just used VIP Mobile Clinic for our two dogs. Going to the vet is a lot of work with two dogs. Scheduling the appointment, taking time off from work, driving there, dealing with the other animals in the waiting room. If this is your idea of fun, VIP Mobile Clinic probably isn't for you. For the other 99.9999% of us, I can't recommend Dr. Darcie enough. It isn't just the convenience of coming to your home for your pet but she is so good with the pets. My dogs were very comfortable with her, she was very sweet to our dogs (even gave them some of her lunch to keep them calm).

If you think you can't afford a mobile clinic, think again. It cost us no more, actually a bit less, than going to our regular veterinarian.

I asked her lots of questions and she can do tests, checkups, surgery, essentially - full vet service.

Thank you again VIP Mobile Clinic for offering a great service!

text: They are very loving and compassionate people.  This is a great service to our community.

name: M. G.
text: When you look for someone to be compassionate at such a personal and emotional level, you want comfort.  I'm in the process of helping a friend find a mobile vet to ease the transition for her very sick dog.  Unfortunately, she is unable to physically lift her guy to get to the vet.  She reached out to VIP vet and asked if there was any way they could assist on the weekend, and the reply was anything but courteous.  Again, this is a difficult decision to begin with and while I realize email can be impersonal, someone offering these services should be MORE caring and compassionate when delivering messages.  Based on this interaction, we won't be using her services.  You want to feel comfortable and cared for in times like this and they didn't succeed.

resp.text: I'm so sorry you felt like our e-mail was not courteous or compassionate. We strive to be all those things any any communication we have, whether it be phone or e-mail. Could you provide more information on the e-mail? We only had 1 person e-mail us this weekend inquiring about a weekend visit and we booked the appointment for today. Feel free to call us or e-mail us directly.

name: Breann Mellon
text:
Dr. Lydia is hands down the most amazing Veterinarian I have ever had the pleasure of meeting. Her kind, compassionate, and thorough home visit for our 15 year old Shepherd/Collie mix Molly during her final day was so peaceful and respectful. There was no better way to have said goodbye to our girl than in her favorite spot in our backyard with all our love surrounding her.
Thank you again Dr. Lydia, you are a beautiful soul!

resp.text: Oh Ms. Breann. Thank you so much for your kind words. I was honored to help your family, and glad that I was able to make it at least a little more bearable to say goodbye. Molly was obviously a very big part of your family, and you have my deepest condolences. I also hope you had a safe trip home.

name: Lillian-Lotus Buccola
text:
Dr. Sullivan has a voice that can sooth even the most stressed human and animal.  Her entire level of professionalism and kindness was not only a welcomed factor, but one I have to say delivered a new wave of calm and love as we sent my service dog and best friend of 13 years on to the next realm.
From explaining in depth from how the process works to how our baby would be handled with his cremation was relaxed and heartfelt.  We were given an imprint of his paw which will be kept on our bookcase with his picture everyday forward.  I cannot recommend Dr. Sullivan enough to anyone who has to unexpectedly [or expectedly] put their furbaby down.
Truly. We thank Dr. Sullivan for her amazing work and the kindness she showed during the entire event.

resp.text: Thank you so much Ms. Lotus. It was my honor and privilege to be a part of such a intimate and beautiful event, sorrowful though it was. I appreciate your kindness, and am heartened that I was able to help make it at least a little more bearable.

name: Angeline Daigle
text: It was a last minute request , but Dr. Sullivan was there for us on our darkest and saddest day. She not only kept Frankie calm but my husband and I as well. We are forever grateful for her service, professionalism, kindness  and compassion.  I highly recommend her.

resp.text: Thank you, Angela. While still a heartbreaking experience, I am glad I was able to help make it least a little more positive. It was obvious Frankie was truly a piece of your hearts, and his loss is immeasurable. I do hope in time you are able to find some comfort.

name: Joshua Carter
text: I just had our first visit from Lydia. She was very informative and gave me a lot to think about. It’s hard to make decisions about your loved one and someone like Lydia can add structure to the decision and help you come up with a plan. She can help make your dog feel better but also make you feel better. I wanted to have her come by and meet my 15-year-old English Springer spaniel ahead of the decision to have a goodbye visit.I highly recommend Dr. Lydia

resp.text: Thank you so much, Joshua. I really enjoyed meeting you and Ollie. I greatly appreciate you allowing me to assist you and Ollie during this very personal and sometimes uncertain time.

name: nani nunu
text: My wonderful older dog was failing and had multiple health Issues.  Dr. Lydia was open, knowledgeable, and compassionate.  We came up with an end of life plan that served us all.  From A-Z, Dr. Lydia was our Angel.  I highly recommend her.

resp.text: Thank you so much! It is truly my honor and privilege. I am deeply appreciative of your trust and faith in me during such an uncertain and difficult time.

name: Brittany Pickens
text: Dr. Lydia is incredible with my senior dog. She is warm, kind and SO thorough.  We are thankful for her help.

resp.text: Thank you so much, Brittany! It's my pleasure and my honor to work with you and your sweet baby!

name: Lee Nocella
text: I took my dog there for a check up and everyone was great.  We had a nice time.  The vet was knowledgeable and the assistant was helpful and we all got along swimmingly.

resp.text: Thank you for your kind words and we look forward to your visit next time.    -Dr. Tucker

name: Moriah Iverson
text: Dr. Rutter is amazing. I met her at a previous location and went back to her after she came to Hoke. Candi at the front desk is also great to work with and always kind. Dr.Rutter is compassionate and smart. She is always willing to discuss options w me and next steps. She has helped me through kidney failure and the passing of my precious dog. Guided me through the elder years or my cat. Who by the way hates most people but likes her! Also love my newest dog since the first day I brought her in at 13 weeks old with have a swollen face from being stung, through all her medical and surgeries to the 4 years old she will be in a few months. I dont know what I would do without her guidance with my most wonderful parts of my days, my animals.

resp.text: Thank you Moriah!  Dr. Rutter does such a great job for us and we appreciate your kind words.  -Dr. Tucker

text: The complete staff were more than professional,  and understanding. The vet listened to my concerns,  gave precise instructions, and they also called several days later for a follow up.

resp.text: Steven, it is always good to hear positive feedback from clients like yourself. Thank you!  -Dr. Tucker

text: The staff was sweet and they truly care about the animals.  Plus Dr. Tucker was super knowledgeable and gave great insight.

resp.text: Thank you!  We really appreciate your positive feedback.

text: They are just amazing with all my animals ❤️😍 love them there so sweet and helpful

resp.text: We appreciate you!  Thank you for the kind words.

name: Taylor Land
text: I’ve been taking my dos here for about 7 years now. The staff and Doctor are TOP NOTCH!

resp.text: Thank you so much for the compliment!  We hope Molly and Oakley are doing well.    -Dr. Tucker

name: Lila Simmons
text: i first started coming to hoke in the 1980s (when dr hoke himself was the only one running the place) as a little girl with my dad with our rescue dogs. thirty five years later i still bring my pets (dogs and cats) to hoke. they have my utmost trust and confidence in their knowledge expertise and compassion for my pets. they also have a down home approach that reminds me of my dad who always chose places of business for their function and practicality (and who knew what they were doing) over pricier options with lots of fan fare or excess. hoke keeps things simple, but the staff, in their knowledge and care of families and their pets, is not; they go above and beyond. my pets and i are treated like family.

resp.text:
Lila,
Thank you so much for your kind words.  Your pet's health and happiness are our number one priority! We look forward to seeing you for years to come!
Dr. Alex Giambrone

name: Nicholas Anderson
text: Boarded our dog here while we were out of town for almost 2 weeks. They treated him like he was their own, the price was reasonable, one of the cheapest around, and our dog almost seemed like he didn't want to leave. They give two walks per day and you can pay like an extra dollar per day for an additional walk per day. And they got him up to date on his rabies shot while he was there. Will definitely use again.

name: Sherry Sanders
text: Dr. Davies is so accommodating. Takes special care with the animals and their owners. The staff is friendly and knowledgeable as well. Cost is also reasonable.

resp.text: Sherry, thank you for your kind and supportive comments.  We are glad we could serve you.   -Dr. Tucker

name: Renee Daily
text: Great service and great prices! They all seemed very knowledgeable, were able to answer all my questions. And they were excellent with my dog. Also I have to say, they are to notch with customer service. Thank you Monya, for dealing with me. I would recommend this animal clinic to everyone!!

name: Dootsie Williams
text: We recently had a put our dog Sandy to sleep. And Dr. G (The female )  could not have been more sweet sitting with me for such a long time. It took longer than usual , and when I told her she could go see her other patients that  she didn’t have sit with me , she told me ,” Nothing is more important than this .”  Our dog absolutely loved going to the vet. She couldn’t get out of the car fast enough and loved going up the ramp and pushing the door open. I think that says a lot that a dog loves the vet .  I love how they constantly are giving them treats, would get on the floor to see my elderly dog instead of making her get on the table every time .  The ladies at the front desk when they handed me her remains, treated them with respect and concern not just like a box they treated it as something special which it was . I appreciate everyone there for being so sweet to Sandi and me and especially Dr Alex Giambrone for that last day . and calling me on a Sunday to give me bad results on lab work .

name: Will Somerville
text:
This veterinarian is happy to take your money, but he doesn't give a damn about the animals under his care.

My wife took our black lab into the Hoke Animal Clinic with a fever and bleeding sores.  They had difficulty diagnosing him and his condition worsened.  He had three visits over a week, and his condition continued to deteriorate.  The first visit he was limping somewhat, and had a fever of 104.  By the last visit, a week later, he couldn't walk and the vet's employees had to carry him in.

$1400 later, they diagnosed him with blastomycosis, a fungal infection.  My wife asked if we should take him to Auburn, and they sad no.  At no point did they suggest that his condition was dire; had they done so, we would have done virtually anything to save this sweet family pet.

This morning we found our dog dead on my bedroom floor.  The dog clearly had been in agony, but we were led to believe that his condition would improve after he began his medication.  Obviously we wish we had taken him to Auburn, but my wife was told it was unnecessary.

This veterinarian may be good at administering vaccinations and clipping toenails, but if your pet has a serious condition, stay the heck away.

resp.text: Will, we certainly sympathize with the loss of your pet.  Blastomycosis  can be a challenge to diagnose and treat, even in the healthiest of dogs.  Our thoughts and prayers  go out to you and your family.   Please feel free to call us at any time if it would help to talk further about your case.    -Dr. Tucker

name: Brittany Kujan
text: Best vet clinic around! I’m always greeted with a big smile from Monya and Angela! They have very smart doctors that know what they are talking about! Highly recommend this place (:

name: Dean Donovan
text: Spoke with a woman named Monya. Was asking for prices regarding my elderly mother's two cats for vaccinations, cleaning, and treatment for ear mites. Not only did she rudely tell me she didn't have any idea how much it would cost for the treatments I inquired about but she also got an attitude when I mentioned another vet quoted an exact price for the exact services (not to mention they are $100 cheaper). She also tried to use scare tactics saying her two cats would be picked up and "taken for forever" when I said they had not had their shots. It's fine if you don't want customers, but if you do, I'd suggest having someone answer your phones that doesn't sound like they're being held against their will and has a little bit of knowledge regarding customer service.

resp.text: Thank you so much for your feedback.  We regret that there was a communication breakdown.  Please call me if you would like to discuss in detail.     -Dr. Tucker

name: Lisa Lu
text: We have used Hoke for years and would not think of going any other place.  We have one dog who is old and has severe arthritis.  There's something special about a Vet who will get down in the floor to take blood and/or examine him.  The rest of the Vets at Hoke are equally amazing!  All 3 of our "babies" are patients with this clinic and they greet us all (people and human) by name when we walk in the door.

name: Tate Holt Maddox
text: The best in Birmingham. They treat us like part of their family. Great team, great location and affordable pricing. Thank you Hoke team for taking such amazing care of our family for over 10 years.

name: Kori Harding
text: This is a wonderful place to take your fur babies. Everyone there from the front desk, Monya and Angelia, to the techs in the back and the doctors, are absolutely wonderful!! I wouldn't take my fur babies anywhere else!!!

name: Emily Tucker
text: The staff at Hoke Animal Clinic are so caring and compassionate. They provide timely and convenient appointments. Highly recommend!

name: Jen Whitworth
text: I called Hoke Animal clinic to see if they could tell when what ages my dogs should recieve their vaccines. Monya answered all my questions. She was friendly and more than helpful. I was told that if I had any other questions not to hesitate to call. Thank you for all your help!

name: Kayla Smith
text: They have taken excellent care of my cat, Tuna! I've been so impressed by them and all their staff has been so friendly and helpful!

name: Ahmed Barakat
text: They took great care of our little animal family and answered any questions we had.

name: Sam G
text:
We've been here twice because our primary vet has inconvenient hours for us a few days a week. The first time, both my dogs needed one single vaccine and a nail trim. I arrived on time to the appointment (and was the only one in the waiting room) and had to wait for almost an hour to see the vet. Then they gave my dogs a full workup and multiple vaccines without asking me or telling me and charged me $450. They remedied the bill, but the lack of communication is the issue here.

Today, one of my dogs needs minor dental surgery. We made the appointment on Monday and the vet told us when to drop off and pick up. When we arrived today (Wednesday) to drop my dog off for surgery, they had no record of our appointment and also forgot to tell us that my dog shouldn't have eaten that morning. They ended up working it out but we had to wait an extra hour to pick her up.

The doctors seem friendly and knowledgeable which is the only reason I give this place ANY stars, but we won't be returning!

resp.text: Sam, please call so that we may discuss your complaint.  Our goal is to maintain a high level of care for our patients and satisfy their owners as well.   We will use all of the information that you provide us to continue to meet the needs of our clients.  Thank you,  Dr. Tucker.

name: Allen Mosley
text: Great staff (Vetinarians, Vet Tech's, & Administrative Staff are all very knowledgeable, kind, caring, compassionate, treat you like family, considerate & generally awesome), conveniently located, great hours, all services available. They've been taking care of my boys for over 20 years and I wouldn't go anywhere else.

name: Ginger Rose
text:
I know the facility and staff very well. My mommy and daddy take me there when I don't feel very well and everyone there always make me feel loved. The ladies at the front desk (Angela, Linda, Monya & Denise) give me treats, hugs and kisses as soon as I walk in!! WHO WOULDN'T LOVE THIS PLACE!!
My doctor is the BEST (Dr. A. Giambrone) in my opinion. I do love the other doctors (Dr. Tucker, Dr .Davies & Dr. P. Giambrone) as well.
I got bit on the neck, by a not so friendly dog last month, my doctor did her very best to fix me right up so that I wouldn't have any bad infection or nasty scarring. My mommy and daddy we're so worried. Dr. A. Giambrone and her assistant Bryan did a wonderful job helping me to heal.
My little sister (Jolene) loves the ladies (Vonn, Bre, Amanda, Lauren, Kelsea & Breanna), and Aaron, in the back. She had to have a little thing done to make her not be so loud and mean (spay). Dr. Davies fixed her right up and now Jolene is as sweet as she could be.
Overall, I believe this is the BEST clinic around. Friendly and very helpful front desk ladies! Gentle and loving kennel staff! Efficient and trustworthy vet techs! Compassionate and experienced doctors!
I GIVE THEM ALL 5 🐾🐾🐾🐾🐾!

name: Shannon Oliver
text: Overall a frustrating experience. The receptionist working that day not only tried to insult my intelligence, but also went as far as to threaten to not allow my dog to be treated. She insisted that if my dog did not receive two more vaccinations I would be refused service. I understand the importance of immunizations, but my dog was already suffering from a UTI, and my limited budget would not stretch for another $80 in vaccines that same day. Now, six days out from our original appointment and two unreturned phone calls later, I still have not been able to get the results of my dog's urinalysis. I thoroughly regret the amount of time and money that I have had to spend towards their services.

name: P Galt
text: I brought my dog to Hoke Animal Clinic after he received a horribly botched neuter from another clinic. His incision had developed a pretty nasty infection. My parents take their dogs there so after hearing their enthusiastic recommendation, I decided to bring him in to get looked at.  They were amazing, Dr. Tucker right away saw what the other vet had done wrong, immediately  gave him an antibiotic shot and a few days worth of antibiotics. Three days later, his incision is much less swollen, faded from a dark shade of red to light pink, and most important, Waylon (my dog) seems much more comfortable. And I, much less worried :) I can not recommend Hoke Animal Clinic more enthusiastically. They care about the animals they treat.

text:
Great employees    great doctors
hard workers

text: Love this place! They are an All animal hospital that come to my house to administer my dogs' vaccinations. Max loved the treatment and atmosphere of the hospital on Capshaw. He had an ear hematoma that they drained without any problems. Max is an older canine that I took to an Equine hospital in our home town, so he the atmosphere around the horses is perfect for him.

text: Drivers are irresponsible and erratic the old woman that answers is rude and unprofessional would highly recommend someone else

name: David Guido
text: Brought the boys in (2x 🐎) for their yearly exam and check up. Short wait but great service , very thorough visit and background exam.  The Vet spent time with us and answered all questions. Certainly gets our recommendation.

name: Ambur Love
text: I take my dog here, and I love the it! The workers are sweet and down to earth. The vet for the smaller animals explains everything very well, and I feel like I can trust him. I'm glad I found them as my new vet.

name: Mary Guthrie
text: Dr. Dunlap and his staff are outstanding. No matter whether it is a wellness visit at the clinic or he has to come to your place for a problem, you can count on him to provide excellent care for your horse and he is great with us humans too. Lucky to have him!

name: Jana Russell Nails
text: I love the folks here. Dr Harney and Dr Dunlap are knowledgeable and friendly; their assistants are helpful and personable too. Whether they're coming out to my ranch or seeing my animals at their facility I can always count on them to take care of my furry babies.  They see small animals too!

name: Gayle Barnett
text: Dr Dunlap has been my horse vet for about 8 years. He and his staff have provided routine and emergency services for us, and they are always professional, knowledgable and compassionate. I feel like my horses will get excellent veterinary care and they also take the time to be sure that I understand and am comfortable with the recommended treatments.

name: Katherine Ferrell
text: The entire staff is amazing, all of my pets go there and I always trust that they're in good hands!

name: Darlene Lawrence
text: Awesome staff and doctors. They take their time to explain and answer questions.

name: Rita Neff
text: Super. Efficient, very helpful

name: s d
text: I trust my pets at Duke Animal clinic.  I take my dog to get his teeth cleaned and Dr. Duke does a great job at that, and for everything else, the clinic is very accommodating for my schedule.  I even take my dog there for a bath and nail trim because they do a good job.

name: Sheli E
text:
My super-senior, Max, went in for a full mouth extraction due to stomatitis. Dr Duke was referring to me by two clinics and I’m extremely happy with the care my baby received.

A vet tech from the clinic I went to for a second opinion had told me the usual price was around 900, but to be aware it may cost more depending on any additional meds or services he may need. The office at Duke Animal Clinic quoted the same price. 900 was more than reasonable as I usually get vet care in Atlanta and prices are insane there.

Although his appointment was further out than I had hoped, when he finally had his surgery I was  pleased at the level of care he received and that Dr Duke gave me a copy of mouth photos (before and after) and explained what he did by showing me on the photos.

Max is healing up nicely, is back to being mischievous, AND the price was just under 900 even though I was prepared for more.

I 100% recommend Duke Animal Clinic to anyone needing dental care for their pets.

name: Ligma
text: Always bring my cats here. Duke animals clinic is the best IMO

name: Adam Campbell
text: My wife took her Chihuahua to Duke Animal Clinic to have a procedure done for his teeth. We were told by the clinic that the cost was going to be around $400, which we were fine with. After the procedure, the clinic charged us nearly $700 without any change in scope-of-service or explanation of the increase. This is beyond unethical business practice. The people that run Duke Animal Clinic are the dishonest crooks they have proven themselves to be. If they cannot be trusted at their word, how can someone trust them with their pets?

name: Cynthia Jones
text: The Doctors and Staff are top notch and honest with tx for your furbabies. They will never try to talk you into things that you may not be able to afford and will never make you feel guilty about it. They are so kind and compassionate. Loving environment.

name: Krizia Tokarski Jackson
text: Dr. Duke is amazing with my dogs, and very friendly. All the staff was helpful and kind. He took the time to answer all of our questions patiently and makes us feel like he really cares about animals. Not to mention prices are extremely reasonable, plus they do military discount.

name: samantha kirby
text: They are so awesome and caring.Dr. duke himself is one of the very best vets i have ever seen.he saved my baby belle and i will forever be thankful to him.

name: Olivia McCarter
text: I've used Dr. Mims ever since I moved to Alabama and got my first dog. He is a very compassionate and kind man and he was very good with Ella. When she had a tumor, he quickly diagnosed it and sent off a sample of it to confirm. We had to go through chemotherapy and it was coming to the point where my Lab was excited to go to vet. That's how great these people are. They knew Ella by name and were very gentle and kind to her. I'll continue to use Dr. Mims and Dr. Duke and recommend them to anyone with pets.

name: Tracy Johnson
text: I only like Dr. Duke. Everyone else puts fear in me like they suggest things that I dont agree my pets need. Ive had dogs all my life and they have always lived long healthy lives. Dr. Duke always said they are healthy when I would see him. He never suggested anything like the others all do.

name: Linda Hulsey
text: Everyone at Duke's have been great.  The prices are very reasonable and usually you are able to see a vet in a very short time.  This is first vets office that I have been totally comfortable with my babies being here.  I walked in to check the place unannounced and was given a tour.  Found the staff friendly and the place was very clean.  Since moving back to Mobile this is the first place that I am truly comfortable bring my 12 Dachshunds to.  Recommend Duke Animal Clinic to anyone with pets.

name: Leigh Merz
text: They always take great care of our fur babies!

name: Mike Rankin
text:
I have been using Duke since 2011.  I have always been pleased with the veterinarians at Duke, and until a year ago was please with the office staff.  But a year ago, I noticed a lot of turnover in the office.  Now, Duke's office is an administrative nightmare.

Until Duke is able to retain a front office staff long enough to attain seasoned, well functioning staff employees, I would avoid this clinic.

name: Joshua Carter
text: My 13yo English Springer Spaniel was very sick.   After spending a night in the Vet ER, I just showed up on a Saturday with no scheduled appointment very worried and had never seen him before.  Dr. Duke was nice enough to stay late and look at him.  Ollie is alive today thanks to him.  Great guy.  great place.  very affordable.  I highly recommend them!

name: Sherry McSween
text: I have used Duke animal clinic for 30 years with large and small animals. Dr. Duke has always gone above and beyond in taking care of our animals along with Dr. Justin Mims.. The Doctors have gone to extra lengths to treat my animals in the best way possible. Staff is good and always try to help in anyway they can. They also take after hours calls for established clients. Dr. Duke specializes in dentistry and has clients come from all over the Gulf Coast. I can't tell you how happy I am with this clinic.

name: T&D Professional Tree Removal
text: I went the first time and everyone made us feel welcome. They tended to my pet's needs and the price was very affordable. We Thank ALL of them there for their hospitality.

name: Larry Bowles
text: Duke Animal Clinic was recommended by a good friend. We were seen right away and made to feel welcome.Care and  cleanliness was excellant.  I will switch to this Vet for our other furry children(3 dogs and 2 Cats).

name: Carissa Pessia
text: Overall we love the care we receive at Duke Animal Clinic. Appointments are always available and the staff is very caring. We brought our rescue dog here after adopting her. They’ve always provided great care

name: Ruth Darlene Stewart
text: This is update to my review a few months ago.  October 23 2018.  Last evening I had an emergency with one of my older beagles.  Dr. Jane Snead was on call. I give her five stars!  She was compassionate, competent and very thorough in her treatment of my Kate. Unfortunately due to bleeding abdominal tumor the decision was made to PTS.  I have the most respect for veterinarians that take on call for their established clients.  Many vets are opting to send their clients to ER clinic and not take call at all. Thank you Dr. Snead for being available and the excellent care provided to Kate.   I have used Dr. Duke ( Duke Animal Clinic) for almost 40 years.  Dr. Mims and Dr. Duke as well as others have always been there when needed. His support staff are always outstanding and friendly.  I have received excellent care and encourage others to use Duke Animal Clinic

name: Murriah Barnette
text: I love Duke Animal Clinic! I volunteered/worked there a few years in middle and high school. Dr. Duke and his staff really care and treat your pets as if they were their own. I am glad to be back in Mobile!

name: Eric Sulivant
text: We've been to three different vets with our 2 yr old dog and this is easily the best. They are always looking out for what's best for our dog and never overcharge! Definitely recommend these guys!

name: Theresa Smith
text: Very Friendly and compassionate Staff, they make you feel very Welcome there.

name: Donna Buckley
text: Dr. Duke and Dr. Newcombe are the best vets I have ever known. I have used 4 other vets in my 69 years and they don't even compare to the Duke clinic. They are reasonable also.

name: Kaitlyn Kingery
text: I have been using Duke Animal Clinic for the past two years. I would not trust anyone else with my pets! Dr. Duke, Dr. Mims, Dr. Caddell and the rest of the staff are amazing :)

name: David Rich
text: I picked up a rescue horse today and to haul it back to Florida I had to have a cogens done and they did it while I waited ,great service

name: brittney buker
text: Duke animal clinic came out to my house to examine my horses, Dr.Mims was excellent with horses. I would recommend him to any one. The prices were also great!

name: M R
text: Unprofessional staff! We had a bad experience and cannot even share our review without the clinic falsly reporting it!  The staff reports any negative review, although legitimate, then uses friends and employees spouses/family to flood positive reviews. Just ask around town,  Duke animal clinics reputation speaks for itself and Dr Mims takes most of the accolades. If a business gets so worked up and has the time to troll Google daily, they may not be the best business to trust with your pets care.

name: Nathan Hewlett
text: Refused to listen to my opinion and consider my ideas once their ideas had proven to not be working.

name: J Slay
text: We've always taken our dogs to duke animal clinic and never had problems, however that all came crashing down yesterday on 7/15/16 our 2 year old dachshund maverick was shot in the neck through our privacy fence by a pellet gun. At the time we didn't know it was a gun shot, we figured it he caught a nail in the neck while playing with his brother under our shed. When my wife showed up at 1:20 the receptionist was as rude as anyone could be to my already frantic wife. She told her no vets were in because they were on lunch. Then when my wife said so there's not a single thing you can do (keep in mind my dog is right in front of her bleeding all over the place) she rolled her eyes and said she could kennel him until they got back from lunch unless it was a real emergency...really lady??my dog is bleeding from his neck everywhere, but no it's not an emergency. After my took him down the road to Irby Overton where they immediately took him back and extracted the bullet from his neck. They said if it would've been a centimeter lower it would've hit his artery in his neck and he would've bled to death in a matter of minutes. Needless to say we are switching to Irby Overton permanently.

name: C Lynn
text: When you pay $60 for a meaningless consult, you should be allowed to share your experience. However, this business seems to have a lot of time on their hands to continuously attempt to dispute a legitimate review. Dr. Duke was condescending and his experience seems to be as out of date as the clinic itself is. I will not use this clinic ever, and would not trust anyone in this clinic with my pets.

name: Charla Ruby
text: Dr duke is an insensitive crule jurk. He did not sedate my baby enough,then used too big of a needle and kept shoving it in and out so much that she was in pain scared crying out till she finally left this word. Never ever is this the way it is supposed to be. 😩😓😡

name: Jerry Adams
text: This place is awesome the vet Dr. Took extra time to fix my cats problem where the other place I took her took didn’t  if your reading this and need a awesome  place to bring your pet this is the place

text: My dog received the best treatment. All my questions were answered and I felt as though the new vet did a wonderful job! I would see her again! I have never had a bad experience. I highly recommend them to everyone!

text: We are new in town....Finding a great veterinarian was important! We had a great experience From the moment we were greeted at front desk to the moment we checked out. I was very concerned about my dog getting sick bc he’s usually healthy. Dr. Brumsky took her time checking Forrest and making sure he got the right meds and dosage. He’s doing better and we are thankful to her and staff.

name: Becky Pounders
text: North Alabama Animal Hospital is outstanding. The love and care they show for the animals they treat is amazing. They care about each one as if it was their own. They have been great with helping our Willow and I wouldn't even imagine taking her anywhere else. I highly recommend this place if you are looking for a place for your fur babies. You will not be disappointed.

name: Sidney Magoon
text: I took my dog, Jethro, there and they were great! The vet was very helpful! He sat on the floor with my dog and was interacting with him to gain his trust so he could look at his ears. I thought that was just awesome! I was also in and out in a timely manner.

name: Christy Shaw
text: We Love NAAH!! They are wonderful, the whole staff!! Our Max Loves going to the vet, his tail starts wagging when we get there, they are really great with all animals!

name: Susan Cole
text: The staff are always so kind and very knowledgeable. Most important, they care about my fur baby.  I lost a kitty last year, and they were so kind and comforting to me during my loss.  In the end, they went above and beyond to help her and without a doubt, she received the best care possible.  I'm thankful for all the staff and will always remember their kindness and dedication to the work they do.  You will feel the same after your first visit.

name: Brenda Lee
text: I got a little crazy when I went to Birmingham and Rocky got worse than he had been and posted a negative remark. It has been taken down. I came home and saw Dr Thompson and we discussed Rocky and options. At one point Rocky could not go outside without coughing. I have been following the plan that was worked out with Dr Thompson and Rocky went out today. He was not coughing and before I could catch him he was across the road checking out girls. Thank you Dr Thompson for giving my dog back his quality of life. We have been out several times and no coughing. We are following the plan.

name: Terri Sassone
text: We are new to the area and changing vets is stressful. Benny's visit was great. He's a special needs senior boy and the vet and staff were awesome. Benny had them trained to give him treats in no time! We will be bringing our other two hooligans in soon!

name: Heath King
text: We started using NAAH after moving to the Shoals area, and our experiences so far have been excellent. We had to make the difficult decision this week to put our dog down after his fight with cancer. We were so pleased with how compassionate, patient, helpful and caring the staff at NAAH were. I would highly recommend North Alabama Animal Hospital to anyone!

name: Lee Renfroe
text: North Alabama Animal Hospital is a very kind, caring practice with high quality veterinarians and staff.  I hold them in very high regard and trust them completely with my pets!  Awesome organization!

name: Janice Smith
text: I trust that everyone at North Alabama Animal Hospital will take excellent care of my pets. They are always competent and compassionate. It is obvious that they love what they do!

name: Laura Hamner
text: North Alabama Animal Hospital does an amazing job caring for our chocolate lab. I would, and do, highly recommend NAAH to anyone who is looking for a team to care for their beloved pet(s). Keep up the good work NAAH.

name: Catie Gajewski
text: The staff was very friendly and the doctor was very thorough getting my leg updated on vaccinations.

name: Vince Brewton
text: Troy and his staff provide great care and treatment. North Alabama Animal Hospital is one of two vet practices in the area we recommend to friends and newcomers. Troy's expertise and experience are outstanding.

name: Emily Parker
text: They have taken care of many of my fur babies over the years. They not only provide great care of the animal but the owner as well. I’ll never forget the horrible day I had to put my Sweetie girl down but I will also never forget the compassion of Dr Youngblood and the techs that day. I highly recommend this office and all the docs!

name: Camilla MIller
text: Everyone was fantastic. So nice and helpful. Thank you for the love you all have for animals. Don't believe you could have made the experience any better!

name: Sandra Johnson
text:
Wonderful  Drs. and staff, they are very patient and caring toward both patients and owners. They really do strive to give the very best care that you could possibly want for your pets at extremely reasonable prices. In my opinion
They are the best in the business. You will never regret taking your babies (pets) to
them.

name: Alison Hawn
text: We are forever grateful to NAAH for all they do to take care of our two babies Max & Okie! They are both high maintenance pups and require a great deal of medical attention. We are always beyond satisfied with the care they receive and the courteous way we are always treated. We truly appreciate everything they do for our babies!

name: tuscaniracer27
text: You guys are always amazing. Your customer service and pet care are top notch. Thank you so much for providing such a great place!

text: Dr. Bonner at North Alabama Animal Hospital has provided the best of care for our three dogs. He is professional and is always responsive to their needs.

name: Christy Arnold
text:
What a great team at NAAH!
You all are awesome!
Daisy is happy

name: David Painter
text: I've taken my dogs here for years. I've seen all the doctor's at some point and time. I usually see Adam Thompson; he's very nice and listens to your concerns. I highly recommend all of the doctor's.

name: Cassidy Beck
text: I've been to plenty of vets in the Shoals and I was recommended to come here by a family member and this will be the only vet clinic I use from now on. my cat had a small procedure done & the vet called me personally to tell me that everything went well and took the time to explain what all they did and asked if I had any questions (Ive never had a vet do this before) The receptionists and the other ladies were super nice, too. A great experience.

name: Laura Engdahl
text: I like being able to go in the clinic with my pets. Under the current circumstances- COVID19- I understand why I could not. I think that the curbside process worked quite well. NAAH is a great place to take your pets. Very caring. I’ve been using them over five years. They always get you in when you need to get in. 😻😻😻

name: Rebecca Patterson
text: Excellent care for our senior schnauzer “Sophie”. Not only the normal checkups but an extensive surgery made us feel like they truly care as much as I do.

name: Lisa Morgan
text: Very clean facility. Staff is very professional and pleasant. Atmosphere is very pleasant. My pup loves the staff. They treat him like there own. Would highly recommend my friends and family to this facility.

name: Darcy Williams
text: Dr. Thompson and the rest of the staff always go above and beyond to take care of my kitties and always keep me well informed. I appreciate them so much!

name: John Fisher
text: We brought our dog here at the recommendation of neighbors. Our dog had a cut on one of her paws. At any rate, we were thoroughly impressed by the quality of care and compassion of everyone we met. Highly recommend.

name: Harleigh Houston
text: I honestly couldn’t have asked for a better experience. Y’all were beyond amazing!!

name: Sandi Ayers
text: All the doctors are very competent, knowledgeable and caring.  They are willing to do all they can to help with anything your "family" member needs and they don't forget you either.

name: Jean Goodson
text: The veterinarians at NAAH are simply the absolute best in the area and from my experience in the state.  They are kind and caring to pets and parents and never fail to go the extra mile for our beloved fur babies.  The entire staff from the front desk to the back kennels are unfailingly nice and professional.  These folks are the real deal!

name: Forrest Davis
text: The staff here are incredibly helpful and knowledgeable. They will answer any questions you have about treatments or the health of your pet. You can tell they truly care about keeping your animals healthy and happy.

name: Teresa Box
text: I was so impressed with NAAH! My Crocker Spaniel has finally got relief from a chronic skin condition. We saw the vet Jason Bonner. He was so thorough.  He listened asked questions, gathered his info, examined dog. We talked again and came up with a starting plan. And after 3 days Harley is starting to jump and wanting to play again! #1 Rating in my book

name: Michelle Petty
text: Your staff and Veterinarians have always had my fur babies health a priority. Everyone is always very kind and professional but yet you make patients feel like family.  I’ve had several Veterinarians for my fur babies over the last 20yrs and I must say your office is hands down the very best.  I know you care for mine as you would your very own and that is so comforting especially when at times have to bring in sick and critical babies without your care and explanation of procedures may have turned out not in a good way.  Thank you so much for your continued care for both pet parents and pets

name: Heather Sheppard
text: Everyone at NAAH is wonderful!! I would not trust anyone else to care for my pets!

name: Patricia Dyar
text: The only improvement possible I can think of is not under your control. I’m an owner of a new patient and I have yet to see the inside of your clinic due to COVID-19!  This, too, shall pass!  Very pleased with your handling of the pandemic!

name: Kyla Pearson
text: By far the best vet hands down! My Sassy Frassy Just loves them! I love that they love my baby like she was there’s! Very friendly also and that’s a plus in my book!

name: S Stewart
text:
Appreciate all the NAAH team That took care of Odie.  Great training as well. He goes to get in the crate at home just to rest.
Just amazed at your wonderful therapy throughout Odie’s two surgeries and all that extra care.  And yes includes the crew that gave extra petting, extra trips out to tinkle and more.
Odie really is a great dog.
He had a set back this past Friday night with a hurt right knee. (I’m thinking slept on it wrong).
Dr Troy gave a great assessment and treatment.  He finally is not having to give to it (on Tuesday).
Odie is protecting himself better now. Being very careful.
Thank you Thank You Thankful for ALL of you ⚽️🥏 no more playing chase the squirrels 🐿🐿🐿🐿🐿🐿🐿🐿🐿
(Too expensive a game)

name: Jennifer Warren
text: Fast friendly staff. I was kept informed about everything that was happening and all the options were explained in detail. I would highly recommend North Alabama Animal hospital

name: Melissa Tapp
text: Everyone went above and beyond with our dog Chloe and we were very happy! This was the first time we used North Alabama Animal Hospital and even with having to do curbside check-in due to the Covid-19 issues, everyone was very professional and responsive. Dr. Thompson called me off and on during the visit to discuss treatment and recommendations for Chloe and explained everything in a way we could understand. We will continue to use them for Chloe and for our other pets as well!

name: Caitlyn Brewer
text: They make everything so convenient from making appointments to refilling meds. I brought my fur baby there when my old vet was insisting apoquel was a fix all for my dogs allergies even after I told her it had stopped working. NAAH listening to everything I had to say and helped me look for answers. Now my baby is on Cytapoint and feeling so much better! This dog mamas heart is happy

name: William Cooper
text: Absolutely the best experience I have had with animal care specialists!

name: James Lamar
text:
Had Christmas plans to come to Muscle Shoals to visit my dad and then on to Monroe, LA to visit my son. I sent a message to North Alabama Animal Hospital inquiring about boarding. Dr. Thompson called me and answered all of my questions and even invited me to come to the office for a tour when I got in town.  I took my Cavalier King Charles, Sam, with me for the tour and everyone was so nice. I had no concerns after the visit on what kind of care my Sam would be given. The next day I took Sam in and he stayed 3 nights. When I picked him up there were no issues at all. The staff is great and the rates are very reasonable. I’ll definitely board him there again in the future.

James

name: Michael Richardson
text: Always leave feeling my pets have had the best of care

name: Butch McGee
text: The staff is so very friendly to my pet and I. The curb side service is a safe and smart way to receive care for your pet.  All my questions and concerns were addressed and never felt rushed at all. A great place for pet care

text: 'When my fur baby has an illness or medical condition, I need someone I can truly trust. That is North Alabama Animal Hospital.

name: Victoria Atkinson
text: I've been bringing my dog hear since 2012. The staff are always pleasant and the doctors as well! They genuinely CARE for the overall health of our fur babies! I recommend this team to anyone who has just become an animal family to those who have had their fur babies.

text: This is by far the best animal hospital I’ve ever been to. The staff comes out and calls your pets name when it’s there time for the visit. They are always ready to answer any question you may have along the way. 5 star animal hospital.

text: The staff was really knowledgeable and friendly. The treated my pet like one of their own

text: We have been using North Alabama Animal Hospital for about ten years and could not be more pleased. Each staff member is very professional and obviously loves what they’re doing. It is very clean and the doctors are awesome!  Strongly recommend this facility for all your pet needs!

name: Maps
text: I'm not a local and came into the area for family reasons. I needed a vet to go to and my brother told me to go here. It's the best around he said. I'm biased as I love my vet at home but when I walked in I was impressed just by the looks. Neat, organized and clean with plenty of space for people bringing in their fury family members. Everybody was very friendly... From the staff to the techs and docs.. Even other customers! Great atmosphere. My dog is special to me as she is my medical service dog and I require different methods of care with vets that not a lot will provide. Not here... They were awesome and did everything I asked for and then some. Above and beyond! If I lived in the area, this place would be my only place. If they were where I'm from I would switch in a heartbeat.. Of you love your fury friends then you should be taking them here for care.

name: Heather Butler
text: They're awesome friendly and kind .my dog has an issue with his leg they're so sweet to him

name: Rohan Williams

text: Easily the best care available in the area.  Four young, bright doctors each with different areas of interest who are all familiar with your pet's clinical needs and coordinate for the highest level of care.  My best buddy would not be alive if not for them.  And not to leave the supporting staff out..they are fantastic!

resp.text: Thank you from all of us! We love Brady!

text: Staff is very friendly. The doctors are very thorough and never leave you with any questions. Dr. Bonner and Dr. Thompson always make us feel special! Would recommend NAAH to anyone!

text:
I 've been to 4 VETS in our area and I'm so very thankful that I finally found one I like. Dr. Thompson is spot on and the best in my book!
All of the staff is so comforting and friendly. I feel as if my fur babies get the best treatment and taken care of to the fullest. So happy to be a client.

name: Jenny Louise
text: Brought my baby Coco in due to breathing problem an didn't think he would make it through the day an after antibiotics an shots my baby is lively an as feisty as ever an doing great,the Dr.and nurses were great an very helpful ,will be bringing all my babies here from now on,they are the best

Using ppe to protect themselves and the public during the pandemic. Pet app that gives a little back for use on pets needs, appts, messaging is awesome.

text: We always have the utmost confidence that the Doctors and staff at North Alabama Animal Hospital will give the very best opinions, diagnosis and care for our 4 legged furry family members.

text: I will highly recommend North Alabama Animal Hospital to all who ask. Very kind and loving and professional. Y'all have treated all three of my cat children wonderful. I just cannot think of any other place I'd rather take my babies to have their health care taken care of. I want to say thank you to all at the north Alabama Animal Hospital the receptionist to the doctors.

name: Rebecca Siery
text: I am very pleased with the service provided to Allie. She had gone through a couple of bad experiences at another Vet's office. Although I brought Allie in just for grooming services, I knew she ( and I) would be nervous during her first visit with you. I understand Allie did very well and I attribute it to your team's professionalism. In addition, Allie's coat never felt as clean and soft as it did after your grooming service. Allie will be coming to you for all her needs, including annual vaccinations. Thank you for making Allie's (and my) experience a pleasant one!

resp.text: Thank you so much!

name: Andrew Massey
text: Our Great Dane had somehow impaled herself through the chest and out her back under her arm. We thought she was going to die that night. The Dr.'s stitched her back up and she walked out the door with a limp the next day. 3 days later she is running around like nothing happened. We will always be thankful for them.

name: Craig Keller
text: We trust North Alabama Animal Hospital, the Vets & Staff with the care of our boy, Chappy!  They are great with detailed diagnosis, care instructions and suggestions to improve his life and help us keep him active and healthy.  Fantastic service!! Craig & Cindy K.

name: BCS
text: Highly recommended. Really put my pup and i at ease, even with the initial phone call. If your in the shoals area or can make it to this location please do.

name: Taelor Wallace
text: Brought my spaniel here while I was in town visiting over the holidays because she was acting sick. They got us in immediately and were very helpful. They were thorough and assured me that if anything changed or if we saw any setback, I could call or bring her back in. I highly recommend them!

name: Stephanie Flanagan
text: I have always had a great experience with my pets at NAAH. I’m open to seeing any vet there because they’re all knowledgeable and show their love for our pets, as well as being honest about why treatments are or are not needed. Thank you NAAH!

name: Michelle Sibley
text: Dr. Youngblood & Dr. Bonner have always given our pets excellent care!

name: Joanne Bush
text: Excellent, skilled, animal loving, and compassionate vets and technicians.

name: QuadCities Daily
text: Great folks who care about your fur babies as much as you do

name: Belinda Bishop
text: even though it was past going-home time, Dr. Bonner & staff stayed with us, going over options to hopefully help our Ringo feel better.  never a mention of being delayed.  this is truly one of the most, if not the most, caring vet clinics we've ever had.

name: Cre Thompson
text: My sweet Moe has asthma and Dr Bonner has been so straight forward and proactive with her treatment. I appreciate him and the entire staff of NAAH so much! They are so caring and helpful! I wouldn't take my loving pets anywhere else!

name: Sarah Ann Evans
text: Dr. Brumby and every tech was fabulous. This is my first pet and first vet experience. They took great care of Pablo and got me in an out within an hour. I was able to schedule my appointment and get in the same day. I will definitely be back.

resp.text: Thank you so much!

name: Mallory Angel
text: Everything has been great. Thank you so much for being thorough, taking care of Alley, and keeping us updated throughout the day.

name: Porch Talk
text: Saved my dogs life. I had no idea what parvo was but the vets there took care of her and it was top notch!

name: Emily Sherrod
text: North Alabama Animal Hospital has always been there for us and taken time to answer any and all questions we have.  Dr. Youngblood and his staff care for our pets as much as we do and we are very grateful.

name: Tracey Loveland
text: North Alabama Animal Hospital has provided exceptional care. The staff and doctors go above and beyond in caring for our furry family members. The sensitivity they have shown when we lost our pets was appreciated. They recently operated on our six month old puppy who somehow found and swallowed a one inch ball bearing. All of us shook our heads at that one, but with great care for him they found out why he was sick and got him on the road to recovery.  I cannot say enough on how thankful we are to have found North Alabama Animal Hospital.

resp.text: Thank you Tracey! We enjoy the friendship we've made with you and your crew!

text: We were in town for Thanksgiving and cousin dogs got into a scuffle. Took one to NA Animal Hospital on recommendation of a local friend. They were great. Gave me options and treated him well. Would definitely use them again.

I personally want to thank everyone that helped me with my dog Peanut especially Dr. Thompson who took the time and called me back and explained everything the best he could.Peanut passed away today and I will miss him a lot.
Thank you

text: Caring professionals!

name: Edgar Black
text: I have taken my dogs to NAAH for 10 years or more. The doctors and staff are the best anywhere and I would never take my pets anywhere else. They are knowledgeable, considerate, and friendly. I trust NAAH completely and would recommend them to anyone needing a great veterinarian.

name: Sydney Richardson
text: NAAH doctors and staff are THE BEST!  They have always gone above and beyond to take care of our fur babies.

I'VE TRIED SEVERAL AROUND THE SHOALS AREA  !!! Fr. Thompson, Dr. Bonner  and Dr. Youngblood are very thorough and very kind to my Shih-Tzu and they all love each of the veterinarians and the technicians who work there and I never have to worry if they have to say for surgery or for any other reason and that is why I wouldn't take my fur babies anywhere but North Alabama Animal Hospital !!! ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐JLM

name: Amanda “MandaPanda” Beene
text: They worked so well with my little girl gigi

text: I've only been going to this animal hospital for about 18 months, but I absolutely love the doctors and technicians.  They've taken excellent care of my lab, and everyone takes the time to answer any questions I have.  So many dogs are afraid of going to the vet, but Colby loves going to visit.

name: Kimberly Russell
text: I brought my sick kitten in. Everyone I came into contact with were compassionate and helpful. I left my little buddy there overnight and they took amazing care of him! I highly recommend you bring your furry family members her for their health needs. You wontw regret it at all!

text: NAAH   has always took very good care of Harley & Logan. They've been our vet since they were 4 months old, they are 10 1/2 now. The entire staff has always took care of us, well pleased with the care they provide, thanks again for all you do.

My puppy liked her and he didn't even yelp with his shot. I'm looking forward to my next visit. The staff and vet care for my Italian Mastiff. They spoiled him with snacks

Last Thursday Chance had surgery on both eyes:
It's not possible to have a better experience.  The staff and Dr's are always respectful and so nice. They also go over any information needed to know about your pet. They go above and beyond any other vet. I'll never go anywhere else other than here with my pets. Dr Youngblood helped my puppy Chance out and he's living so much happier now.  Thank you and everyone else who helped in my baby's surgery.

They do not run pricey tests without your go-ahead, but lay it all on the table for you to choose. Also, we drive 70 miles round trip and it is worth it. So, trust your pets to the care there and you will not be disappointed.

Her follow-up and physical therapy with Dr. Brumby is going extremely well. After each visit, she is able to use her injured leg a little more.  We definitely recommend Dr. Youngblood and his entire staff.

text: Recently, I took my 14 year old shelter rescue cat to get her claws trimmed. The tech who worked with her was especially kind, gentle and effective. Upon completion, she again soothed and petted my cat. I appreciate such extra care very much. Metro Cat has been our vet for years and I've found all of their techs, as well as the vets, to be knowledgeable and professional as well as very kind and caring.

name: Roxanne Roberts
text: I’ve been using Metro Cat Clinic since 1990. They have wonderful caring staff and great docs. I appreciate how they call and discuss any issues that they find and have the skills to help my cats live longer healthier lives. The facility is very clean (never smells like cats) as well. I have utilized every service they offer at some point and have never had any bad experiences. I also have 6 cats, so we are very familiar with each other!

name: LeslieAnn Gruen
text: Since I moved here, Dr. Montgomery and her staff have been absolutely wonderful in caring for my cat, Nelson. In his first visit, the techs were so wonderful and they just loved Nelson from the start. They were spoiling him, gave him treats (Nelson didn't like the treats they first gave him bc he only likes seafood, so they really wanted to make sure he knew he was being a good boy and they found some seafood wet food and gave him a little...lol...). They took their photos with him and helped us out with an issue we had with his chip. Recently, he was bit by a scorpion, although it was unknown for quite a while as what happened to create a really terrible infection. He stayed there overnight and they cared for his wound. His fever lowered but then it spiked so the tech called me on a Sunday evening to update me about his condition. Miraculously, Monday morning, instead of performing surgery on him, Dr. Montgomery told me I could take him home. Also, she told me about what she felt caused the infection, a scorpion bite. They gave me directions to care for him that were easy to understand and follow. They asked me to let them know the next day about how he was doing. Metro really cares about their patients and also the mommies of the patients, like myself. Nelson means the world to me and they completely understand. Highly recommend

name: Anna Seay
text: I absolutely LOVE Metro Cat Clinic! Every single staff member is beyond amazing! You can 100% feel the love they have for every single fur baby that comes through their doors! My sweet little fur baby is a huge scaredy cat and can be a HANDFUL when faced with new people and environments. They went out of their way to make sure she was comfortable before doing anything. They perform the best services I've ever experienced with veterinary clinics and make sure you are 100% clear on everything they do and why. They also give you great pamphlets to read after the visit as well. I could go on and on about how amazing this clinic is. I will always highly reccomend them to all my kitty owning friends! I wish more clinics were like these wonderful people! :)

name: Tammy Baker
text: I took my cat there with some pretty severe issues. Dr Montgomery and her staff have been not only wonderful with my cat but they have also been very caring with me and my family. My cat needed surgery and is possibly going to need more and I am so very happy I found metro Cat Clinic! I highly recommend them!! Thank you Metro for all yall have done for my cat Will 😁

name: Wayne Bolden
text:
I usually don’t do bad reviews, mostly because I can excuse, understand and/or sympathize with the person or situation. But NOT HERE!!!! My wife and I just visited here yesterday with our 4 week old kitten to get an eye problem checked out and a little guidance on properly caring for the little guy. Overall the the visitation was informative. We did get guidance on how to care for and take care of our new kitten properly, even if the Vet was very flippant and lacking in a warm bedside manner! (like I said I can overlook somethings.) This brings me to my point... In order to get that information, we had to ask questions. That’s where my issue is...

My issue is with the pettiness in their billing practices!!! They actually charged us $10.00 for “EXTRA TIME” in our appointment! WTH!!!! Whoever heard of such a thing?! Now keep in mind, I am a stickler for following rules.......but in this case NOBODY told us we only have an allotted amount of time to have your appointment and ask questions!! Also, there was NO SIGNAGE about this anywhere!!! Again, WTH!!! HOW CAN YOU KNOW, IF YOU ARE NEVER TOLD?!?

Also, when my wife called to ask about this they had the nerve to say, “We asked too many questions and talked too long with the Vet, making the next appointment start late.” I am sorry, but when was it a bad thing/wrong thing to ask questions to a doctor? And never mind that we sat in the room with our Vet SILENTLY WAITING, while she told us to hold on, while she typed up her notes!! Heck, that was at least 15 minutes!!! Also, per their policy, we called to their office number upon our arrival to let them know we are here and WAITED ON HOLD FOR ABOUT 10 MINUTES, prior to starting our visitation!! I guess that was counted against us too!!!

Needless to say........this has nothing to do about the $10.00 and more about the pettiness and principle of the matter. And upon talking to them further, they still don’t understand or acknowledge that this is a ludicrous fee for a petty policy! They have lost our business forever over $10. I hope it was worth it!
And don’t get me started on the overcharging of medicine...............

name: Nathan Stuckey
text: We've been taking our cat here for several years and it's been perfect. They handle everything quite well from the routine to the problematic. They helped us a lot with selecting the right food and water additives, things like that where we would have been totally lost otherwise. Highly recommended.

resp.text: Nathan, we really appreciate your kind words! Your babies are important to us and we are pleased you guys are a part of our MCC Family! ~Catherine, MCC Practice Manager
