text: Dr. Montgomery and all of her staff were wonderful! Everyone is very welcoming, and they all take the time to explain things to you.  I would highly recommend this clinic!

text: Metro CC has treated us and our cats with care and understanding. They have insight into the feline anatomy and well-being that has given great results. Our cats don't like going to the vet and the folks there understand how to and when to use physical restraints to get them the care they need. The MCC's care for a feral tribe is an example of their desire to assist whenever they can.

resp.text: Thank you so much for your feedback! We do love our kitties! The feral tribe here are local celebrities and it is an honor to be able to provide their meals and healthcare! name: Rayven Chaney
text: I learned a lot about felines when I was doing my clinicals here but this is not a healthy environment unless you're smarter than her. By her I mean Dr. Montgomery. She was extremely rude and mean to me. She'd make racist comments also and also put her hands on me, tell me to move outta the way and just a mean person. I suggest if you're a student (black) just starting out, don't get your hours here. Now Dr. Lolli is an amazing vet, she's very nice and takes her time teaching you things and wants to help you learn instead of tearing you down and making you feel worse about yourself.

resp.text:
Creating a learning environment for up and coming veterinary students and technicians is important to us here at Metro Cat Clinic.  It is crucial to sustaining the care and benefit to all of the animals in our community to do so with dedication and passion.

It is also important to acknowledge an ongoing responsibility of every single person in this world to combat racism and ethnocentric views.  These are serious problems in our world and they need to be addressed head on in every instance such we are not passive in any way allowing these monstrous issues room to fester and grow.

I want to thank you for bringing up your concerns and I want to encourage you to do so in the future when the situations that make you uncomfortable happen.  It takes a lot for us to prepare to address such emotionally raw and upsetting topics such as racism and any feeling associated with being violated.  This is why even though it has been a long period of time since you were here in our clinic; I still commend you deeply on standing up to speak.

I want to apologize on behalf of our clinic that you experienced any situation that made you feel the way you have expressed.  We will discuss this situation in our next staff meeting and see what we can all remember about that time period such we can be aware it made you feel this way.

I hope your career is budding and you are able to utilize some of the wonderful things you referenced being able to learn while you were with us.  Let us know if there is anything we can help you with in the future.

~Catherine, MCC Practice Manager

text: I have been using Dr. Bob Bush for many years. This Vet is in this for the love of the animals and has a heart for the community. He had him 4 days and lots of IVs and medications and labs and hours of care later , I had a less than 350 dollar bill. You will not find a more compassionate or caring veterinarian anywhere in this area. I have left my house several times calling all the way with a dog in distress and he will be in his Mobile  Clinic waiting with surgical area ready and sterile if needed. He does not always answer immediately , that way he can keep cost down, he will call you back though as soon as possible.  Hes a awesome vet.

name: Daren Carter
text:
“I’ve worked on your dog for 4 hours and I’m tired and I’m going home”.  These were the exact words Dr. Buxton said to us after we had taken our dog to her.

This specific weekend, Dr. Buxton was working the weekend shift at the Emergency Animal Clinic just off Governor’s Drive.  Our Bassett Hound, Daisy, had been attacked by two other dogs on a Saturday afternoon so we rushed her to the hospital.  After “diagnosing” and treating for her for about 4 hours, Dr. Buxton is ADAMANT that we euthanize her due to her injuries.  It was about 10:00 PM when this occurred.  In addition to the comments above, she also told us “besides, you only have a year left with her at best”. REALLY????

I insisted on a second opinion, not because of the prognosis, but because Dr. Buxton’s lack of ability to be open-minded.   And here’s a tip Buxton:  If you sign up for weekend emergency room work, you may have to stay late and skip supper to care for the animals.

The next morning, we took Daisy to Dr. Galbraith, an angel on Earth, in Pulaski, Tennessee.   Dr. Galbraith stated that Daisy might eventually have to be euthanized, but we wouldn’t know for 48-72 hours.  Daisy stayed with Dr. Galbraith about a week and is now home and fully recovered.

This is not an indictment on Wall Triana Animal Hospital itself.  If you do patronize this establishment, then I would just ensure that you choose another of their doctors.

How sad if we would have listened to this lady’s advice..

How many other pets has she needlessly euthanized?

Dismayed,

Daren Carter

text: Today was our second visit to this clinic. We took our new puppy Priscilla in. The assistant was outstanding as she was the first time. name: CBowman
text: This is the worst place to take a animal in a emergency, he flat out lied about what he was going to do to take care of our baby and what little bit he did do he did a half way job. We left straight from his office after he charged us a large amount and left our baby in a kennel all day bleeding and suffering we went straight to another vet that tried everything they could to save her and without knowing what all this man had done she talked about the grass and debris she was pulling out of her wounds that he supposedly cleaned. He talks down to the owners of the pets so I hate to think what our girl went through when we left thinking she was going to surgery, she was not given anything for pain she didn't have the first stitch in her and he released her with all her wounds open and bleeding, the other vet spent over 3 hours stitching her up and closing wounds, that's how bad she was and he released her like that, and if you still choose to use the vet you should know his anti inflammatory shot he gives combined with the other two he routinely gives causes ulcers in the stomach or shut the kidneys and liver down. This man is a lier and if it was possible I would give negative stars -*****

name: Rebecca Barkey
text: Valley Vet.. First, the place is kinda dirty, run down and stinks! I went there because its convenient to my home, but after several months of using them, its obvious they care more about making money than about your pets health!! I was already displeased about being talked down to when I asked Dr. Leonard about getting my dogs monthly flea/tick and heartworm meds from an online vendor. He told me it would only save me a few dollars, blah blah... but, he seemed to fail to realize that, they are MY dollars!! 4 months later, after paying about $45 a month for her meds through him, I finally decided to place my order through 1800petmeds and pay $60 for a 3 month supply.  Of course, the Rx has to be authorized by your vet, who we just saw less than 2 months ago and had an appointment to see again on the 17th for her final round of puppy shots and to make an appointment for her to be spayed in the coming weeks. After a week has passed, 1800petmeds has faxed them for approval 3x and I have called twice. Finally, they called my husband to say it'll be $18.50 to approve her prescription, and she will need a $25 heartworm test first??? Regardless of the fact that she's been under his regular care since the day I got her at 6 weeks old. I am switching vets. Like, today!!!! I will not be extorted by a cheap, condescending vet who cares more about making a profit off the meds than about the health of my dog. Also, at her last visit, I had her nails trimmed, it was going right along fine when he got to the 8th toenail and all of a sudden she yelped so loud and totally freaked out and he couldn't finish.. but, of course, he didn't cut or hurt her.. she just suddenly got upset.. after calmly letting him cut the first 7 nails!  The ONLY thing I can say positive I can really say about this place is there's a very nice lady that works there on Tuesdays, who seems to care about pet owners and helping them save money while caring for their fur babies.  I used to interact with her alot with my previous pup, who I lost tragically in April, but I haven't seen her much since I got the new one. I'm not sure of her name, but it wasn't the vet, or his wife, who treats my dog like she's just any old anonymous dog... didn't even bother to write her name on the folder containing all the shots, treatment info she sent home, it's just a blank card with no "pet's name" written in the blank. Same with appointment cards.. to them, she's just any random dog. Convenience isn't everything! Go elsewhere!

text: I have been using red barn for years. I always respected the staff and they always doted over Josiah, Sabel and puppies. Since it was time for Josiah’s check up and they offer bathing, we thought no problem and although I have had a bad feeling about the older guy, I knew that the vet and staff had always loved Josiah’s company. They told me to come back after 3, I got there and they said “we can’t see him anymore he’s aggressive?””.. So the guy said you stand in the hall and just listen, I did, yes Joe barked and sounded terrified, the guy left and I went in, my boy melted in my arms, his face and eyes soaked from crying. I walked him out of the clinic by the vet and everyone else but that man, he was fine. Got him in the car, the guy came out, I hit record on my phone, he was screaming profanities and cussing my dog, just had him evaluated by another vet and it shows clear signs that he was abused while in their care. Please, please I don’t care how long you have used them please don’t take them back, Josiah is traumatized and will have to go through therapy and much more to get over this. We have never hurt our animals and I left them with a vet I trusted and she failed.

text:
Dr. Horne has cared for our two male cats for many years. She really listens to our observations and thoughts when a cat isn't feeling good. Dr. Horne cares about our pets, she's kind and gentle. Pip, the orange guy will walk right in to her office (on his leash) and follow the tech into the exam room like he's going to a party!
We really appreciate the care Dr. Horne and her staff provide to our guys.

text: I honestly do not have enough nice things I can say about the people that work here. When I call up there to make my appointments they always ask which veterinarian I would like to see, and I always just say, "Whatever ones available because they're all fantastic!" When you have a lot of rescue babies like I do, it's nice  to know you have some awesome vets available on your speed dial to call on to ask a question or make an emergency trip to visit when needed.  I absolutely love my vet's.

I cannot recommend Weatherly Animal Hospital enough.

text: The only reason for the 4 star instead of 5 star is that we thought they were very expensive.  We had contact with two of the three vets who cover the clinic and both were very nice and caring.

text: Our puppy has been well provided for over the last 7 years is life. Without Jill in the crew he would be lost. They took care of every concern and the concerns became their own. They are part of the puppy family!

name: Lori Smith
text: We recently moved to Pelham from Ohio, and chose this clinic based on proximity to our home more than anything. What a lucky choice that was! We had a minor emergency with one of our dogs, then a much more serious situation with the other within a month of moving here. The entire staff was helpful, compassionate, and kind, and I feel like our pets are receiving top notch care. Highly recommended.

name: Beth C
text: The staff was kind and professional, the doctor was as well - and he understood my limited income issue. The facility is very clean and smells like stepping into someone's home, not some smelly pet place or overly sanitized hospital.

name: Holly Kinney
text:
I do not typically write reviews, but I was genuinely distressed about the negative review written Ms. Jacoby. I am sorry about her ill pet; I know this is always stressful. However, I have to believe that this was merely a misunderstanding by someone with limited experience at this clinic. We have taken all of our pets to Weatherly Animal Hospital in Alabaster for more than 15 years and have always received exceptional care. They were amazingly compassionate when our elderly dog had to be put to sleep, and were literally there holding our hand through the whole thing. Additionally, we board our dogs there when we go on vacation---which believe me---requires a great deal of trust!

I assume that Ms. Jacoby was referring to Michelle when she talked about the 'receptionist'. Michelle is the office manager, and even more than being a professional, she has always proven to be a compassionate individual with a house full of her own pets. Again, I have to assume that there was a miscommunication problem.

I hope that others with medical emergencies or those looking for a safe, compassionate practice to take care of their pets will give Weatherly a chance. They say that they think of themselves as the 'other' family doctor, and I believe them.

name: Matthew Burford
text: Nice location in Alabaster.  Nice knowledgeable staff.

name: Dianne Scott
text: Great docs and staff.

name: Bethany Johnson
text: So amazing

name: laura jacoby
text: When we visited this clinic, our dog was x-rayed by Dr. Leedy and we were told he more-than-likely had terminal cancer.  She told us Dr. Brunner would review the x-rays and give us a call with a second opinion.  I didn't receive a call, but when I followed up the next week, Dr. Brunner acted as though he had never reviewed the x-rays and basically read me Dr. Leedy's notes.  We had to take our dog back when he became unable to walk and Dr. Leedy was very nice, but when I mentioned our unhappiness with Dr. Brunner and how we felt he did not take the time to adequately review the x-rays, the receptionist became defensive and basically called me a liar.  As someone with a dying family pet with no hope of getting better, we were less than happy with the clinc's obscene lack of compassion.  Dr. Leedy was nice enough, but we have opted to switch to a farther away, more expensive clinic because they just seem to care more.

name: Lori Covington-Strouss
text:
I use both the Weatherly and Southlake clinics depending on where my day takes me. I have had nothing but wonderful experiences at both locations. The staff always know my pets by name and always have time to explain everything to me concerning my pets care. I'm a pet Mom of two cats, one of whom is diabetic and has been for 4 years now - thanks to great care he is doing wonderful. I also have two dogs and one of them suffers from allergies - he gets lots of love and care at the clinic plus they call on a regular basis just to check and see that he is doing ok.

Last year,  we had to put our 15 year old dog down, the compassion and care we received at the Southlake clinic made our experience so much easier.
Our pets will be patients of the Weatherly & Southlake clinics for life.

From Syrius, Evie, Kovu, Mika, Lori & Bart - Thank You !!!!

name: Terri Tipton
text: It's not #10, "Very Likely" that I will recommend North Blount Animal Hospital, it is, "I Will Recommend." I travel 2 hours to bring my pets back to Dr. Angel Brothers. I love my pets and I need to know that the vet I go to loves them as well and will provide quality care for them. Dr. Angel, as I call her, not only knows her "stuff” and knows it well, she provides compassionate care of the highest quality and will share information I need to know openly and honestly. She has helped me through many situations with my pets and I am so grateful. You will be hard-pressed to find another vet like her.

resp.text: Thank you, Terri! I am so honored that you travel the distance that you do to let me care for your pets. It is always a pleasure!

text: Dr. Brothers and her entire staff are the absolute BEST! They are knowledgeable, efficient, responsive and caring. And, did I mention welcoming, compassionate and helpful? I would recommend Dr. Brothers and North Blount Animal Hospital to anyone for the care of their four-legged family members. They will treat them as if they were their own!

name: jason everett
text: Doctor Brothers and her staff are the only vets that I truly trust in North Alabama. The have been caring and compassionate on the many occasions that I’ve had our pets in. We have had everything from first shots and spays/ neuters to cancer checks( tumor removed/ benign (thank God) to end of life care. They have celebrated with us, guided us, and cried with us. My new adopted shepherd will be in for a visit as soon as we can. Not for treatment (the animal shelter that we got her from has to handle a few things first) but just to meet them.( When it is time for more shots, she’ll be at Dr Brothers.) Just because they will be as happy for us as we are. They are truly caring individuals that I would recommend to anyone looking for a great vet.

name: Becky Garren
text: I have been taking my beloved pets to Dr. Brothers since she first opened her clinic.  She is one of the most compassionate vets I have ever met.  She has shared laughs in the good times and has shared tears in the sad times.  Dr. Brothers and her staff are wonderful.  I can always count on excellent care when my furbabies need medical attention.  Thanks for all you do!

resp.text: Thank you so much ❤️!

name: Pamela Williams
text:
Dr Brothers and her staff are caring, kind people who are as concerned for their clients as they are their animal patients. The office runs smoothly and I never am rushed through appointments. I know that Dr Brothers will discuss options for my dog or cat’s care. She leaves the choice for me to make and never makes me feel wrong in that choice. I know personally she cares for both people and pets as she has helped me with many hard decisions during the last year with the loss of beloved 3 elder dogs. One of those dogs had a stroke three days before my husband died of brain cancer. She dealt with my hysteria, my pain, and terror with gentleness, understanding, and compassion. She took care of my dog as if he were her own. She truly has a big heart.
Thank you Dr Brothers and your staff

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to share such kind thoughts.♥️

name: Tracy P
text: This is seriously a great place. All four of our “rescue” pets have had a somewhat difficult past and require a little more than average care. On our first visit we got there a few minutes early with our two dogs and two cats and in no time at all they were seeing Doctor Brothers... so... no waiting!! All our fur babies loved her and the dogs were laying at her feet not long after being seen and the cats were at ease too. They got their shots and blood draws, she diagnosed and prescribed meds for a yeast infection in one of our cat's ears that was previously undetected for years and found a hernia and a tumor in our newest dog’s abdomen. A week or so later she repaired the hernia and removed the tumor, spayed her and pulled four broken/bad teeth and now she’s doing just fine. She is VERY happy and active now and actually runs and plays. We love Dr. Brothers, we really love her and her office staff too! Excellent care at reasonable prices!! Thank you!! - Sherri & Tracy

resp.text: Thank you so much for the kind words. We are grateful to have you and look forward to many years with you and your pets!

name: Lisa Mcgill
text:
Very professional veterinarian. Dr. Brothers first impressed me when she called me herself to let me know how the outcome of surgery went. The staff did not call. She personally took the time to let me know that my fur baby was ok. That meant a lot and still does. That was many many years ago. I have taken my cats,kittens, puppies, and dogs for everything from spaying,  neaurtering,  shots, flea and tick treatment.  There have been a couple of my babies that had to be euthanized,  but she did everything she could to prevent that. Her facility is always clean and the staff is always nice. Dr. Brothers is excellent at her job. I am grateful for her and I am so glad she is close by. I have an appointment for a momma cat to be fixed in January 2020 and I can bet you, when surgery is over, she will call. Thank you everyone
at North Blount Animal Hospital for the way you care.

resp.text: Thank you for your complimentary comments and great loyalty!

text: Dr. Brothers and the entire staff are amazing! Most friendly, thoughtful and informative folks I've encountered! I can't imagine the experience could be even better than it has been for our family and pets!

name: Lori Criswell
text: We have used Dr. Brothers and her staff for several different animals and many different services.  Most of our animals are rescued animals.  One particular story is about Marty McFly.  I was working at a client's office and took a puppy that was in the street.  I ended up having to leave the client's office early because of the puppy.  On the way, I called to see if they could fit me in because I knew the puppy needed to be seen.  They made room for Marty, who was worm infested, flea infested, and malnourished.  Thanks to Dr. Brothers and her staff, Marty McFly is a thriving one-year old!  Dr. Brothers has also had to be there at the end of life of some of my animals, and she does it with the utmost care and concern; it seems as if they are her animals, too.  I really can't say enough about the great service we have received!

name: Abby Ingram
text: My “Sweet Dixie” had a stroke around 6:30am on a snowy Friday morning. I left a message on emergency line, halfway expecting no response due to the weather. Dr. Brothers called me back quickly and had me bring Dixie to the office. Dixie was seen immediately upon arrival. Dr. Brothers and her staff were very knowledgeable and compassionate about our situation. I was convinced we would be putting Dixie to sleep that day, but after going over options DrB recommended us try medication for a few days and reevaluate. Each day Dixie significantly improved. 6 days later she’s back to her spoiled rotten self. I’m thankful for DrB’s knowledge and advice because it has given my family more time with our “Sweet Dixie.”

resp.text: We are soooo glad Dixie responded as well as she did! Thank you for the kind praise. Having Dixie around longer makes us happy, too!

resp.text: The FTC and federal laws prohibit price setting. Therefore, we do not discuss cost of services with other animal hospitals. However, statements made from clients coming from other practices indicate that we are very competitive and sometimes lower, compared to other practices in our area. Perhaps your perception does not reflect a comparison of exactly equal services? At any rate, we are always happy to provide estimates for services before they are performed and routinely give them for any higher cost procedures.

name: Amy Markt
text: If this is your only option still don’t use this vet. He is rude and unprofessional. I have been getting a prescription for Revolution from this clinic for years, from Dr. Shelnutt. This vet would not sign the order from 1800petmeds or give a verbal order. He did write a prescription that I have to mail in. So something that should take 30 seconds will take days. Also, he recommended that I not give my puppy heart worm prevention until he is 6 months old in order to save money! I will NEVER take another animal there....

name: Grace McManus
text:
I have a mutt puppy that I’ve been taking here since I got him at 8 weeks. My experience has been overwhelmingly positive, and the vet is extremely knowledgeable. The prices are also very reasonable! Results may vary, of course, but these approximate prices (give or take $1) are based on my puppy who was 4 lbs at 8 weeks old, 8lbs at 12 weeks old, and 12 lbs at 16 weeks old.

Each set of his puppy shots was about $28 each and the rabies shot was $14, and each time I went they also did a wellness exam for about $12. So, less than $150 for all 3 rounds of shots + rabies vaccine, along with a visual exam each time. A test for worms was $18, and his microchipping was $53.

When I had a list of questions written down and sent in with my pup during one of his checkups (renovations made it impossible to go inside), Dr. Baldwin came out to my car and went through each of the bullet points with me. Very professional and thoughtful.

My ONLY complaints are that I often get the “closed” or “busy” messages when I call, especially at around 8-9 in the morning. I don’t blame them though, because I understand that it can be very busy and a lot of people may be calling at that time. I just would be more willing to wait on hold than to try calling back at random intervals. Also, they have no website, which I feel would be helpful to have in this day and age. Those are small complaints, though, and overall I highly recommend this vet.

text: I absolutely love Dr. Tom Harbin! He is the best vet and I actually will drive from Florida to bring my dogs to him if there is anything serious that I can't trust someone else with.  His background is with the excellent Blue Pearl Vet Group, which I am very familiar with, since my dog had to go for specialized treatment in Atlanta.  He is very caring and takes the time to show it and address all your concerns. After surgeries, they actually hold your pet until they are able to wake up and walk around. That made me feel like my pet is important and they care about them and me and it's not just another dog getting surgery or more money in a practice's pocket. I highly recommend him and all the staff I have met there.

text: I have been taking my 2 pups here for years one being an English bulldog so we need things frequently. The staff and doctors are all very professional and accommodating. We have worked with Dr. Golden and Dr. Chandler and they are so caring and take the time to educate you and come up with a plan best for you and your pup. Also, their new system for ordering medications online is very convenient when we can't get by the clinic.

resp.text: Thank you so much for taking your time to write such kind words! We truly appreciate your business and enjoy taking care of your pets!!

resp.text: Thank You

name: Elizabeth Morzuch
text: Dr. Golden is simply the best. I have never encountered such a great, friendly, (pet, human, and toddler) veterinarian before. This man, and by the way his employees operate, is clearly passionate and an expert in his field and customer service. We were only in the area for a short time, but by the time spent and way he interacted with me and my family,  you would think we were long time clients  - or, his family - he cares that much.  The only downside to this experience is that we knew it wasn't forever as our lives keep us constantly moving. I was heartbroken that we had to leave the area. Golden Animal Hospital is just top-notch.

resp.text: Thank you so much for your kind words!!  We take great pride in treating our pet parents and pet patients like family!!!

name: Kati Ballard
text:
My dog got out of my yard and run over by a car a few weeks ago.. and because of the amazing people at Golden Animal Hospital, I have my girl back home and healing well! The love for my furbaby that these people showed is out of this world. From Jamie texting me to just check in, to Dr. Harbin who took her home with him to be sure she made it through the night. I have cried tears of sadness and joy with the staff at Golden and would highly recommend them to anyone looking for a vets office that will treat you and your babies as family.
Thank you again to everyone at Golden for making it possible for me to still have my Sookah ❤🐶

resp.text: Thank you so much for your review!  We are thrilled with Sookah’s recovery and look forward to seeing her sweet face for many more years to come!!!

I have a maltese/yorkie (male) named "Tinker Tot" who loves Dr. Golden and all of his staff, especially "Michelle and Brook".  They have always answered all of my questions and made scheduling for Dr. Golden and Grooming services a breeze.  My name is Pamela Polke and my companion is Tinker Tot and we both recommend Golden Animal Hospital.

text: I have tried to get a referral for my dog to Auburn for a cancerous tumor. I have been given the run around, first it was Wednesday, then call back on Friday, and now Monday. Getting impatient and upset.

name: Qingfeng Chen
text:
(Translated by Google) I wonder if you remember iris? Yesterday, her amniotic fluid broke at about 1:35 pm. We called you around 5:30 pm to find out if her condition is normal. Your doctor is very sure to tell us not to worry. It will be around 1:30 in the evening. It ’s been 12 hours. When I called your doctor again and left a phone number for us, we called for a long time before contacting your doctor, but he still said everything was normal. He only helped to find the contact method of the pet emergency room, but during the two prenatal inspections of iris before, we twice asked you to help us find a contact method for the emergency room. You said that even if there is a problem, you can do it at night Calling you, you also have an emergency room at night, saying that she will have no problems with the second production. Even if there is a problem, you can help me at night. I believe you, because Iris has been here to check with you . But last night when we needed you most, I took a long time to contact you. I also thank you for helping me find the emergency room contact method at the end, but just when we were going to see the emergency department When Iris left us, I always wondered why during the two prenatal check-ups, we asked for an emergency room contact method. You only gave me your outpatient phone number, and I remember I told you that It ’s just that Iris can contact the doctor who can help her when the 1% you said needs the doctor ’s help. You said you can help her even at night, but when Iris needs the doctor ’s help most, where are you , Did you know that because we spent the time to rescue her in the most urgent time, if you can help me find the emergency room contact method, at least Iris still has the hope of survival, and May continue to be with us. Do you know that iris is like our daughter in our hearts? Do you know how helpless we are when we watch iris walk away in front of us? I want to ask you Where is the night emergency? I want to ask if your commitment is really so worth mentioning? Iris just had her two-year-old birthday last month. She is still so young, and the baby in her stomach has a total of 9 lives. Just say that it is gone? ?

(Original)
不知道你们还记得iris吗？昨天1:35pm左右她的羊水破了，在5:30pm左右我们打电话给你们，想要了解她的情况是不是正常，你们医生很确定的告诉我们不用担心，等到了晚上1:30左右已经12个小时了当我再一次打给你们医生留个我的电话号码我们打了好几久才联系到你们的医生，但是他还是说一切正常，那时我们已经非常的担心的说了iris的状况下，他才帮忙找宠物急诊室的联系方法，但是在之前iris的两次产前检查的时候，我们两次要求你们帮我们找一个急诊室的联系方法，你们说就算有问题在晚上也可以打电话给你们，你们也有晚上急诊，说她是第二次生产不会有问题的，就算有问题你们也可以帮到我在晚上的时候，我相信你们，因为iris一直到在你们这里检查的。但是在昨晚我们最需要你们的时候，我却花了很长的时间来联系到你们，我也感谢你在最后的时候帮我找到了急诊室的联系方法，但是就在我们准备去看急诊的时候，iris离开了我们，我一直想不明白为什么在两次产前检查的时候，我们要求要一个急诊室的联系方法，你们只给我你们门诊的电话号码，我也记得我告诉你们我只是为了iris在那个你说的1%需要医生帮忙的时候可以及时的联系到可以帮助她的医生，你说你们就算晚上也能帮助她，但是在iris最需要医生的帮助的时候，你们在哪里，你们知不知道就因为在最紧急的时候我们却把救她的时间花在寻找你们，如果当初你们能帮我找到急诊室的联系方法，最起码iris还有还有生还的希望，还有可能继续陪着我们，你们知不知道iris在我们心里就像我们的女儿一样，你们知不知道当我们看着iris在我们面前走掉的时候，我们有多么的无助，我想问一下你们的夜间急诊在哪里？我想问一下你们的承诺真的那么的不值一提吗？iris上个月才刚刚过完两岁生日，她还那么的年轻，还有她肚子的宝宝一共9个生命就这样说没就没了？？

name: Joshua busha
text: Very knowledgeable and friendly. Doesn't push meds or "putting down" pets just because they are old. He sits and talks to you for as long as you need. He really cares and it shows. I fully recommend Dr. G. to take care of your fur babies.

name: Cindy Walton
text: We love bringing our pets to a place that loves them too!  Dr. G is very knowledgeable and kind.  He takes his time to really understand the issue your pet is facing.  This is truly a one of a kind vet clinic!!!

name: Charlotte Landers
text: The vet was informative and good with the animal.

name: anastacia wilburn
text: Excellent doctor, staff, and service.

name: Chris Petris
text: After visiting and working with other veterinarian care facilities in our area we were very happy to find Dr. G. Our elder dog care was handled professionally and with compassion. The staff also shows great concern and care.

name: Maria Jay
text: We loved the Vet and and his staff.   They are amazing with animals and very welcoming.   They also take time to answer questions.     Great place and very local to us.

name: Barbara Townsend
text: The best place to get excellent care for the fur babies. Dr G and his staff are fantastic

name: Renae WinterWoman
text: Seriously the best vet team around.  Having moved over 20 times, and dealing with many vets, we appreciate excellence when we see it.  This compassionate, knowledgeable couple is fantastic  and takes its time with ensuring that the animal is not stressed before they examine.  Their advice is solid and yes, prices are very reasonable, indeed.  They practice medicine the way it should always be done:  With knowledge AND love.  Cannot recommend them highly enough!

name: Charles Long
text: My mom's boxer-mix was found with multiple puncture wounds from a dog attack. Dr. G and Julie took her in at 4pm this past Saturday. One of her muscles had been bitten through entirely. She was bloody and in a awfully pitiful condition. She was so anxious on our ride to Dr. G's, breathing heavily, obviously traumatized. She was given pain medication, stabilized, and then taken into surgery where her wounds were sutured and her muscle reattached. Julie and Dr. G stayed up with my mom's pup until 11:30 that night, several hours after her surgery. She is now at home recovering well. She is curled up on a warm couch by the fireplace. It will be a few weeks before she can use her right front leg again, but her spirit suffered little damage. She is encouraged and at ease, Thanks to Julie and Dr. G. ... My mother is glad to have her back home, but I would be lying if I told you she wasn't worried about how much her care would cost. I was worried too. We don't have bunches of money. How about there were no emergency charges. The care was more affordable than I can tell you. These people have true compassion and live by principle. It was inspiring to be treated with love and to see our pup taken care of.

name: Dalton George
text: Stopped to pick up flea killing medicine that the dog can eat like a peanut butter ball post last for a month 3 week still great 4th week you could tell was fading for 12 dollars great product

name: Behumble 94
text: Took my pup to them on a Saturday afternoon. He was so comfortable and so was my daughter . They are very sweet and make you feel right at home. Its like your at home instead of a vet office. Really nice couple. We left will all smiles and very satisfied will definitely go back highly recommended!

name: Sandra Gilbert
text: Dr. G and Julie are GREAT! I have a very aggressive and unsocial miniature dachshund, who was ruined by another vet office years ago. He has been in social classes and other training classes that did not work! I spent a ton of money trying to “fix” him. Very few vets have been able to work on him, which makes it very hard for the allergy and anxiety issues he has. I explained to Dr. G all about our problems and he had a plan right away. I was worried Klaus would bite him. Dr. G told me not to worry. I was blown away on how he handled him. First by informing me to come in and sit on the couch and then he approached sitting on the floor next to Klaus- not looking at him but talking to me about him. Then casually touching him- still not looking at him. He instructed me to stand up and hand him Klaus! Klaus never seemed to mind it and then he examined him in a very kind manner still talking to me. I’ve never seen anything like it. Dr. G and Julie patiently worked on Klaus and he never growled or tried to bite them. IT WAS AMAZING! It was a great experience for us! With Dr. G’s plan my mom’s visit this time has been a SUCCESS! We had no issues and they are best friends! He sleeps on her lap and plays ball with her! ( he bite her last time she came)I want to thank Dr. G and Julie for everything they do and will continue to do for us! If you have a pet, take the time to call them, they are GREAT! I’m very pleased to call them my friends!

name: Sandra Gilbert
text: Dr. G and Julie are GREAT! I have a very aggressive and unsocial miniature dachshund, who was ruined by another vet office years ago. name: 2xperthands
text: A little drive, great results!

name: Kathryn Dalenberg
text: My cat Alex has an inoperable cancer.  When the cancer began causing him to have difficulty breathing due to excessive mucous, I took him to High Falls Holistic Veterinary Care.  Dr. G prescribed medicine for the mucous and Hoxsey for the cancer.  Alex is doing so well with the medication, he even has "running through the house spells" and play time spells with his feline siblings. Pretty amazing for a cat who has a terminal condition, I think.   I am very pleased with High Falls Holistic Veterinary Care.

name: Rebekah Mikell
text: Dr. G and Julie are the best around.  They truly have a heart and compassion for animals.  I love that they use traditional medicine and natural/holistic treatment also.  Dr. G is very knowledgeable and thorough with his treatments.  We are super excited to have them available to us and our 5 dogs.

name: Lynn Shelhart
text: Dr. G and Julie are very kind, caring wonderful people. Anyone who truly loves their pets , will love them too.

name: Stephanie Urquhart
text: This is what every veterinary office should strive to become. Very relaxed atmosphere that I greatly appreciate because our dog has special needs. Dr. G and Julie take the time to really talk with you and get to know what your goals are for your pet. Dr. G and Julie are very knowledgeable, prices are very reasonable, and I honestly could not be happier about the care our pup is getting. I highly recommend High Falls Veterinary Care!

name: Darrien Marx
text: Absalutely Amazing place. My dog was attacked by 2 dogs a few yrs ago. This is our 2 nd visit with Dr G and Julie. My Sophie Absalutely Loves them both. Other vets had to muzzle her because she has trust issues! They both are Caring, Compassionate, Understanding, they listen and discuss options and solutions but most importantly they do what's best for your animal! Now they are Unce Dr G and Auntie Julie to my Sophie! In my yrs of going to any vet...No one and I mean not 1 vet has ever spent an Hour with my dog!  My Sophie needs NO Muzzle because Dr G and Julie make my dog feel comfortable and she trusts them! This is HUGE because of her dog attack. Just 2 visits and my dog Loves them both! The Atmosphere is Excellent! My dog isn't anxious nervous or anything. I love the fact there are no other animals in the waiting room . They put you in a Beautiful clean waiting room. Love the colors and decor.  Lol I'm just so very Blessed that a neighbor introduced me to them both! I wish I could give them both 10 STARS!  I HIGHLY Reccomend this place!!! I was trying to find my post from our first visit last month. Can't find it.  Out first visit was Every bit as Amazing if not more. I wish there more vets out there like Dr G and Julie. FANTASTIC PEOPLE!

name: Heather Bouldin
text: We can never thank Dr G and Julie enough! They are wonderful caring people. They show genuine concern and love for your animal. Our Liza is 4 months old. We were outside and a car that was speeding came thru and never stopped. It happened so fast. It was scary and Dr G and Julie were great with her. It’s been 2 weeks since the incident and you would never know she was hit. We used medications but also used herbs. The herbs we boiled as tea and made a warm compress and also she drank it. It helped with pain, swelling and we also used a salve on a very bad gash. We tried Antibiotic cream and considered surgery but decided to try and let it heal. It was really bad. The first night we used the salve and by morning you could already see it was healing. This was a week after the incident. It healed from the inside out. We were amazed and can not believe at how quickly she healed. The love and knowledge they put into her care really is remarkable. It’s not your average put them on the exam table type facility. It has a home feel to it. We were comfortable and so was she. I highly recommend them to anyone! As long as they are here, my animals will be their patients. It’s really hard to find a place like this where they actually care and offer competitive pricing. Very friendly, even to my very curious 4 year old daughter. They will explain every detail and answer any questions you have without making you feel uncomfortable, or like it’s a dumb question. Go check them out and I don’t think you will be disappointed!!

resp.text: Thank you for your kindness🙏🙏🙏

name: Jennifer Dart
text: Dr. G and Julie are the best! They are great at listening to your needs and tailoring their care to meet your situation. Our cat is the official patient when we come to visit, but they are so helpful and informative with regard to our farm animals as well! I actually had an injured duck a few months ago. They coached me through her recovery process, even though they normally stick to cats and dogs. They genuinely care about all creatures, and it shows in the kindness and respect they give to everyone who comes in. Sometimes the kids and I even find ourselves having deep philosophical discussions with them over the kitty's exam. We wouldn't go anywhere else!

name: Cindy Clardy
text: Very intelligent, friendly, caring & thinks outside the box. Love them!

name: Rachel Ford
text: High Falls is by far the best vet experience!!! I love they fact that they actually take time to get to know the animal and aren't in a rush. My dog was in constant pain, thought I was going to have to have him put down, but they got him on some meds...took awhile to get the doses just right for him individualy, but now he is great and I am so thankful!!! They keep his meds filled and make sure my Chew is taken care of♥️

name: Herb Neu
text: I have never met a Vet that’s so caring and knowledgeable. This includes nutritional expertise. I live in Grant and High Falls is worth the drive.

name: Debra Whitehead
text: Both Dr. G and Julie were beyond amazing with our little Lexie.  Normally she is scared to death and not relaxed at all.  She was calm and received a through exam like she has never had.  The office is clean, calm and relaxing for both Lexie and myself.  They take the time to get to know your pet and you.  Get experience and our new vet. Thank you for caring and being here!!!

name: Triscia Young
text: Such compassionate people and treat your animal as their own.

name: Brandon Porier
text: Amazing vet! Caring for animals and the people themselves. Very home like atmosphere, and comfortable for the animals. I wish there were more vets like this.

name: Susanna Lopez
text: I would definitely recommend High Falls Veterinary Care they went above and beyond for my son’s dog 🐕. We took my son’s dog on a Thursday afternoon at 5 o’clock and they close at 7, they stayed late that night just for our Gru. They were in touch with us every bit of the way with our dog Gru.

name: Andrea Holbrook

resp.text: Thanks so much for taking the time to write a note. We try to treat the four legged and the two legged ones walking through our door as cherished guests. It feels really good when someone notices😸😸🙏

name: Joaquin Hernandez
text: Wonderful people with a true love of animals and a gift to comfort and treat with love. I definitely recommend High Falls veterinary clinic!

name: Steven Silas
text: Great people really caring about the animals

name: Kellie Lock
text: Dr G and Julie are fantastic!

name: Tania Mikell
text: Great place!

name: zachary duplechain
text: I just moved to this area a year ago. I have been in search of a reliable and homey feel clinic in this area and stumbled across these wonderful people. I’m in the process of breeding one of my French bulldogs and they have treated me like family since the moment I spoke with them on the phone. I am very picky and this process can be very time sensitive and they have worked with me every step of the way. It feels good to know I have my dog and future puppies in good hands.

resp.text: Thank you, Zachary. We strive to make everyone feel welcomed and like family.  We care for all our patients like they were our own.  We can’t wait to see and love on all the sweet puppies!!

name: Shannon
text:
We have always had a good experience here. They truly care for our pets and help us through any problems with care and concern.
One of our dogs has terrible allergies and has to go in often, Dr. Belue takes great care with her and has done everything possible to help make her more comfortable. Very wonderful staff and I highly recommend their care.

resp.text: Thank you for the 5 stars, Shannon! We are so glad you enjoy your visits here! We appreciate your business and are always here if you need anything!

name: Michael Darrough
text: My 2-year old Bulldog (Rebel) have gotten real sick.  She must have gotten into something and now we have a "bad bowel movements".  We tried to take care of her at home but couldn't waste anymore time.  We called Paradise Animal Hospital and Hanna was very caring and sympathetic the whole time on the phone.  Based upon my work schedule and in Decatur, I couldn't make it for that day but for the next.  Overnight, Rebel gotten really bad.  They were able to get Rebel in first thing that next morning.  Dr. Mitch Belue and the staff were wonderful and spent so much time with Rebel. Dr. Belue sat on the floor and treated Rebel like his own puppy. I truly believe she is on her way to recovery due to the treatment, experience and care from Paradise Animal Hospital.  This is top notch staff and facility.  Highly recommend this team!

resp.text: Thank you for choosing Paradise Animal Hospital and taking the time to leave us a review! It was a pleasure meeting you and Rebel! Our team is here if there's anything you need!

name: Kelly Bowyer
text: Doctor was thorough, patient and heeded my concerns about our 13 year old Boston Terrier. Initial annual exam, the vet took over an hour.  So glad we moved to Paradise Animal Hospital. Our last vet averaged less than 5 minutes in the room for a senior dog with multiple issues.

resp.text: Thank you, Kelly.  We are so glad you enjoyed your visit here.  Dr Belue tries to make sure he gives each patient the time they need so he can provide the best treatment for your pet.  Our team is here if there's anything you need!

name: Stephanie Nowak
text:
Dr. Belue and staff are amazing. When we first moved to Alabama last year we were recommended to a vet whom I was never really comfortable with, so when Paradise opened the vet office next to the daycare, I thought why not. I took my old sassy cat and wished them luck when they approached her - she made me look like a fool - she purred and was so friendly to Dr. Belue and the tech, my mouth dropped to the floor! She’s never friendly to anyone- ha! They are definitely the pet whisper.
Since - I have been back with my other pets and we are always greeted with a smile and the staff does their due diligence to make sure my pets are treated to the best of their ability and a few times there has even been calls after the fact as the problem required some additional research.
When people ask for vet recommendations I always  recommend Dr. Belue and his staff!

resp.text: Thank you, Stephanie! We appreciate your kind words and are glad to have you as a client!

name: Destry Webster
text: Amazing service from the front door to the exam rooms.  Everyone is extremely friendly and treated us like family.  They were so good with my animals and took the time to get to know them and me.  Can not say enough good things about this place!

resp.text: Destry, we really appreciate your kind words.  We are so glad you felt at home and were pleased with your visit.  We really do love them like you do!  We are here if you need us for anything!

name: Ryan Christopher
text: Hands down the best vet experience I've ever had.  My partner and I had to take our dog here on a road trip. Dr. Mitch and the staff were absolutely wonderful.  Not only was their dogside manner top-notch, but they were extremely thorough and patient with our scared pup, while ensuring they listened carefully to all background information.  I really can't say enough about how exceptional this place is.  I'd consider flying in just to take our little girl here if there were a major issue. They are that great.

resp.text: Wow! Ryan, what a kind and thoughtful review.  Our goal is to make every client feel welcomed and to give every pet all the time and attention they need.  To say that you would consider flying back to see us for something major, means the world to us.  Thanks again and hope your sweet pup is doing much better.  We are here if you are ever in the area again and need us!!

name: Michelle Coe
text: Great care for my special dog!  The staff are extremely friendly and knowledgeable.

resp.text: Thank you so much, Michelle.  We appreciate your business and are always here if you need anything!!

name: Cesar Calderon
text: There are the best team I have ever met, they help me a lot with my dog all the way to the end. Thank you for your time and kindness Dr.Belue and Dr.Gill for the comfort until my dog last breath.

resp.text: Thank you so much for your kind words.  We can never keep them long enough! You are in our thoughts and prayers.

name: AJ S
text: Dr Belue did very well with my pets. My oldest dog had went off his food.  He spent all weekend trying to coax him to eat.   The cats were taken good care of and my new fur baby puppy is going to him.  I am very happy with care they all get with this veterinarian.  I recommend him.  His staff is very friendly and nice.

resp.text: Thank you so much for taking the time to review us.  We appreciate your kind words:)  We look forward to meeting all your fur babies!

name: Peluche
text: Dr. Belue is one of the best doctors we had a chance to work with. He helped us alot with our German Shepherd problems and helped us. Thank you so much Dr. Belue for everything you did for Abby.

resp.text: Thank you so much for taking the time to review us.  It was our pleasure meeting Abby.  We are here for you if we can help with anything in the future.

name: Brandalon mcclure
text: I can't say enough good things about Dr. Belue and his staff.  They are very professional and courteous.  Dr. Belue spent a lot of time with my babies and made sure that all my questions and concerns were addressed.  He took his time and made every effort to make sure that my animals were comfortable with him and his staff.  I live in Muscle Shoals, AL and it is worth the drive to Dr. Belue's office for the care my babies receive.

resp.text: What an awesome review!  We are so happy to hear it.  Thank you for making the drive to let us take care of your babies.  We're glad to have you as a client.

name: Kelsey Hogan
text: I have brought both of my dogs to see Dr. Belue, he is an amazing vet and one of the best in North Alabama! He and his staff were all super friendly and helpful. They answered every question and concern I had! Highly recommend Dr. Belue and his staff!

resp.text: Thank you for your taking the time to review us.  We are glad to have you as a client.  Looking forward to working with you in the future.

name: Mike Swafford
text: Great bunch of folks!

resp.text: Thanks so much for your kind words, Mike!

name: Dennis Gilliam
text: My wife and I were in the area for a few weeks and we had our dog with us. We used the Paradise Pet Resort for day boarding while we were at work. It was an amazing experience, all the staff were extremely friendly! I was most impressed that all of the dogs ran to the staff when owners dropped them off. They all seemed so excited. While we were there our dog fell ill. The Animal Hospital was so helpful and was able to diagnose our pup quickly and get him back on the mend. We have already told others we would definitely use them again and feel better about coming to Huntsville for extended stays. Definitely recommend.

name: Sam Wilkinsn
text: Cat clinic. Not dogs.

name: Craftalinc Creatives Crystal Lamb
text: They showed my cat, Simba a lot of care and compassion the week he was there. When I accidentally left his antibiotics there, they brought them to my house because he needed them. I'll definitely use them for all my veterinary needs!

text: We called several times and They told me and daughter that they never had her dog when she went missing, but low and behold I go online and there she is. And then they name her MOLLY!!... Then they adopted her out!!! That's ok. Good does not like ugly!

text: Don't be deceived by outward appearance. This veterinarian hospital is top notch and inexpensive compared to other veterinarians in the area. I have boarded my pet there for several years with no injuries or illnesses. They give him the food that I send with him. He had his teeth cleaned yesterday and the cost was substantially lower than the going rate.

name: Amber
text: Absolutely horrible experience. The vet told me to give her some syrup to help her low blood sugar, and then all would be fine. When it started getting worse, the vet refused to do blood work on my dog, and said it was “female problems”, but when she started having seizures, I took her to another vet. Come to find out, her breed has low blood sugar as puppies, and her organs had ended up failing, and we put her to sleep. Would not recommend.

name: Diane Siniard
text: Front desk is great. Too quick to put animals to sleep when owners aren't found.

name: courtney riley
text: They don’t let you go back and see the animals. Seems to me like they are probably living in dirty inhumane conditions. Adoption fees are high and I was forced to use there clinic to spay my cat when I wanted to use my better cheaper vet. They don’t vet the animals until after you adopt them which isn’t healthy for any of the animals there. The staff seemed nice but the environment was dingy and unprofessional. I don’t know how they get business as a vet clinic. I think people only adopt from the shelter so that the animals won’t be put down. Overall it’s a sad place and I appreciate the little help that they try to give to these animals but something better needs to be done with this facility

name: Elisabeth Ellis
text: Horrible and rude Vet,  I have a friend from the Dothan area who works with rescue in that area and she had for years. She went to Colony Vet and tried to talk to them about contacting her before they put dogs down she would come get them. They have kennels, vans to transport dogs, people who help care for them till transport to new homes . Colony was very ugly wanted huge amount of money for each dog. Now you tell me why it was better to put dogs down instead of contacting a reputable rescue and letting them find homes?

name: Lisa
text: We took our 3 dogs to Dr. Flowers and he was great with all of them. One of our dogs was very sick and the emergency vets office wanted to charge several thousand dollars to run tests. Dr. Flowers ran one test and got us a diagnosis and treatment that worked. He was also very available to answer our questions and even was willing to come back from his vacation early to take care of our sick dog during closed hours. He is a nice and friendly vet with a lot of care and compassion for our animals. I highly recommend him.

name: Jessica Wetherbee
text: I brought a puppy here last Tuesday that was diagnosed with parvo, they sent us home with medication and she still ended up passing away the next day. Then I had my other puppy start showing symptoms and when I called them they told me to go ahead and bring her in and then about three minutes before I arrived they called me and said that the doctor said he was going to be gone all weekend so he was not going to test her for parvo. They gave her a shot for nausea and send her home after telling me that she didn't look like she had parvo. 3 days later she was still sick so I called them back explain the situation and how dire it was that she got hydrated they told me that because she had an appointment the next day to just wait till the following day to bring her, that would have been four days in on not eating or drinking. I am very disappointed in this place I truly thought that they loved animals but they didn't even give my puppy a chance each time I would call them about her they would call me right back and explain why they could not do whatever it was I was asking. I pay in full every time so it's not even like I have a bill there, this used to be the place I referred everyone too but not anymore. I called central Baldwin and they told me bring her in immediately and now she is being well taken care of!!

name: Trenton Wood
text: Our  dog was acting very strange. She was staggering around, and couldn't stand. She was also foaming at the mouth. We suspected poison, so we immediately rushed her here. The next day we found out she had died over night. Dr. Baxter had no explanation, as to why. She didn't have her stomach pumped, or anything. It seemed liked nothing helpful had really been done in attempting to save her life. I feel as though if we had taken her to another vet, she might still be alive, I would not recommend Animal Health Care to anyone.

name: Austin Noakers
text: Would recommend this vet to anyone. They treat our pets just like they are family.

name: Linda Cleveland
text: Everyone very friendly and Chloe my Shi Tzu does not get nervous

name: Brandon McCurry
text: dr baxter and his staff are some of the best most caring kind and compassionate i know i recently lost my little fur child molly he was compassionate kind and caring and thats hard to find in a doctor of any kind if all doctors were the same his staff take incredible care of the animals that come and those that stay in the kennels. dr baxter has a brilliant mind and hes like an expert so i respect and value his advice it was hard to say good bye but molly had an infected uterus and then infection was causing her body to shut down there was nothing anyone could do i hugged him and he left me to make my decision i couldnt just let my baby suffer so we chose to put her to sleep i was allowed to hold her paw and gaze into her eyes as she left this world and entered the spirit world. he then hugged me and his nurse wrapped my baby in her blanket and i brought her home and buried her under her favorite tree. dr baxter sent me a card that helped my mourning and meant alot he said i did the right thing now tell me what doctor would that other than a truly compassionnate person i give 5 stars

text: I've put my precious little babies (chihuahuas) in the most trusting ,caring , healing hands of Dr.Cox & Marilyn since 2002 , I say this cause I mean it , THEY CARE ABOUT U & UR PETS! They are the best I recommend them ,trust them.

name: Nikki Wells
text:
I love CVH . DR. COX is compassionate and truly committed to caring for your companions. My Championship Winning Bloodline pure breed American Akita (Google: Minda Akitas AKC ShowDogs) has been in his care since 8 weeks old. He is healthy and loves Dr. COX. Now that my baby is almost 3 years old, we do HAVE TO MUZZLE him. LOL....  even humans don't like getting shots... LMBO..... Love all the assistants and Dr.Cox. if you are looking for professional care and a knowledgeable professional veterinarian,  I highly recommend Cox Veterinary Hospital.  You will agree.

They take walk ins for last minute 'I FORGOTS' as well as Daytime Emergencies... but you of course have to wait if they are busy, (unless it a  life threatening Emergency.....)with pre scheduled appointments... it is best if you are short on time to make an appointment.  But if not, they will ask you to leave your baby or babies with them and you can pick him/her up after work. They board, give medical baths, treat all types of animals.  I was there once when someone brought in a box full of baby Squirrels.  Cuteness overload !!! He treats Birds, Cats, Dogs, Pigs, Squirrels.... lol... and probably even raccoons.  But I dont know for certain what I do know is he LOVES ANIMALS.
Fir Retail; They have leashes, Collars, prescription Science Diet food - Dry and Wet, Treats and Air fresheners and Candles for sale.  I love the candles.... they do get rid of that animal lives here smell... lol
trust me... it takes 5 hours to bathe and dry my longhaired Akita and Whew.... whew, no one wants to smell Wet dog especially while he is getting a mandatory blow blow dry.

Thank you C.V.H. for loving my Akita even when he is not a happy camper... we love you back....

COX WELL I WILL TELL YOU ALL OF THEM ARE NUTS ! BUT THEY ARE THE BEST IN MY EYES AND U LOVE ALL OF THEM TO THE MOON AND BACK ! THANKS Guys !

name: Debbie Zubia
text:
Do not take your animals here, especially to Dr. Sherry Marrs at the Golden Triangle Veterinary Hospital in Southlake!!  My mom took her precious ten month old maltese to be spayed and have some teeth pulled.  This little baby was the sweetest thing.  She went in for the surgery on Friday with Dr. Marrs. After the surgery, Dr. Marrs placed her on Previcox which, according to the Previcox website should not be given to animals under 12.5 pounds because it is not possible to break the tablets accurately enough for a proper dosage- (My mom's dog is 4 pounds).  After the surgery, she initially she didn't eat, but that was understandable because of having teeth pulled.  On Tuesday (four days later) she was having multiple seizures, couldn't stand up, and wouldn't eat. My mom took her to back to Golden Triangle, and after more tests, they gave her IV fluids and sent her to an emergency room.  They told my mom that her dog most likely had a liver shunt - a birth defect not related to the surgery at all.  After more pricey testing, they discovered the puppy has no liver shunt. You are telling me that it's just coincidental that a perfectly healthy dog had surgery, was given a drug that shouldn't have been given to a dog that small and the side effects including seizures, and four days later has severe neurological issues unrelated to this?  I doubt that. My 78 year old mom is now nursing an invalid puppy that was supposed to bring her joy.
The puppy can't stand up, she bobs her head up and down and does basically nothing more than that.  When she takes her outside, she can't even stand up to go to the bathroom and just goes on herself.  Golden Triangle has done NOTHING to try to help. I am happy to send before and after videos to anyone who asks if it prevents them from going here.

name: mike evans
text: They take great care of our pets. Thank you for saving our dogs life

name: Beth Risse
text: They do an amazing job. They saved my babies. Yes plural.

name: Brian Alexander
text: What started out as a deal that was almost too good to believe turned into a mess that became almost unbelievable. This place wreaks of a business that is growing too fast. The communication between departments is weak at best, the inexperience level became apparent as we got closer to closing and the amount of redundancy in an effort to get to a quick closing was ridiculous. My personal closing was delayed and in that period the complete lack of professionalism led me to pull out altogether and go with a larger, more experienced group. Do not let them fast track your closing. Take your time and go in with your eyes wide open.

name: Rohana Shifflett
text: Well I would not deal with any of their clinics now. Called them as owners of a clinic in Va that I had a bad experience with and no one wants to discuss anything. They allow bad practices within their clinics and hold no one responsible. My 10 week old puppy almost died at a clinic they own and no one wants to rectify or discuss anything. Do your research and know who owns the clinic. Vets who have no stake and are just working for the paycheck are not the people that you want caring for your pets! Look how many clinics they own read and reread reviews before you choose a clinic. There is no care in corporate owned vet practices. I will continue to shout this to the roof tops or until someone does the right thing. BLOCKED ME ON FACEBOOK AFTER POSTING TO THEIR WALL ABOUT ISSUES SINCE NO ONE WILL CALL BACK! WHEN A COMPANY WON'T TAKE REVIEWS OR RESPOND TO ISSUES YOU SHOULDN'T USE THEM! 1/18/2019 UPDATE- NO ONE has reached out to me! The "manager" at the clinic provided me falsified paperwork and resolved nothing. No one from your main office or your Medical Director from Va has called. I have no missed calls or messages from anyone. You all did delete me from Facebook because I am trying to reach out in all the proper channels and can not get any response from anyone concerning this matter. 2/2/2019 Still no phone call from manager as promised.

resp.text: Excellent patient care and client experiences are our top priorities at SVP and our hospitals. Our Manager in Virginia has met with you and spoke with you to hear your concerns and our Medical Director has reached out to you.  We hope to remedy this situation with you.

name: M Murphy
text: I have left four messages for a return phone call to report misconduct at one of their veterinary practices.  A month has gone by and they have yet to figure out how to return a telephone call.  No one ever reached out to me via, phone, email, mail or carrier pigeon.

resp.text: Ms. Murphy - the Regional Medical Director for Virginia reached out to you to discuss your concerns.  We appreciate you bringing your concerns to us as exceptional client experiences and excellent patient care are our top priorities.

text: We were on vacation at Lake Martin and had an emergency with our pup. It was reassuring to find great care even though we were so far from home. Highly recommend Kowaliga Whole Health Pet Care.

name: Traci Bray
text: Recently relocated from Missouri to Alabama with three cats in-tow. We sought an integrative practice, and found a fabulous vet in Dr. Mary Battistella. She and staff are caring, responsive and thorough. I must say that with two of the cats prior to coming to Kowaliga, although they had experienced routine vet care, issues had not received the proper diagnosis - Dr. Battistella not only addressed those but came up with simple solutions resulting in healthier, happier cats. We travel up from Montgomery, and the services and care are well-worth the drive.

Dr. B is also one of very few vets who perform ovary-sparing spays in that general vicinity. I couldn’t recommend Kowaliga enough!

text: I love the care that Willow and Holly get there!  And the place is always so clean which can't be said for most vets!  Dr B and the staff are always friendly,  caring and helpful!!

name: Kathy Gunn
text: Love Dr. Mary Battistella (and staff)!  Found her at a very sad and scary time right after the cancer diagnosis of my dog.  She is very knowledgeable and caring, and I'm so grateful I found her at such a very critical time.  After I chose not to do chemotherapy, but rather a more holistic/natural approach, my dog has done exceptionally well and has had a good quality of life under her direction and care, and she is still doing very well two years later!  I'm so very thankful for "Dr. B" and her staff!  Highly recommend!

name: Mike
text: My pets have been patients at Kowaliga Pet Care for five years.  The employees there are attentive, thorough and caring.  Doctor Mary Battistella has specialized knowledge in holistic healing, nutrition and medical practices.  She is very receptive and accommodating to the individual needs of customers and their animals and has unique training and experience to offer solutions beyond traditional veterinary practices and medicine.  There is also a large play room for animals who stay overnight.

text: I brought two of my dogs for nail trims and check a hot spot on the tail of my other dog. The doctors and techs are wonderful! name: Marc and Karen Werner
text: We have boarded both of our dogs and most recently had them groomed and their semi annual check ups. 1 of our 2 cats that we rescued was showing symptoms of what we thought was allergies, but turned out to be a virus that was quickly found and treated within only a few minutes. The vet called us and explained everything in detail and answered all the questions that we had about treatment of both cats (since they were rescued together). Pricing is extremely fair and the staff is great!

name: Misty Doles-Busic
text: Very happy to find a veterinarian near our home in Helena that is professional, responsive, and good with our fur babies.

name: Kevin Stober
text: All the people at Helena Veterinary Clinic are professional, friendly, and caring about animals. It's very easy to get an appointment and their hours make it possible to drop off and pick up even if you have a busy work schedule. Their prices are very fair for the quality of service for your pet. They are my go to place for my dog (Coco)!

name: Amanda Counts
text: We changed vets after over 25 years and came to Helena Vet. The office manager helped me with getting out 3 dogs records from our previous vet and arranged our pets visits. During the vet visit the Doctor was on the phone with me the entire time (during COVID) - explained everything including the cost for each test and medication. She answered all of my questions honestly and was great to explain everything. My dog suffers from allergies and previously we were not taken very seriously and told to give large doses of Benadryl even though I explained that does not work for her anymore- it never really did. The most vital part was that she helped me with a treatment plan for my dog. At the end of the visit #1 I was not surprised by the bill- she discussed all that with me as we spoke and #2 I knew the all of the next steps. That was a big deal because where we were before I never had a treatment plan and basically we started over every time we came in. The next day Lucy’s skin was not red, hot, and irritated, she wasn’t chewing on her paws and shaking her head, she wasn’t panting and stressing her and everyone around her out. she was relaxed and calm, and sleeping so peacefully- that hasn’t happened in 8 years for her. The doctor even called me back to go over all of her blood work results. I have never been more impressed with a veterinarian clinic. I am actually a little embarrassed that I continued taking my dogs to the previous vet all these years- had I known the level of service that we were missing and the expertise these doctors offer in comparison to what we had grown accustomed to, I would have moved them many years ago. I look forward to many years of quality care for my dogs.

name: Kay Guess
text: Dr. Barnett and the staff at Helena Veterinary Clinic are always so easy to work with and have such compassion for the animals they care for. They explain everything fully, and you leave knowing exactly how to take care of your pet when you get home. Very thankful to have them in Helena!

text: The veterinarian is always very professional and always lets me know any details about my pets visits. The staff there are super kind, would highly recommend others to go to this veterinarian.

name: Kala Bradford
text: We have been taking our sweet fur baby Marlin to this clinic since we got him earlier this year. He's a mischievous little kitten and had to have major surgery this past Friday. I could not be more thankful for this clinic and its amazing, caring and professional staff. I would recommend them to anyone who is looking for a vet for their sweet fur baby. They took care of our Marlin like their own, made sure to keep us updated through the whole process, gave us specific directions for his aftercare and he is now at home healing nicely. We are SO THANKFUL for Helena Vet Clinic and its staff for being so wonderful through this process. You can tell they are all dedicated to making sure all the fur babies are well taken care of!

name: Kelly Benton
text: Everyone was very kind! Doctor Stephens was also very patient with all of my questions and very specific and detailed when he gave me information. I am a new dog owner and had a lot of questions I needed answered for my Doodle Puppy! I also very much like that they will communicate with me via Text Message about whatever I need! Love this place!

name: Chris Parton
text: This is a great clinic! The docs and staff are caring and patient. They have done a great job of adapting to the times during Covid.  Highly recommend!

name: Ashlee Elliott
text: Helena Vet Clinic is above the rest. They have cared for our best buddy since he was 8 weeks old. He is now 7 and has a tremendous amount of allergy issues. They have always been very responsive to his issues, even referring him to a speciality vet when they knew he needed specialized skin treatment. To me that speaks volumes of their professionalism. Dr. Stephens and Dr. Barrett are amazing, as well as Erin and Janet. These are the staff members we interact with most, but every single person we’ve ever encountered there has been like family! We can’t thank them enough for everything they’ve done for caring and treating our Apollo!

name: Donna Robison
text: Very friendly staff, Truly love animals and they take time to make sure every detail is handled.  Available  when you need them.  Definitely would recommend .

name: Jennifer Mamucud
text: Love Helena Vet. They know your pet is family and treat them as such. Very honest and upfront but also compassionate with the bad news.

name: Jennifer Castillo
text: Everyone at Helena Veterinary Clinic was helpful and friendly. They treated Luka as if he was their own. It meant a lot when Christy reached out to ask how Luka was doing after our visit.

name: Donna Robison
text: Very friendly staff, Truly love animals and they take time to make sure every detail is handled.  Available  when you need them.  Definitely would recommend .

name: Stacey Simpson
text: Everyone at Helena Veterinary has just been the best.  We have lived here going on 6 years and have had 5 different pets (4 dogs and a cat) under their care.  Sadly, 2 of our dogs have passed on, but the folks at Helena Vet kept them healthy and happy for as long as possible. Drs. Barnett and Stephens always answer all of our questions, and I've known Karen for as long as we've been using Helena Vet.  She is just so patient and kind and helpful, no matter what is going on.  Janet also has a real heart for animal care and has patiently answered my recent questions about my sweet older dog.  And talk about responsive, they will work with you in any way they can for appointments, medication, whatever the need is. Always return calls. Just can't say enough good things about all of these folks!

name: Joyce Peterson
text: Always a great experience at Helena Vet.  Treat Max like he’s their baby also.

name: Alex Pierce
text: My dog had been attacked.  I pulled into their parking lot. I had no idea they were closed for lunch. They took my dog and saved her!  They managed to keep me updated on every issue.  I can not recommend this practice enough!

name: K Hardy
text: Love Helena Ver! I’ve used them for 20 years! They have always taken great care of my fur babies!! Highly recommend!!

name: Jalie Edmonds
text: Great service, friendly, and take good care of our dog!

name: Rebecca Cannon
text: Dr. Barnett & her team are extremely kind and thoru. They have our girls best interest at heart. Dr. B gave me her time to explain our dogs condition & what the best route to take. Rose, the vet tech, was extremely friendly & clearly loves animals. Even with a mask on, you can tell she was smiling. We will use them again!

name: Pam Malone
text: We are new to Helena. They saw my baby as a work- in, diagnosed her with collapsing trachea and gave me options. She (Theia) is on meds and doing so much better and she’s family to me. I won’t go anywhere else!

Dr Stephens was very knowledgeable with any question I had about raising a puppy. I have only ever had adult dogs. Thank you so much for all of your help! Can't wait to bring my big baby in next!

text:
The nicest of people work there. It seems like they really like their jobs!

For covid: You call if you have when you get there if you have an appointment.

text:
I honestly could not imagine taking my baby anywhere else. I moved about an hour away and refuse to go anywhere else.  Any time we need something, they are so quick to respond or get us in.

Both Dr. Stephens and Dr. Barnett always know what my pup needs and they get her fixed up! The whole staff from Janet to Karen and too many more to name, they are the literal best!!

text: I’ve been to Dr. Barnett twice so far to check on my cat who likes to overgroom and rip open healed wounds. She is always so clear on the best treatment for him and though I don’t like taking him to the vet I know he’s in good hands with her. I recommend Dr. Barnett to anyone in need of a doctor for their fur baby.

name: Debbie Turpin
text: Very prompt on time. Very friendly.  Staff were extremely informative and 8nderstanding.

name: Kelsey
text: I took my pet for his first visit during COVID times. They had drive up service. Registration was easy enough. Sadly, it meant no interaction with the vet. Our previous vet retired and we loved him dearly. The kind of vet that grew up on a farm and loves animals is what I've struggled to find since. I couldn't tell you the vet's name here. My pup was fine when returned to me and is up to date on vaccines so I suppose it's okay.

name: Nathaniel Billings
text: The clinic manager was excellent! Dr. Stephens took so much good care of our little fur baby. I’m happy to drive from Hoover to Helena for Dr. Stephens and his clinic!!!

name: Eric Velez Ruiz
text: I don't even know where to begin explaining how amazing HVC was with our baby. Our poor baby was injured pretty badly requiring oral surgery and a lot of TLC. The staff at HVC was very friendly and so helpful! They took excellent care of our baby Chief and were in contact with us during the entire process making sure we were always in the know and making sure we were able to afford our Pups care. I couldn't be more grateful for having the opportunity to work with such an amazing caring staff from the Hospital Manager Janet being so kind and transparent with us to Dr. Stephens dedicating his after hours time and personally calling us after the surgery to let us know how Chief was doing. Needless to say I would recommend HVC for anyone seeking any care for their beloved pets. I am forever grateful for this Clinic and I can guarantee you it is where my Family and I will be seeking out our pet care!
