name: Jane Shelton
text: My miniature Schnauzer cross, Suzy, LOVES McCurdy Animal Hospital! Our one stop shop for Medical, grooming and boarding.  We have used them for 5 years and Suzy is always happy to see the staff at McCurdy and we are always happy with their service. :)  :)  :)

name: Frank Zawada
text: Always a pleasure, professional, and very caring by the entire staff. Blaine is a an outstanding vet.  Feel very safe taking our dog here.

name: Carla Landers
text: Clean, prompt and quite personable.  I would recommend anyone in the surrounding Huntsville area to use them.  I felt like family immediately entering and the appointment and experience couldn't have been easier.

name: Lacey Reinoehl
text: Love McCurdy animal hospital! We have been going there for several years. The staff is always so friendly and even remember my dog Delilah. They never seem like they are in a rush and is always encourages me to ask any questions.

name: Faith Jones
text: Such a sweet clinic! Jingles says thank you!!

name: Kendra Leslie
text: I went to their website and saw a long list of animals they apparently see so I tried to make an appointment with them through it because it was after hours and I needed to get my pet seen. They didn’t get in touch with us so my boyfriend called them and they hung up on him. I called them and the person who answered didn’t seem too nice and told me they only see cats and dogs. I wish when I made the appointment that they would’ve called and let me know so I wasn’t waiting around but they definitely need to update their website.

name: Gracie Renfroe
text: Everyone was so friendly, especially Sondra in the front. I was stressed because my usual vet couldn’t even make room for an emergency (to me) appointment until the following Wednesday. Sondra fit me in that afternoon and made sure I was taken care of from start to finish. Dr. O’Reilly was very thorough with answering my questions, and the vet tech was gentle and reassuring to my very anxious pup.

name: Cliff White
text: The whole crew at McCurdy is awesome. They have taken car of our pets for over 10 years now.

name: Catherine
text: I have been taking my pets to McCurdy for years and we love them. They treat our animals with compassion and respect without being overpriced. Their staff will try to work with you for scheduling and are overall very helpful as well.

name: Melanie Brooks
text: Have used them for YEARS!  such great service and friendly people

name: Linda Herold Prouty
text: Everything went perfect. Love this place. Always helpful and my Steele gets wonderful care. Highly recommend

name: Jeffrey Baker
text: New customer, very pleased with their kindness and affordability. I moved nearby recently and have had both dogs in. They were treated very well and the doctor explained everything to my satisfaction.

name: Sylvia Alexander
text: I have had nothing but pleasant experiences here.

name: Dale Ayers
text: Great staff, Dr O'Reilly is very easy to work with, really like his approach to care for our senior Lab.

name: Jaime E.
text: The staff is friendly and clearly love animals. The doctor was kind and informative and didn't push unnecessary products - just the necessities. The prices are fair, too. Highly recommended!

name: Rachell Dawn Portraits
text: I've been bringing my babies here about 20+ years. Always the nicest staff, the vet is always very caring, I love these guys!

name: Kristin Marie
text: Great place, very clean and organized!

name: LauraLou Mou
text:
I recently purchased a 13 week old puppy in the Huntsville area for which I had 48 hours to get it examined by a vet to abide by the contract I signed with the breeder. Being from FL, I did not have the time to get back to my trusted vet, so I had to choose a local one. I did my due diligence by checking quantity and quality of reviews and chose McCurdy Animal Hospital. I am glad I did.

The staff was exceptionally friendly and treated both me and my new puppy with tender loving care. The doctors, we saw both, were very compassionate to our situation, thorough with their checkup and explanations of what they were looking for and/or finding,  knowledgeable, and generous with their time.

I will be forever grateful for this vet office and the insight and  time they took to help me get my precious  puppy.

name: David
text: Very overpriced vet. I had a terrible experience here that forced me to find a new vet. I brought in my dog to get his shots that he was due for. I asked if it was ok if he only received some of the shots now and I’d bring him back for the rest. I just wasn’t used to having such a high vet bill and I needed to split up the services. I was told by the woman behind the counter that yes, it is possible to do that but the overall price will be higher because it costs less to do it all bundled together. I said that’s ok and I still want to split it up the bill. They took my dog in back and 10 minutes later they brought him back and charged me the full amount for all services, even though I was very adamant about not having them all done at this time. They just went ahead and did it all without my consent and then actually had the nerve to tell me that’s what I said I wanted done. Really?!? I just got done saying I wanted to split up the services and I asked for specific ones to be done. Then they just did them all anyway. To me that seems like a place that’s more concerned with getting as much money as they can from you and very little concern about your actual pet. And I don’t like how they take your pets in a back room to do everything. My last vet did all the shots right in front of you and didn’t have anything to hide from you. I hope this review helps at least one person save some money by going elsewhere. This place is terrible.

resp.text: Thank you for bringing this matter to our attention. McCurdy Animal Hospital is committed to providing the best care possible for our patients and the best customer service to our clients while striving to keep prices affordable. We are truly sorry to hear that you were less than satisfied with the service provided at your recent appointment. Miscommunication sometimes happens despite our best efforts. Please know that, except for occasional extenuating circumstances, it is McCurdy Animal Hospital’s policy to examine and treat our patients in the exam room with our clients present. We would like to get more details about your visit. Please contact our Office Manager, Teresa Wilburn, at 256-881-2482 or teresa@mahvet.org at your convenience.

name: Lisa Clark
text: I needed service the day I called. I had a appointment to go in 30 minutes after the call. Everyone I met was really nice.

name: judy henley
text: Great  place  for  grooming  and  the  vet is great

name: Allison Reed
text: McCurdy couldn't have made given me a better experience. I feel 1000% comfortable with McCurdy Animal Hospital taking care of Trixie and treating her heartworms. I adopted Trixie with heartworms, and the people I adopted her from original told me it would be best to treat using slow kill. Since she was my first dog, I didn't know any better. I've been so nervous about treating them knowing that dogs have the smallest possibility to die during treatment, & my last vet did nothing to ease my concerns. He just nagged me and didn't understand the time constraints of my pharmacy residency. However, the vet at McCurdy explained everything to me, listened to my concerns, and is willing to work with me on Trixie's treatment. I can't imagine going to a better vet. I'm excited to return and feel comfortable leaving my best friend in their care. They treat Trixie like she's their own dog.

name: Amelia Ragland
text: Friendly and knowledgeable staff.  Great experience for my Gracie and for me.

name: Nicole Makela
text:
Dr. O'Reily is absolutely wonderful with my rabbit Goose! He is professional, friendly, and very caring. The staff is also great.

Update: I do still love the staff at McCurdy, I think they're very friendly. However, we were never able to get our issue resolved at McCurdy. We were told that the doctor would consult with a specialist in Auburn regarding our rabbit's issues and that they would contact us back. Yet after MONTHS and months of calling, more vet visits, and even showing up to the office, we were never helped. We eventually went to a different vet in town who was able to diagnose the issue. While we were unhappy with the outcome and disorganization, we were still very pleased by the kindness of the staff and doctor.

name: Pam Swinford
text: Staff was very friendly and made me feel like they loved my dog Buster right after meeting him.  I felt like he was in very good hands and would definitely use them again.  Office was very clean and inviting and I did not have to wait long either.  Great experience for me and my dog.

name: Karen Crippen
text: The vet was very nice and explained everything that was going on with our dog. He patiently answered all our questions and gave us the treatment plan. Our dog is much better and we will continue to go back.

name: carolyn thrower
text: Love the vet's input pertaining to my baby Dixie.  She did well for a few days, then Sunday evening she started having the "runny nose" with her cough.  In all honesty, she is better.  She remains on her abx.  Hopefully this will take care of the problem?  Vet was nice.

name: Rosemary
text: The WORST most expensive vet in Huntsville. Your pet will ”need surgery” no matter what is wrong with them.

resp.text: McCurdy Animal Hospital is committed to providing the best care possible for our patients and strives to keep prices affordable. We are unable to determine whether you are a client and have no record of your having visited our clinic recently. We would be happy to address any concerns you have in person. Please call (256-881-2482 ) or e-mail (mah@mahvet.org ) our office at your convenience.

name: F S
text: Dr. O is the best. Ditto for every staff member.

name: Leah Crouse
text: A very sweet office. Dr. O’Reilly and his staff have cared for my dogs since we moved back home 5 years ago. They take the time to discuss the best course of action and options for caring for your pet.

name: Dee Reed
text: The individual I spoke with over the phone was very rude!

name: Jessica Robinson
text: I brought in my 2 year old deaf Boston Terrier, Petey, for vaccinations, HW preventative, and annual wellness exam and I couldn't be happier about my visit. The entire team was extremely thorough with Pete's care and made certain to walk me through each procedure step-by-step. Not only did they take the time to answer all of my questions, they also took it upon themselves to learn some of the hand-signals for Pete to make him feel more comfortable...which meant the world to both of us. It's so great to find a clinic that sincerely cares about their patients. We both had a great experience and will certainly be back!

name: Margaret Harbin
text: I take my dog there and I couldn't be happier with them. My dog has a lot of special needs and they are so patient with him. I adopted him a little less than a year ago from the Humane society. He's 10 years old and was born at the Humane society and had lived his whole life there so he had a lot of issues to overcome. McCurdy has been paramount in helping me address all of these issues. He is a sweet, loving dog that deserved a chance at a home as much as any other dog. His name is Max, but now he's my sweet 80 lb BooBoo that loves on me and wants me to snuggle his neck when I hug him. McCurdy helped that to happen.

name: Tana Lee
text: I've taken all of my pets here for a long time and they get the best care. Dr. O'Reilly and Dr. Agnew are wonderful as are all of the tech and office staff. Highly recommend.

name: Allen Blankenship
text:
This is the first company besides mine of course, lol, that I can not think of a thing you could have done better. Clean waiting room and offices, very little wait times and a staff who genuinely cares about our animals.

Trust your pets to these loving, caring folks at McCurdy Animal Hospital.

name: Laura Barnes
text: Amazing place of knowledge and safety for my baby boys! Crew were fabulous!  I know my boys are well taken care if here! Highly recommend!

name: Sherry Patterson
text: Takes time to listen to problems so my pet receives the best care. Very knowledgeable and up to date on latest treatments.  Makes sure I understand any follow up care at home. Staff is very courteous and accommodating with all my pet care needs. Always does follow up calls to make sure there are no concerns.

name: Preston Plese
text: I thought they were better. Very disappointed in this place we used them for years and through countless surgeries and check ups but the moment our dog gets to old to bring into the office they write him off.  Let me explain he is 17+ years old and takes a pain relief medicine called caprofen for arthritis (it is a non narcotic).  Instead of allowing us to purchase more caprofen to help with his pain for his remaining time they demanded that we bring him in for blood work.  After explaining how stressful that is for him and how we would rather not do that and asking if there is any other way to get the prescription filled they told me no.  So let me get this straight you need blood work for a prescription that he has been taking for over a year to tell me "The numbers are good but he is old and will die soon" or "The numbers are bad but he is old and will die soon".  Look I understand that my dog does not have much more time I am just trying to give him his best life for the remaining time he has as long as he enjoys assisted walks outside, eats food and drinks water I will continue to do so I just wish this vet clinic had more compassion towards its animals.  Honestly I am just disappointed in the staff and how they handled the situation.

name: cynthia ocampo
text: The staff was very courteous and was able to get us in quick.   I loved Dr. Agnew, she took the time to explain things to me for my new fur baby. She took good care of my Bella and  she is very caring and thorough.

name: David Uptagrafft
text: We found an abandoned kitten and the McCurdy Clinic was able to get us in the same day and take care of Nova. Dr Agnew did a great job going over possible issues and parasites with the kitten and the staff provided accurate information on costs before we received treatments and handled scheduling efficiently. There is also a great app they use for your phone.

name: diane rigsby
text: Great caring team! I always recommend them.

name: Sarah Ramdeen
text: Friendly and knowledgeable staff.  Discussed the diagnosis and how they arrived at that point.  Gentle with the cats (I have two sisters).  Have a great cat only area of the waiting room, and supplies to make them calm.

name: Edge
text: The best animal hospital to take your pets

name: Ivy Brazelton
text: LOVE the family atmosphere  here at McCurdy! They love my Koko as if she was their own pet.  I feel as if my pet is safe with McCurdy Animal Hospital.

name: C Rod
text: I've been a client for many years. The staff is caring and the doctors are top notch. When it was time, Dr. O'Reilly kindly came to my house to put three of my seniors down in the comfort of their own home. He also provided great guidance that helped me with difficult end of life decisions. When it comes to my animals' care and needs, I know McCurdy Animal Hospital will provide the best service.

name: jake brey
text: The staff at McCurdy treats our animals as their own. Our pit bull suffers from major vet anxiety, they are great with him and he was feeling more comfortable by the end of his very first visit! Fantastic overall care, the best vet we've found in Huntsville!

name: Mishael Williams
text: I've been bringing my cat here for several years now. Love the service and how much they care! I recommend them 100%!

name: Michael Burkett
text: Both of the vets I have seen with Kloey have been very knowledgeable and kind,which goes a long way for us.

name: Mallory Johnston
text:
After over $10k worth of boarding, medication, and surgeries for our 17 year old dog who has mobility issues (which we adopted at 13), the receptionist or vet tech Teressa literally hung up on me when I asked to speak with the vet about getting a medication refill.  (It’s called caprofen. It’s basically doggy ibuprofen for arthritis.) We we’re trying to avoid forcing the dog to travel (he’s about 40 pounds, so he’s not a lap dog) and avoid that stress.  Along with being HIGHLY disappointed in their customer loyalty, here are a few reasons why you should t use them for professional reasons.

1. Their record keeping is horrible. They do not keep good records on vaccinations, procedures or other visits.

2. They will overcharge you for things they did not do. Multiple time we have been charged for vaccines that didn’t happen (or weren’t recorded), nail clippings that didn’t occur, etc.

3. Along the lines of record keeping, they will not transfer your records to any other vets- even if it’s so you can board your animals at a location 3 minutes away instead of the 20+ minutes away they are.

4. For the cost of their services, their facilities are a joke. I’m not sure where their money is going because it is not to hire good staff (except Dave and Ivey)  or going back into their vet offices or boarding areas.

Again, incredibley disappointed in their professionalism and customer support after years and years of loyalty. Shame shame on them. I’m sorry Dr O’Reilly has his name attached to this place.

name: Lynn Chappell
text: Love taking my pets here. Have been going for years. They are like family. They really care about my pets and their health and my pets love them. Highly recommend.

name: Judy Werner
text: It is the best animal hospital I have ever taken my dog to. Dr. ORiley is kind and caring and takes the time to listen to your concerns. He really cares about both you and your animal. The staff is friendly and calls you by name and does everything to make both you and your animal comfortable. Would not go anywhere else.

name: Pam Phelps
text: The nicest and the friendliest staff I have ever met.  You could not pay me to take my babies to another vet's office. They really get to know you and your animals on a personal level and treat  you just like family.

name: ron jewell
text: Dr O'Reilly and staff are great.  I have 3 dogs and two cats that visit the clinic and it is always a positive experience.  The groomer is great also.  I worried when Dr. McCurdy passed away that the service and compassion would be hard to match but "The Team" has done a fabulous job.  Thank you Dr. O'Reilly

name: Erin Reece
text: I cannot say enough about the staff at McCurdy! Dr. O'Reilly was amazing they stayed open for me on the snow day so that my dog could have a c-section. That surgery saved her and her puppies lives. Thank you to all the staff at this wonderful place.﻿

name: Paul Martin
text: We had our first appointment today. The staff was the greatest. Maryanne [I think that is her name] was awesome with my pup. Hands down the best vet care in Huntsville.

name: Caroline Buncick
text: We LOVE McCurdy Animal Hospital! I learned about them when I went to work for Burritt on the Mountain and Dr. McCurdy took care of all of our barnyard animals. I started taking my pets to him and never looked back! When he died Dr. O'Reilly stepped in and has done a phenomenal job. I  have used several vets over the years and this is the best by far!

name: Eduardo Saldana
text: Because I didn't have the $1,200 for my dog to stay overnight it died from parvovirus, how sad, truly no compassion for animals. They said they would call the next morning to check up on our dog it was until late the afternoon when he was close to dying. More worried about money than anything else.

resp.text:
Mr. Saldana,
We are truly sorry for your loss. We understand that losing a pet is very difficult, no matter the circumstances. When a dog is diagnosed with something like parvo, it can be expensive to treat and does not have a guaranteed outcome. Unfortunately, although we would like to, we cannot treat every pet for free. Once again, we are very sorry for your loss.
Sincerely,
Blaine O’Reilly D.V.M., Owner of McCurdy Animal Hospital

name: Nico N. (Nico)
text: VERY knowledgable vets, willing to work with you to find solutions for any problem your animals might be facing. They also understand the financial burden our furred family can be at times, and work with you to help alleviate some of that as well.

name: Diane Blocker
text: Dr. O'Reilly took over the practice after the passing of Dr. McCurdy.  We have continued to love our interactions with all of the staff.

name: Kristina Reser-Jaynes
text: Were from out of town and they graciously got our dog in and got meds to get us through to when we go home.

name: Gregory Lewis
text: Dr. O’Reilly, Dr. Agnew and the entire staff at McCurdy’s have been, by far, some of the best animal care providers we’ve been to.  They provided phenomenal service, expert opinion, and compassionate care to our 16 year old dog who has lived in and seen veterinarians in 7 states during her long life. We’d only been in the Huntsville area for a little over a month when our dog became terminally ill. The lengths this hospital was willing to go to to see our pup through her final days astonished us during a very difficult time. Ultimately, the hospital provided us at home euthanization care in a very respectful and heartfelt manner. We’ve found this veterinarian team to be among the very best we’ve been to. We have other vets closer to us, but will continue to visit McCurdy’s to provide care to our other animals. We highly recommend them.

name: Reverend Karen Fisher
text: Visiting from out of state when my little dog began having breathing problems. I phoned them before the close of day and was given a 8:30 am appointment for the following morning. Staff is great, Doctor O'Reilly highly knowledgeable. They also have equipment needed to help diagnose medical problems. I appreciated their knowledge and compassion. My pet's heart condition is now being treated even though his vet back home, whom he saw last month, has never even informed me of a potential heart problem. We were blessed to be visit in the area when this happened.

name: logan foster
text: Alarming experience of neglect today. Took a very sick goat in this morning who is drooling and frothing at the mouth and is barely able to stand and can’t eat. She lost significant weight over the weekend due to not being able to drink/eat..The office took a 150 dollar deposit for her exam and any other care necessary for the day. Did not give the goat a single IV fluid, treated her for worms which she does not have and didn’t tend to her all day from all appearances...we asked if they attempted any food or water with her and they said they hadn’t given her anything all day....and told us to take her home this evening in worse condition than when we brought her in for care which she desperately needs. The doctor didn’t give a single clue as to what illness she is fighting...charged us for the antibiotic that turns out is only a worm medication and labs. Called a different vet in Fayetteville upon getting there to find out all of this who without seeing her gave a thorough explanation behind the symptoms and agreed to treat her first thing in the morning....should have gone to Fayetteville in the first place this morning so we didn’t lose another day of this animal being in misery....First time going to this vet and will most certainly be the last.

name: Gene Fleming
text:
The care and service has been excellent for years at McCurdy Animal Hospital.
The staff and doctors are knowable, caring, friendly and personable.
Thank you for giving my pets long healthy lives.

name: Paula Peterson
text: Excellent care for your pets.  Professional and appropriate; compassionate and knowledgable.    Gives excellent care to small pets as well as large.

name: greg thompson
text: Staff is great but they over charge. Started going somewhere else for half the price and same service

name: Mary Cupp Hall
text: Thank you for always taking such great care of my Louie.

name: Patrick Fitzgerald
text: The staff was friendly and knowledgeable. They took very good care of our girl. No complaints.

name: C R
text: Don't bring Ferrets here!  There are much better more knowledgeable ferret vets in the area.  Brought in 2 ferrets, doc wanted to perform blood work on 1, urinalysis on the other.  Knocked both out, results were delayed, and he sent the receptionist out to relay results rather than discussing them with me himself.  He never called or followed up with me even though I had questions and requested it after getting results. Turns out he requested the wrong blood-test to yield useful information, and of course recommended coming back to perform bloodwork on second ferret since urinalysis showed no issues (from the beginning we said 'symptoms' could be behavioral and not actual symptoms).  By this time I was done, and started looking for a new vet. For the first time ever, I received the impression that a vet was in it for the money and not actually interested ensuring the best care for my critters.

name: Shelia Coffey
text:
I can't say enough good things about McCurdy Animal Hospital, I've been taking my furbabies there almost 47 years. The entire staff is like family to us. My babies always get the best of care, health or grooming. I truly
appreciate everyone and I know they will take care of every pet and Pawrents
Who come thru their doors.

name: Jack Sawyer
text: Doggy death camp. On the outside it may seem to be an extremely professional facility, but behind the scenes this is a horrifying and unsanitary veterinary clinic with little regard for the well-being of the animals found in its kennels. Feces and urine are left lying around for inexcusable periods of time and sick animals are left to wallow in their own mess helplessly barking and crying. Furthermore, the needles used for surgeries are reused rather than being discarded. Having worked in and observed practices of other clinics, I can only describe this as a disturbingly careless establishment I would not charge with the care of any animal of mine.

resp.text:
Mr. Lenore,
We have no record of a Mr. Jack Lenore in our client base at McCurdy Animal Hospital. We are a very professional facility with a high regard for animals and their well-being. Our kennels are beautifully kept and all sick animals are given the necessary treatments at the time they are needed. No animal is ever left in a cage crying in pain or lying in their own feces. This would go against the professional oath we took when we entered a career in veterinary medicine. Further, all surgeries are performed with the utmost professionalism and we strive for the highest standards of surgical treatment, including our aseptic protocol. Everything you have insinuated is offensive to every person on staff. If you would like to discuss this matter further, please contact me at 256.881.2482.
Sincerely,
Blaine O’Reilly D.V.M., Owner of McCurdy Animal Hospital

name: Chris Wiginton
text:
I am a long-time client of McCurdy Animal Hospital and over the years Dr. O'Reilly (and Dr. McCurdy before him), as well as his great staff, have cared for seven different dogs of mine and have consistently provided excellent, caring service, regardless of the situation.  They have gone above and beyond the call of duty a number of times in a variety of situations.  In fact, in one instance, Dr. O'Reilly's outside-the-box thinking saved the life of one of my dogs when he had a life-threatening infection.

All in all, you could not ask for a more professional, yet caring, environment for your veterinary needs.

name: Shata Pace
text: Dr. O'Reilly and his staff have been most helpful to me and my furbabies.  The staff at McCurdy Animal Hospital are very kind, caring and loving.

name: Thomas Russell
text: Great people. Expect a wait, but fix anything and have treats and coffe in waiting room.

name: Moon Pi
text:
Dr. O’Reilly of the McCurdy Animal Hospital is an outstanding veterinarian who has been providing quality and compassionate care for our animals for the last several years.  In addition to taking care of our personal pets and horses,  Dr. O’Reilly has also helped with many cases associated with our 501c3 private family foundation, which is specifically dedicated to animal welfare and rescue.    He has always worked with us to come up with the best possible solutions for our most unfortunate cases.  He will even take the time to personally educate an indigent owner as to how to care for the special needs of his/her pet.   Dr. O’Reilly is truly an asset to our community, and we would like to give him our highest recommendation.
posted by: The Bucket Foundation

name: Brandon Benson
text: Have been taking many animals to them for years now. Great people, everyone cares so much for the animals and the owners too.

name: christina kirkland
text: nice and friendly staff- answered all my questions and seem to care.

name: Marci Baker
text: Completely overpriced. $575 to get a dog spayed?  Find another vet, would not recommend to anybody.

name: Caroline Buncick
text: I recommend McCurdy's all of the time!

name: M.K. Honeycutt
text: I have been going to McCurdy Animal Hospital for years and prefer this clinic for many reasons. When we were looking for a regular veterinarian in Huntsville, I remembered seeing Dr. McCurdy over the years as a 2nd opinion for a couple of my animals and had a good experience. When we decided to take our animals to the McCurdy clinic again, Dr. O'Reilly had taken over the clinic. During that visit, Dr. O'Reilly was informative, he asked us questions, listened to our concerns, and gave us options regarding how to address our animal's needs. Since then we have been thru a lot with he and his staff! Thru everything, they all showed us and our pets caring and concern and were always there if we had any questions. Dr. O'Reilly is professional and practical when it comes to our pet's needs and understands not everyone has bottomless pockets! He will also refer when needed. We have seen Dr. Maddox on several occasions and had good experiences with her as well. Everyone at McCurdy Animal Hospital deserves a BIG Thank You for all you do down there!!

name: Lexie Robinson Austin
text: We love Dr. Agnew and all of the staff at McCurdy!!!

name: Jackie McDermott
text: A great group of ppl !!! Takes great care of my animals !!! The groomed does a great job!!

name: Samantha Woodard
text: The staff is always friendly, kind and helpful! I would recommend  them to anyone!

name: FJ B
text: Very high prices

name: Carla Dupree
text: Front desk staff is on point. :)

name: Gregg Walker
text: Excellent vet, excellent service, very friendly

name: william pierce
text: A.J.'s girl works here.

name: George Edwards
text: Courteous, knowledgable, and effective pet care.

name: David Chapman
text: Professional. Fast service.

name: Jimmy McMurry
text: My son's vet!!!

name: S C
text: Awesome staff!

name: Charles Shirley
text: Excellent experience.

name: Gregg Walker
text: Very friendly and awesome staff.

name: Carla Taylor
text: excellent service/friendly

name: Karen Balance
text: I contacted them after my pet passes at home. They were so compassionate and cared about me and my emotional well-being.  We didn't have a vet  and they didn't hesitate to help me. I have found a new vet!

name: Clay Barnett
text: Very kind veterinarians who are great at explaining thing. Radar (my tuxedo boy) actually doesn’t hate going to the vet!

name: Lara Vickery
text: We had to take our older cat in on a Saturday morning due to what appeared to be an abscessed tooth. The Vet was amazing explaining everything in detail and he spoke about our kitty like he was a patient and family member not "just an animal". Everyone we interacted with was not only professional but very kind and empathetic. The fee was also extremely reasonable. I would highly recommend this vet.

name: Alicia Carter
text: My boys have been cared for so very well. Today I brought in James Thomas (5-ish year old neutered male cat, Domestic short hair, normal weight for frame)for a maybe, could be, yikes, UTI. Dr. B and sweet techs were very gentle with him and thorough with exam and questions. I am confident their expertise and care will have him on the mend and back to himself soon.  Thank you Bluff Park Animal Clinic.

name: Michal Shar
text: I had a wonderful first visit here with my babies for their annual exams.

name: Vasilios Tsantes
text: Our dearest cat Snow White passed away while they were caring for her. I know she passed around good and caring people who loved on her as we did. BPAC is first class with good people. 👍

name: Jennifer Maddox
text: I took my mom today to get her dog seen. Ashley in the front is extremely nice and professional. Kennel tech and doctor ( didnt get their names) were also very helpful and very nice

name: Sara Marsh
text: We’ve used Bluff Park Animal Clinic for the past 4.5 years for two different pets. They have a friendly and compassionate staff. Highly recommend.

name: Jerry Brady
text: This place is great! So helpful & efficient.

name: cheryl yarborough
text: Very pleased with this clinic! All verts & staff very caring. Dr Erwin is so kind and caring. Takes time to explain everything. Only works on Tuesdays now, but we are thankful for that! He is awesome!

name: Olivia Thompson
text: Able to be seen quickly. Super friendly staff!! Very clean and well equipped waiting area, office, and patient care rooms. Love our neighborhood vet!

name: Jennifer Tsantes
text: They take care of tour furry babies

name: Jane Frink
text: So compassionate, knowledgeable and able to work in an out of state  sick pet on a moment's notice. Highly recommend this clinic!

name: Kenyon Ross
text: The best crew ever

name: Chrissy Hawkins
text: Best service, honest, and the best pet care we have found !! Vets and staff are professionals and always there for your pets.

name: Rob Piosik
text: Nice and quick service.

name: Ward Lachman
text: Great doctors and great employees . Very clean and friendly.

name: Lynn Dickey
text: We have used Bluff Park Animal Clinic for over 15 years.  Our primary vet is Dr Eric Skocelas but over the years our dogs have been treated by the other Vets at Bluff Park Animal Clinic as well. They are all friendly,  professional,  compassionate and their behavior demonstrates that they care about my sweet fur babies as much as I do. The staff is well-organized,  efficient and they are just as nice as they can be. The cost is comparable to other veterinary services in this area but the service is far superior. If I could give them more than five stars, I would.

name: Marjo Gann
text: I have used this clinic for 42 years.  Great team!  They are always kind, caring, and on point in their care and diagnosis!

name: Duane Ward
text: A very friendly caring staff. And really good at what they do. I have brought several pets here from simple scratches or dry skin up to the end of life stages. All of the staff are very caring and professional. I will continue going there as long as needed.

name: Anne turner-henson
text: Professional attentive service. We have used their services since 1984. They provide exemplary service. Our dogs love the spa (aka boarding).  We would not go any where else

name: J T
text: Went recently for the first time and were very pleased. They fit us in on short notice and were super friendly. They aren't the cheapest Vet we've used and they don't take American Express but we will certainly be back.

name: Gwynne Mountz
text: We took our new kitten (a stray we got from a friend) to Bluff Park Animal Clinic on a Monday at 5:00 p.m. (they close at 5:30). This was our very first time here and they were so kind and saw us despite the fact that they could've said that they don't take appointments after 5:00. Dr. Eric was extremely thorough on his exam of our kitten and gave my daughter great tips for taking care of our new kitten. They didn't rush at all even though they could have! Great staff, great environment and extremely friendly and helpful! You won't be disappointed if you bring your pets here!

name: Melissa P
text: They love my crazy dogs well and staff is very knowledgeable.

name: Georgia Johnson
text: They were so compassionate when we had to euthanize our baby Gypsy. We also take our other cats and my dog Lucy. Staff members are always helpful and very informative.

name: Jay Elmore
text: Great docs, friendly staff & convenient to the Bluff Park community

name: Leslie Moon
text: They go above and beyond for their clients! I had a family emergency and had no way to get my pup there to board. Dr. Erwin personally drove to my house to pick my pet up! What compassion!

name: Nancy Forshaw
text: Everybody here is super-nice.  The 3 vets I've dealt with have all been very knowledgeable and compassionate.  They really love animals here.

name: Cameron al Shaqar
text: Great vets! They have gone above & beyond to make sure my puppy feels safe with them

name: Spencer Dixon
text: Wouldn't have ever gone here if it weren't for a recommendation from a friend who works here, but I'm so glad I did! Great people, and great prices! I was worried about taking my cat to a clinic because of how over priced vets can get, but I haven't had to worry about that here!

name: Bill Pitts
text: Great care for our puppy.  Always ready to answer our questions. Vets and staff are very thorough and knowledgeable. I would highly recommend!!

name: Sadie
text: I love Bluff Park Animal Clinic. My mother has taken our pets there since I was a child, I suppose she started out because they're a convenient 5 minutes away but 23 years later our animals are still in their care. I've also moved out on my own and I have my own animals now and there was never any question in my mind they also be treated at Bluff Park Animal Clinic. The Drs are knowledgeable and Dr. Jim and Eric have both been fantastic about answering me and my mom's questions (and with my mom, there are always a lot of questions--it can get frustrating). I have been able to call them up several times and they are fantastic at giving me a call back and talking to me about whatever my issue is. They have made it so clear to me they have your pet's best interest in mind, but they also have yours. I absolutely adore them, quite honestly and highly recommend them if you're looking for a vet.

name: Jay Elmore
text: Great docs, friendly staff & convenient to the Bluff Park community

name: Ben Stocks
text: Great people, very helpful. We just walked in with out puppy and they were so accommodating. Walk ins are welcome here.

name: Jackie Hamilton
text: Wonderful, compassionate vets. So glad to have them.

name: David Burrowes
text: I've been a customer for over 25 years, and I wouldn't consider going anywhere else for my cats. Extremely caring, great vets.

name: Laura Nadell
text: I love my vets

name: Melanie Brumfield
text: Dr Irwin is the BEST! He is a caring veterinarian and I recommend him HIGHLY!

name: Laura H
text: Great doctors, great people.

name: Laura Ellis
text: My dogs drag me IN to the vet's office, and then just chill out in the waiting room. My family and I love our vet's!

name: Barbara Lemley-Wheeler
text: Very happy with the care of my animals, vets and staff are professional.  The fee is higher than the vet my daughter uses.

name: Marshall Malone
text: Very personal and attentive Vet.  They saved our doggie's life and have been diligent care givers for over 10-years.

name: W. Gary Smith
text: We have been using for years. Very satisfied with the service and care for our dogs.

name: Abigail Miree
text: I will forever have a special place in my heart for Dr. Erwin. As long as I have a dog, this is the only vet I take her to!

name: BTA “bta2997” RACING
text: Great people

name: Chris Powell
text: friendly and great

name: sarah jones
text: I have been using these guys for years.. I moved across town and still use them!!

name: Steve Russell
text: Great veterinarians excellent staff.

name: Rosemary Wendel
text: Love the staff!!!

name: Jayla Gash
text: Pretty professional. I feel as though they should communicate as staff with each better. I was over charged because I asked for one thing and it wasn’t communicated properly with other staff. But the refunded a portion. Also, if my dog is being boarded, and I call to check on her, you need to actually give me details on her well-being. Don’t just say “she’s fine” and you haven’t actually gotten off your butt to check. Other than my last visit, overall I haven’t had any issues.

name: Wanda Sessions
text: Although I'd prefer to be able to come in and stay with my girl, I know she's in the best hands with Dr. McMillan and his staff!

name: Val OBrien
text: My kitty was very ill this week with an infection. The medical staff at PC Animal Hospital were very caring and persistent on making her well. She is recovering well and I appreciate all of them!

name: Krissy Kinsey
text: My cat had to be spayed quickly because of a constant infection. I was concerned about cost because I'm between jobs and they quoted me $160 by phone. When I picked up my kitty imagine my surprise when she stated my bill was $260.....$100 over what they said...this on top of the $100.28 I already paid for the initial exam and antibiotics ! I am now going to struggle just to pay my utilities this month which are already past due. Other than the outrageous prices, they took good care of my kitty. If money wasn't an issue I would take all my animals there.

name: Lee Yates
text:
I can't say enough good about this place the professionalism they cared as much for me as they did of my little sissy girl .at this trying time. They prepared here for me to take her home to her final resting place .From the bottom of my heart Thank y'all
Rest in peace sissy girl

name: Susan Randle
text: Very dedicated doctors and staff! They pay extra attention to the pets and keep the owners informed. I've used this clinic for 10+ years! Love them!

name: Linda Fontes
text:
I have left my French Bulldogs at many places in St Clair county.
None compare to the quality of care my pups receive here.
They are loved exercised and watered also fed well
The Doctor and staff are the sweet people
Thank you for taking such good care of my babies
Linda Fontes

name: shelby boutwell
text: This vet is very good at what they do..  they are always so nice an welcoming of anyone and any furry friend.  We love pell city animal hospital and we always refer people to this vet. They have saved some of my babies and took good care of them. The best understanding an helpful vet we have had.

name: Laura Smitherman
text: I trust you! May sound simple but honestly, my pups are extreme important to me. I truly believe you all do the best you can to make them safe. Thank you all.

name: Holly Mims
text: This was the first time I’ve taken a sick animal to this vet. Dr. Farmer and his staff were wonderful and treated my baby with love and care. Dr. Farmer was very thorough with his instructions for our pup and I am very happy with my decision to use this groups of veterinarians.

name: Sherry Bishop
text: The team at PCAH take great care of my cats!  They are warm and friendly people and take time to talk to me whenever I have a question or concern, no matter how trivial or strange it may be!  I never feel like they think I'm bothering them and they always return my calls when they say they will.  They go above and beyond to care for my cats.  I highly recommend them if you want great quality care for your pets!

name: Paige Allen
text: You walked me through the entire process of everything Fynn had and answered all my questions and put my mind at ease. Fynn came through with flying colors and you took great care of my fur-baby. Such friendly, helpful staff!!!! We are both so pleased.

name: Lee Karcher
text: We boarded our Bella with this facility over a weekend and they took great care of her. All of the staff was super friendly and you could really tell they LOVE their animal friends. I felt sorry for them at our drop off on Saturday because they were so busy and seemed understaffed. I hope others see a need for more staff here and hire some great people because these ladies were going above and beyond to take care of everyone with the crazy COVID restrictions in place. They never slowed down so I cannot imagine them having to keep this pace every weekend. Our hold time to check in was about 20 minutes but we were happy to wait bc we saw the issue was just not enough hands on deck, nothing else. They were very professional, super sweet, and we are so happy that they will be Bella's new vet facility in Pell City. I highly recommend Pell City Animal Hospital to anyone looking for great animal care.

name: Kim Garland
text: Can not say enough great things about this place. They have the most caring staff of any place I have ever been. I have been taking my babies there since moving to the area in 2017 and I am so thankful for them. The doctors are extremely knowledgeable.

name: N Kilgroe
text: The doctors & staff at Pell City Animal Hospital provide excellent care for our pets.   Their care, expertise and compassion for our fur babies is the best.  They have taken care of all our pets for 20+ years!

name: Owl
text: Good people! Caring staff who treat me and my animals well.

name: Amy Baker
text: THE BEST vet ever!  They are so kind and loving toward your pet.  Very accommodating and informative.  I highly recommend.

name: brandi baugher
text: So many reasons to get your animals treated here. The front office staff is friendly and helpful. All the Dr’s are exceptional with both my cat and dog. One of my favorites is Dr Bearden sitting in the floor with me and my golden retriever (talking treatment to BOTH of us). My golden loves to carry her doggie in with her for comfort and they let her with out complaining (as they pick it up over and over). We have had nothing but great experiences here!

name: Jessica Wright
text: Treats my fur babies as their own pets! Goes above and beyond! Highly recommend

name: Lesley Warren
text: Dr. McMillan has a great combination of empathy balanced by even, rational explanations of our babies' ailments and treatment options.

name: Patti Herring
text:
Professional and good service.  Treat you and your pet like family.

Patti Herring

name: Susan Rinehart
text: Our dogs always get professional and compassionate care from the doctors and staff at PCAH.

name: Angela Whisenant
text: All of the staff at PCAH are fabulous!  Crystal and Dr Bearden are especially good with my very eccentric German Shepherd Lutz.

name: Dianna Enoch
text: Always receive the utmost care. They care about your pets.

name: Trina Barrett
text: I don’t do reviews often. Dr. Farmer is a wonderful vet and I have used him for years. However recently we saw Dr. Bearden. I cannot recommend her under any circumstances. My dog had an obvious deformation in her leg after an accident. Dr. Bearden put her in a splint, took X-rays and told us she would send them to a surgeon. Each week we went back and the treatment plan/diagnosis/story changed. The staff would tell me something different than she did each time. She never sent the X-rays to a surgeon. 6 weeks this went on. (Shame on me for letting it go on so long) On the last visit the dog was dropped off 7am, at her request, for observation without the splint. She didn’t look at the dog or remove the splint until I called at 1:30 for an update. At 3:30 she claimed the dog only had “liganitis” but was still not putting weight on the leg. When I asked about the “dent” she claimed I had never told her about it. Not true, and it was easy to see on the dog’s leg. She wanted to give the dog back without a splint. I had the staff splint the leg and took the dog to another vet. She had to have a metal plate surgically implanted to fix the damage. Because of Dr Bearden’s poor diagnostic skills, I cannot recommend PC Animal Hospital unless you see Dr. Farmer.

name: Kisha Lybrand
text: We had a great experience leaving our fur baby in your hands. He had a great time and was glad to be home.

name: Azure Taylor
text: I have always used Pell City Animal Hospital for my pets care and needs.  They always do a fantastic job with my pets and answer any questions I have.  I would recommend them to anyone that have fur or furless babies.

name: robnob64
text:
Out of town for almost a week and used PCAH
for boarding our mature cat.  The good folks at PCAH sent us pics and text updates on how “Miss Kitty” was doing. Nice of them to be that concerned.

name: Stacye Pilkington
text: Everyone has been really nice and helpful.  They have taken really good care of my sweet baby.

name: Kyrie Word
text: I bring all my pets here for shots, surgery, etc. fair pricing and they are always great with my animals.

name: Deborah Tipton
text: She brings meds to my car and is so fast and responsive to my questions

name: Heather Morgan
text: Great place to take your fur babies. Kind, professional and informative.

name: Jack Conley
text: Best veterinarian I’ve ever used!  Great boarding!!

name: Alaina Davis
text: Ww have been taking our pets here for 15 years, the whole staff is wonderful

name: Lenton Williams
text: Excellent service when they took great with my dog.

name: Susan Simonson
text: Took time to thoroughly discuss pets health

name: Judy Allen
text: We took Sugar Baby their for her shots and first vet visit. They were recommended to us. Very pleased with them and their service.  So good with our little 6 pound baby.

name: Landon Smith
text: Very friendly and professional staff.  I wouldn't go anywhere else.

name: Leisa Kreeger
text: I highly recommend this hospital. The doctors are knowledgeable and the staff is friendly AND kind to my pets. They all treat you and your pet like family. I have used the boarding facilities, as well. They anticipated my separation anxiety and sent me pictures of my girls daily. Thanks everyone at Pell City Animal Hospital! You’re the BEST!❤️

name: marlee
text: I recently had to take my puppy there and the staff and the vet was very rude and had attitude when I was just trying to ask questions. Not only was my puppy scared to death when he got out of there he also urinated all over me cause he was shaking so bad. I know dogs don’t like the vet but he did not act this way at our primary vet. I’ve spoke to other people and they had the same experience there.

name: james willis
text: We have never had anything but positive experiences here. Anytime we have needed in there is never a wait and they are always so helpful and welcoming. Coming from the veterinarian we used to go to in Inverness on 280 prices are so much better as well. I recommended this animal hospital to anyone who ever asks of where to take their pets.

name: Jes Sullivan
text: Very friendly and clean facility! I was in town visiting for the holidays and needed to find a Vet for my dog. I was greeted at 7AM, on a Saturday morning, with a welcoming smile. Cynthia was very knowledgable and solved my issue with ease.

name: Art O'Reilly
text: We had our first visit yesterday with our 12 week old lab pup.  Outstanding staff of Docs and Techs.  Everyone friendly and courteous.  Highly recommend

name: Karin Liddle
text:
Very nice people...very clean!
Thanx for the great groom!!!

name: Tony Parker
text: Being using them for at least 12 years.  Entire staff are great and go out of there way to provide excellent service.

name: Tracy Burton
text: I would give 6 stars if possible   great people that have went over and beyond to help over the years .my boxer Baby Girl loves going to the vet . Thank you to every person there !!

name: Linda Hallmark
text: Pell City Animal Hospital has been caring for our pets for more than 8 years. Dr. Farmer and his staff are knowledgeable, compassionate,  and caring. I find their prices for vet care to be reasonable. Dr. Farmer has performed multiple,  successful surgeries on our rescued Golden Retreiver. I would highly recommend Dr. Farmer and Pell City Animal Hospital.

name: vicki letlow
text: I've been going here for several years and they never disappoint. Always friendly and helpful. This time I had to board my dog and I was completely satisfied with her care and at about half the price of kennels in my Chelsea area. For me it was worth the drive.

name: KambiQuake
text: I love bringing my dogs here. Everyone on staff is super friendly and knowledgeable. Best of all, they love animals, so they will love your pets and treat them like family.

name: jewell monroe
text: I would like to thank Dr. Farmer  and his staff for helping  my dog Roxy Monday when I brought her in at 5pm, She is doing so much better ,  She is eating and drinking her water and pooping no blood and tiki g her meds, this is one happy mamma🤗

name: Kaitlin Haynes
text: I wanted to say a big thank you from our family ! My husband brought our dog in Bella in this week not knowing what was going on with her . I was so afraid that she had the parvovirus but she didn't. No one knew what was wrong with our fur baby ! But they prescribed antibiotics for her an some other medicine .  She couldn't drink water by herself but yesterday she got up an went to her water bowl an drank some . Today she jumping around and playing ! She's taken little bites of her food ! I'm guessing that normal after having a upset stomach for 4 days ! But I can't thank staff enough for helping us with her an giving us every piece of information they could !

Previously we were at another vet in town and experienced the complete opposite. Highly recommend this vet.

name: MaKenzie F
text: I was very happy with my first visit to Smiths Station Animal Hospital! Being new to the area, I was so happy to find a reliable vet so close to home. The clinic is clean, organized, and full of a great staff. All my questions were answered and I was completely satisfied by our appointment. I am so happy that my new puppy has a great place to take care of him for years to come. Thank you!

resp.text: Thank you so much Makenzie!

name: Brandy Tinney
text: Such sweet ladies behind the desk! So so helpful!!Helped get my furbabies all set up to SAY GOODBYE  to THOSE NASTY FLEAS!

name: K Lindsey
text: Nice friendly staff to help in any way they can.

name: Jackie Powers
text: We were so thankful for your team getting us in so last minute and providing exceptional care for our puppy, Doc Hudson! Without you, we wouldn't have known the sickness he had that a recent emergency vet did not catch while he was in their care for 4 days! Without you guys our baby could have potentially died because we would have just assumed the emergency vet was treating all he had going on and trusted that! Luckily my gut said take him somewhere else and you were the first to respond AND actually care to treat him ASAP! My own regular vet didn't even call me back! From now on, Smiths Station Animal Hospital is our go to for our furry family members!

name: Antonio Hardge
text: My Nikko found a Vet. Very nice friendly staff!

name: Biggg
text: Absolutely the best experience. You can go from one hand to the other and get the same excellent service. I'm very thankful to live nearby, because I'd hate to have to drive a ton of miles for service, but, I would!

resp.text: Thank you so much!

name: Isabella Donohue
text: HORRIBLE GROUP OF PEOPLE!!! I had an extremely carsick kitten and they were the closest animal hospital. I called in to let them know I was on the way, and the receptionist was unprofessional and transferred me to a tech. After a long wait, someone else answered and told me that the veterinarians were all at lunch, there was nothing they could do for me, to take my business elsewhere, and then hung up the phone. What would’ve happened if it was a real emergency? I’d rather not find out. Take your business elsewhere and get your pets the help they need before going near this place.

resp.text: Isabella, When you called, our Doctor was out of the building on her lunch break. We offered for you to come wait but you refused and said you would go somewhere else, then hung up. I am sorry we couldn’t help you right then, but our assistants are not allowed by law to diagnose or treat pets.

text: Everything is always perfect..no improvements needed!! Thank you all for taking such good care of my Trouble!

name: Gypsy Jones
text: This is the best vet I have ever had. They take extremely great care with our two dogs, Cassie and Roscoe. Miss Phoebe loves our kiddos as though they were her own and the vets know all about our dogs pasts. One of ours is a rescue dog and sometimes struggles with going to the doc, of course, so the vets allow my husband to hold her instead of muzzling her which makes things worse. Such understanding people who care about these furry friends. The clinic is spacious and clean as well. Now there is an app that while your pets are being boarded they can write you a letter from “camp” and tell you all about their adventures while you are away. I only wish there was a way to reply back. Perhaps I just haven’t found it yet.

name: Derek C
text: Great Hospital with very friendly and down to earth staff. Dr Shelton was especially caring and knowledgeable. She was super informative, laid out all the facts for us, gave advice, and enabled us to make the best possible decision for our dog.

name: Michael Mitchum
text: Very clean and super friendly staff. Very good prices and fast. Always able to get in the same day for appointments.

name: Meredith Curtis
text: Just been here a couple of times, but so far so good!

name: Jenny Vance
text:
I have been taking my little man to this vet since we moved here three years ago. In my honest opinion, they are rude, incompetent, and greedy.
I took him in today for a check-up because he hasn't been acting like himself. They charged me $45 just to give me a sales pitch of services that my little man "needs". They wanted $400 to test for heart worms and give him a shot of antibiotics. Not to mention that over a year ago, they recommended that I switch him from Revolution (which helps prevent heart worms) to Simparica, which does not. They assured me that Simparica was a better alternative. The technician had the audacity to say that "I" have not been treating him for heart worms. So sorry...I trusted an incompetent vet! Please don't take your babies here.

name: Marcus Luton
text: You guys are always so friendly and helpful! Dr Namie is a rockstar and has taken care of all my pets the last couple years and wouldn’t have it any other way.

name: Peggy Franks
text: Dr. Namie and staff are the best.  Thank you for the care you have provided to my fur babies.

name: Cynthia Wolters
text: Doctors are excellent and try to save any pet beyond what other vets would. Techs and staff is so awesome. I drive pasted several clinics due to the quality and services you will receive here. Highly recommend.

name: chanta mizrahi
text: They are a great place for your dog's and cats. They do great work. Go check them out.

name: cindi greer
text:
Helped me find owner of a lost fur baby
Everyone was really nice.

name: Paul G
text: They always take good care of my Ferrets

name: robert williams
text: We switched from 2nd avenue vet to here. Best decision we made for our pets. Great staff!

name: Suzanne Belcher
text: Amazing, caring and knowledgeable staff. Beautiful clinic and the staff really loves animals. I found the perfect vet!

name: Darrell Henderson
text: Takes good care of my pets.

name: Tina Baujan
text: We have lived in several different states moving around with the military and this is the best vets office we ever used. They took excellent care of our animals and have a very friendly staff that goes out of their way for you. I would highly recommend them to anyone!

name: Mitzi Winters
text: This is a great clinic! Professional staff, knowledgeable veterinarian, and the cleanest vet clinic I have ever seen. I feel good leaving my pet in their care.

name: Suzanne Rainey
text:
Run!!! Do NOT use Dr. Steve Griffen, especially do not use his partner, and stay away from the rude staff!! Money is ALL they care about!

I brought my dog here after he had been run over. I made a $200 deposit and explained that the rest would be paid when my husband was able to call me with the credit card number.

The estimate for care was WAY over the top!
I left my dog there and went home to make phone calls. I found much less expensive  estimates at EVERY other vet i called! I went to pick up my dog to take him elsewhere. They refused to give him to me until i paid them over $1000. (The ONLY thing they had done at this point was pain medication). 7 hours of care, he was kennelled!! They called the sheriff when i became angry and upset and would not let me see or have my dog. When my husband called with the number i had to leave my dog with them . It was too late to take him elsewhere, and the amount they had already charged me made it negligible.
EXCEPT: I get a phone call the next morning from Griffen telling me to pick up my dog. He wouldn’t do surgery on him “because he didn’t feel he could make me happy”!

My dog had been with them for over 24 hours. When I picked him up, his wound was not cleansed, or packed! It was left gaping open for infection! I was charged over $1000. For nothing!!!
THEY COMPLETELY MISSED THE FACT THAT MY DOG ALSO HAD A BROKEN PELVIS.

Go anywhere else!!!

name: Ben P
text:
Wife took our foster dog to this establishment, came home extremely upset. This facility is in dire need of a revamped customer service strategy. The staff made an honest mistake, no big deal. Handling this by lashing out and blaming the customer is not a good strategy. I hope my wife was not discriminated against for not being from the area...

To sum it up, we will not take any of our dogs here, and neither will anyone that I know.

name: mike green
text: We take our 3 dogs here for shots every year. They are nice and helpful each time.

name: Sara Dean
text: Great experience. Thank you Dr. Namie and staff!!!!

name: Debra Lobley
text: All of our pets are cared for by the wonderful staff and doctors at SSAS. The medical team is patient, caring and thorough. Highly recommend them.

name: Casey Poncini
text: What a horrific experience I just had at this place. The staff is just depressing. The receptionists do not smile at your nor make eye contact as you enter the establishment. The technician who "helped" me was just plain rude. There was some miscommuication regarding a health certificate I needed for a foster dog I was sending up north and when it had been filled out incorrectly she huffed and puffed and talked down to me to make sure I knew it was MY fault. Great customer service skills with that one, they should probably just keep her in the back away from paying clients. The doctor was incredibly condescending, talked down to me like I was stupid. Neither one of these individuals wanted to listen to what I had to say, they just needed to be correct. Just a horrible experiece from start to finish. I don't even know how these people are still in business.

name: Derek Thomas
text: Staff is great, my dogs love going

name: Andrea Ellison
text: After taking my dog there 3 times with an incorrect diagnosis all 3 times.  They were unable to identify a loud heart murmur as stated by a doctor at a different hospital.  Also when asked about my dogs heavy breathing I was told it was normal only to find out at a different vet that he had fluid in his lungs.  Two different doctors "examined" him and gave false diagnosis'.  After taking him 3 times I really feel they were just trying to get money and were absolutely clueless.

name: Wendy Hall
text: I can't say enough good things about this place. I always know my dog is in good hands.

name: Mindy Jo Milligan
text: Always thankful for all the staff and doctor's that help me spend another day with my doggies.

name: Jesse Crutcher
text: Love smith station!!  The doctors and techs are amazing--a true heart for animals and their owners.

name: MitchumLawn
text: excellent knowledgeable people who love your pet as much or more than you do!

name: tessa mcintire
text: Awesome staff and doctors!

name: Aaron Neal
text: Honestly, Best Vet clinic I've been too.

name: Brittany Norman
text: The doctor truly cares about the animals and will give you the best treatment possible.

name: Shawn Williams
text:
Relatively good staff and doctors but the cost of their services are absolutely outrageous. Went in for kitten booster and rabbies shot, was upsold a neuter and was told since I chose to have that done 3 additional tests each at $40 had to be done. The final bill was $198.76 when over the phone they quoted me at $80. Just checked around for another kitten I have and Affordable Veterinary in Columbus Ga has 5 stars, their prices I easily seen on their website and with a Neuter, boosters and rabbies with office visit it'll only be $68.

I don't know why Smiths Animal hospital has these prices but they are clearly over priced and for that much more over pricing something seems fishing. Maybe they just prey on the fact they're the only one in town. I'll be going to Columbus from now on!

name: Wendy Hall
text: Always takes great care of our dog Campton.

name: BILL SMOKE
text:
I live in Birmingham but my mother is now in assisted living close to this vet.
During my last trip down I left him at Smiths for a bath and nail trim. When I picked him up , we drove straight back to Bham. I noticed when I picked him up he was like a wild animal trying to get out of there. He has been to several other vets and I have never seen him act this way. When we got home ,I noticed blood on my seat. This was caused by having his one nail cut below the quick. It has been several days now and still gives him trouble. His regular vet said all can be done is allow time for it to grow out.
I WILL NEVER TAKE HIM BACK TO SMITHS STATION AGAIN ! THEIR PRICES WERE HIGH AND ALL I GOT FOR MY MONEY IS A INJURED PET.

name: Jennifer Neal
text: Friendly staff,  great veterinarian and they even call to check up on your animal later.

name: Kelly yaegel
text: They helped with the passing of our dog Apollo. They were very helpful and compassionate about the whole process.

name: Leslie Taylor
text: Drs. Namie and Griffin are truly the best veterinarians in the area, and I can say that truthfully, as I visited nearly every single one of them prior to finally settling at Smiths Station Animal Hospital as my clinic-of-choice nearly five years ago. I originally stumbled upon Dr. Griffin and SSAH when I was searching for a place to have my dog, Lou, who I had recently adopted from Columbus Animal Care and Control, treated for heart worms. At the time, I didn't have the funds available to pay for the fast-kill treatment, but every other clinic I had visited informed me that I had no other options, and that my dog would die very quickly if I refused to have the treatment performed. I met with Dr. Griffin that first day at SSAH, and he was the only veterinarian I had seen (out of at least a half dozen) who understood my predicament and explained that we could start Lou on the slow-kill treatment option until I had saved up the funds to do the fast-kill, as the slow-kill may not work long-term but would certainly extend and improve Lou's quality of life until I could afford the more expensive treatment, since it would prevent the heart worms from continuing to multiply and may even kill off some of the mature worms. SSAH was also the hospital I rushed my dog, Charlie, to the first time he had a seizure. My husband met with Dr. Namie that day, who ran a battery of tests that were all reasonably-priced, and who went over every detail of what she was doing, what it would cost, and what the short-term and long-term implications might be for our Charlie. It was that visit that solidified SSAH as our home clinic, if you will. Since then, we have taken no fewer than eight dogs and two goats to see Drs. Namie and Griffin, and each time we go we are treated like family. It is glaringly apparent that these doctors have a heart for animals that exceeds what one would think is possible for a normal human being. Dr. Namie has devoted hundreds of hours of her own personal time to care for animals at the clinic after-hours, including my own pets on multiple occasions. Every time we step into the clinic, our pets are greeted by name by nearly every member of their staff. Our pets are excited to visit their friends at SSAH, where they have been apprehensive of visits to other veterinary clinics in the past. Drs. Namie and Griffin and the staff at SSAH have always been available to answer my questions, even if I am unable to bring my pets in at the time. It is incredibly comforting to know that a professional, educated, experienced, and compassionate staff of veterinary medicine professionals are always just a phone call away in the event of an emergency. I recommend Drs. Namie and Griffin and the staff at SSAH to anyone and everyone who may be searching for a veterinary family to which they can trust their pets' care. Our pets are our family, and they are SSAH's family, as well; after five years of excellent medical, preventative, and emergency care administered by the doctors and staff at SSAH, that much is obvious. Do not hesitate to take your pets here. You will not be disappointed.

name: samantha thomas
text: This vet is amazing and really saved us after North side scared us all so bad. I wouldn't recommend North side to anyone they don't act right. They didn't introduce themselves to our dog, just grabbed him and started poking. In 10 years we have never had a problem at the vet, and they ruined it for us. Smith's Station understood our concerns and did everything to make us comfortable. The tech spent - minutes getting to know him and us, so did the vet. They also did the blood work in the room so I could be there to help hold him and keep him calm. Nicole Namie is our vet now she is so nice, answered all our question's knowledgably, and walked us step by step through everything. Im so glad we were able to start fresh at a new vet where they understand our animals are our babies. In fact they asked me "what's your babies name?" and "Bring your baby in to meet us!" They took their time with him not rushing him, and went through all our questions. I would recommend taking your babies to Smiths Station Animal Hospital!! Defiantly NOT North side animal hospital.

name: Jennifer Williams
text: Because some people don't know, 1-800-Petmeds does not get their products from the manufacturer. Veterinarians are the only ones legally to purchase certain products directly from the manufacturer. 1-800-Petmeds has a reputation for "illegally using" veterinarians DEA numbers. This can cause legal problems with vets, therefore a lot of vets will not fax directly to some online pharmacies. This is just a way for the vets to protect their identity and reputation. Most clinics do not mind writing a written prescription at all, I know Smiths Station does not mind. A lot of people do not know this information, neither did I until I asked. It makes sense. The reason for the tests is because heartworm preventions require a recent blood test. Its like when we go to the doctor, certain types of meds need bloodwork before prescriptions can be filled. If certain values are not where they need to be the medication could be harmful to the body. Sometimes we may think that ones policies and procedures are ridiculous and just another way to get money, but the true story is, the doctor and staff just want to make sure that the pet will not be harmed. I do know for a fact that most clinics, including SSAH will do their best at price matching online pharmacies. Never hurts to ask right :o) Novartis, the maker of Interceptor is not selling certain products to vets because of FDA requirements. SSAH has an online pharmacy you may want to check out as well.

name: Suzanne Rainey
text:
Run!!! Do NOT use Dr. Steve Griffen, especially do not use his partner, and stay away from the rude staff!! Money is ALL they care about!

I brought my dog here after he had been run over. I made a $200 deposit and explained that the rest would be paid when my husband was able to call me with the credit card number.

The estimate for care was WAY over the top!
I left my dog there and went home to make phone calls. I found much less expensive  estimates at EVERY other vet i called! I went to pick up my dog to take him elsewhere. They refused to give him to me until i paid them over $1000. (The ONLY thing they had done at this point was pain medication). 7 hours of care, he was kennelled!! They called the sheriff when i became angry and upset and would not let me see or have my dog. When my husband called with the number i had to leave my dog with them . It was too late to take him elsewhere, and the amount they had already charged me made it negligible.
EXCEPT: I get a phone call the next morning from Griffen telling me to pick up my dog. He wouldn’t do surgery on him “because he didn’t feel he could make me happy”!

My dog had been with them for over 24 hours. When I picked him up, his wound was not cleansed, or packed! It was left gaping open for infection! I was charged over $1000. For nothing!!!
THEY COMPLETELY MISSED THE FACT THAT MY DOG ALSO HAD A BROKEN PELVIS.

Go anywhere else!!!

name: Bianca M
text:
We had never been here before and needed to leave our dog with Indian Hills over the Thanksgiving weekend. She came back happy and clean (all pets are required to leave with a bath) which was lovely.

However, there were a few problems.

First, there is a gray cat that wanders around in the lobby. I might be a bit more understanding if the cat was relaxed and calm, but it clearly doesn’t like dogs (hissed at ours as soon as it walked in). It was walking all over the counter and floors when we dropped off and picked up, and was actively rubbing itself on the items owners were leaving for their dogs. Everyone in my household has cat allergies, so this was very unwelcome for us. Additionally, not all dogs can handle being around a cat or their scent, and with leashes coming off and on there is way too much opportunity for an attack to happen. That puts people’s dogs AND the cat in danger, which just seems so irresponsible for a clinic/boarding facility.  As we were picking up, we also witnessed this cat suddenly scratch a woman that had been petting it. I know cats can be finicky but what if that had been a child?

Our second issue was that we had to ask where the rest of her items were when we came to pick her up as they weren’t with her bag. Their boarding paperwork requires you list all the items you will be leaving with your pet, so what was the point of filling it out if it doesn’t matter?

Third, we left exactly enough food for our dog to be fed for 6 mornings and 6 nights when we dropped her off Monday morning, so you can imagine our surprise when we saw 2 bags of food left. When we asked the receptionist why she still had food left over, she directed us to someone who might have been feeding her for the time she was there. He said that he and one other person were responsible, yet when we asked he couldn’t explain why there were 2 bags left. First he said he didn’t know, then he said she ate everyday. Which means she either ate someone else’s food or someone didn’t feed her. Either way he clearly didn’t know and didn’t want to get in trouble. We label her food bags because she has to take a fish pill for constipation in the morning(which we leave in the bag) and both bags were morning bags, so that’s 2 days of her stay where she didn’t get her food OR her pill. It’s unacceptable that no one could answer whether or not she had been fed. If she had just not eaten on those days I would understand, but they didn’t even know the answer to that.

I will say that our dog was clearly much calmer and happier at the end of her stay than she has been at other dog boarding facilities, but sadly the other issues will likely keep us from using this facility in the future.
