text:
I had scheduled about 2 weeks ago an appointment to have my dogs teeth cleaned.
I received a quote in the amount of $180.00. About a week ago the office called me and told
me that my quote was incorrect and that the new quote would be $309.00
Today 03/16/15 the offfice called me again (let the phone ring only once) and told me that the quote
has changed to around $500.00. Now this price doesn't include hospitalization or any extras.
When I let the lady in the office know that my dog will not stay over night she replied; we have
7 surgeries for that day and we can't promise you anything. Which to me means well I guess your dog will stay overnight and you will have additional charges.
I am looking at my quote  which I received about two weeks ago and in the price of $180.00 the
hospitalization for that day is included. Since the teeth cleaning supposed to be done on 03/18/15 I have decided not to go with this animal clinic since I might land up paying more than I should!

name: sara ellington
text: After going to another vet with my first puppy,  leaving with unanswered questions, and not getting the compassion I felt like he deserved from a serious heart condition at his age I decided to go to another vet in Tuscaloosa for a second opinion and I'm so glad I did. Indian Hills was so great to my first puppy and has been just as good my current one. Every time I come in the staff is so friendly and accomidating. They will walk over just to pet him and say how handsome he is. They all clearly love animals and care beyond what just a job would require. I haven't had a single bad experience there that they could help and even when I had to come in to put my first puppy down at 17 weeks old Dr. Smith stayed with me after they closed and let me have my time to come to terms with what was happening while giving me comforting words. Even today when I came in to get treatment for my current puppy they all listened to my concerns about antibiotics destroying all the good bacteria in my dogs stomach and gave me some probiotics to help him. Indian Hills is definitely my go to choice for a vet in Alabama.

name: Clarice Westover
text: DO NOT board your dogs here. The staff is rude, off putting, and clearly does NOT understand dog behavior NOR do they practice stress reducing handling. My usual amazing vet (Animal Medical Center) was booked for the 4th of July holiday so I had to take my 2 dogs here. Upon dropping them off the vet tech removed both of their collars which I found VERY unusual. I asked and they said it was for safety? NEVER have my dogs’ collars been removed when they were boarded. But alas, it was the rules and I had a vacation to get to. An HOUR after I had left and am well out of town, I receive a call saying that my Great Dane/Pit was “too aggressive” to be boarded with them and “needed to be removed.” I was shocked. Never has this happened at any other boarding place! I drive all the way back and a vet took me back to the boarding area to remove my dog myself! Have you seen the boarding area?? YIKES. The beds and toys I had given them weren’t even in their “kennel” (shelter holding cage it looked more like) and they said some BS about how they had to de-tag everything? Who knows if my one dog even had her things with her during her stay. After collecting my “aggressive” dog, I called AMC and told them what happened. They thought it was ridiculous and made room for my baby! They even LAUGHED when I told them Indian Hills said he was too aggressive. AMC understands dog behavior, Indian Hills does NOT. I even connected with another woman on Facebook who said that her pit mix was refused as well. Breed discrimination? I think YES. If I could give zero stars I would.

text: My 2 cats were treated first last summer for flea bite allergy skin problems.  Two brutal summers battling this problem with little help from vets we saw.  I met Jonathan, Vet Tech at Emergivet and was so impressed with his manner that when I found out he also works full time for Dr. Phillip Smith I made a follow up appointment for both cats to be seen.  They changed their topical flea Rx, gave them combination cocktail injections and within a week problems resolved and stayed resolved all summer.  Before we could get our 12 yr old standard dachshund in for a geriatric evaluation as planned, he had to be seen following a first time acute pancreatitis episode that came on when we were traveling. His treatment by Dr.Smith and staff was thorough, compassionate, and confidence inspiring to anxious owners with a very ill dog.  We are happy to have found him and everyone who works there to deliver the vet care we expected but had been unable to find.

text: STAY FAR AWAY!! they are all smiles with bad ethics. I would not wish anyone on this horribly ethical place. I had an emergency shortly before they were closing. My dog was seriously wounded and needed medical attention. They looked at her and gave an assessment then told me i needed to take her to the after hours clinic because they were closing. WTH!! What kind of ethical vow did this doctor take?!?! Then they slapped a $600+ bill on me. Are you insane, you just pushed me out the door after an x ray and some pain killers. My dog was dying. It will be my mission to have this doctors(one from a year ago,female, but I'm sure the same lousy staff is there) license revoked. On top of that the sleazy vet tech reported my dog because she bit me while in shock, seconds after she was hit by a car, so after she was eventually put down the state took her from me to cut her open and look for rabies. Which is a backdoor for the government to do animal testing. She had up to date shots and results were negative. STAY WAY !!!

text: I would prefer to not even give them one star. This office gave us bad instructions on after care for our dog after getting spayed there. They gave her a 24 hour pain shot and told us she shouldn't need pain meds after that but if she did give her liquid Tylenol and Ibuprofen, to dose her as a 40lb child. After the day she was still acting like she was in pain so we did what they said not thinking to research before we did because a vets office told us to do it. 3 days after her surgery she was still acting like she was in pain and then started to act like she didn't feel well at all. Called our previous vet to be told ibuprofen and Tylenol are harmful and toxic to dogs and could kill her!! $210 , a very sick dog, another vet visit, and emergency vet visit later and she's finally starting to act like she feels better!! When we called Colbert Animal Clinic back they told us again she could have ibuprofen and Tylenol!!

PS  I want to add to my review I called with a very very sick pet cat that was like my baby my human baby he turned 11 September 5th I kept trying take  him in to the Dr ...they had a answering  machine message he'll be in tomorrow  then then a week had gone bye ,  the Dr  was sick i can understand that, I talk to his wife normally she is very considerate ,  concerning,  caring..she finally answered,, I describe my baby's symptoms and she told me that they couldnot help him I  needed take him to another vet for blood work  and possibly for blood transfusion and a lot of other things , she told me he would die..... then she told me I have other patients I've got to see hung up.... to me that was a little cold hearted , we were going to take him the next day  to another  veterinarian .....now my feelings have changed because he did die my baby boy .   very hurtful because he was a one-of-a-kind cat my baby boy I won't forget this a piece of my heart went with him.......they should have left a message not sure when the Dr will be in ......take your pet to another vet................. the message was very misleading................now we are watching his sister close because it seems she is greaving  over her brother they were born at the same time it's like they were twins..................

name: Tina Peden

name: R S
text:
I was leery of the quality and cleanliness of this veterinarian’s office because of all the “stuff” (aka junk) piled in various spots around the outside of the building.  When I took my animal inside, the stench of litter box odor filled the air.  There was a cat on the receptionist's counter, one on a bench in the waiting room, one behind the receptionist's desk, and I think another cat was present.  I was too shocked to really remember.  When we walked towards the exam room, the smell seemed to be stronger and I noticed things appeared to be dirty.  I declined service and stated we were leaving because it was too dirty and smelly.

I had phoned around for prices on vaccinations, and this place was one of the cheapest.  We recently moved to the area and our small-town vet back home had a building that wasn’t fancy or anything special to look at from the outside.  However, the outside was always clean and maintained, and the inside was spotless.  I hate to judge a book by its cover, but in this case the outside spoke for the inside.  I highly recommend taking your pet elsewhere.  When I left the Colbert Animal Clinic I phoned the Tennessee Valley Animal Clinic, which is located up the highway about a mile.  They offered to work my pet in and were only a few dollars higher.  It was money well spent to have my pet cared for in a clean and well maintained facility.

The staff at the Colbert Animal Clinic seemed friendly and nice, but I was only in there for a couple of minutes.  On the phone the receptionist mentioned they offered kennel services; but after seeing the office, I can only imagine the condition of the garage where they kennel pets.  Do yourself and your pet a favor, spend a few bucks more and drive up the highway to the Tennessee Valley Animal Clinic or another local vet.  Surely there can't be one that is more smelly, filthy, or dirty.

name: Leslie Brown
text:
I agree with the many points of the previous review. The staff was nice and friendly, but the place could use some picking up. As far as first impressions go, many bad ones were made right off the bat.  Upon my arrival, all of the techs were sitting outside smoking which, in my opinion, should be done at the back of the facility.  Upon entering the facility, I also smelled the litter boxes and the smell was so strong that when I left I had to roll my car windows down to air out a bit. There were at least 5 cats on the counter, two of which kept getting in my way to fill out my paperwork and another swatted at me in an aggressive manner for no reason.

The place employs nice people, but they REALLY need to clean up a bit.

name: Bertdell Estep
text: I came to this office pto have my dog neutered after adopting him from the animal shelter. This was the only 1/2 I could choose from that had an opening available in the time frame I needed. The staff was extremely nice however they were all out smoking upon my arrival from drop off and pick up which is super unprofessional in my opinion. The entry way is very messy and the establishment itself was a bit of an eye sore. Arriving I was extremely surprised and almost confused. After entering it was quite a mess. The establishment reaked with the overwhelming smell of ammonia I assume from all of the cats that were running around. It was so bad that I couldn't breathe and my head began to hurt. I was counting the seconds until I could leave because of this... Behind the counter where you could see while filling out paper work was disgusting and unclean to say the least. There were also cracks between the floor and wall caked with dirt and debris as well. There is duct tape holding their scale wires to the wall and numerous random food items and personal items scattered though the shelves of the weight intake area. I was worried to leave my dog here because of the conditions, immediately after leaving I wanted to turn around and bring him home. Though the staff was nice and courteous I will be sure to take my business to a more clean and sterile environment from here on out. My personal preference is Animals Choice in Iuka.

text: Our family's pets have been patients of MRVC for decades. My wife and I rescued a kitten that showed up at my office at the cold beginning of December. The kitten ended up having no health problems (no worms, etc.) based on the initial exam at MRVC. Despite the kitten's good health, we have been charged $435 by MRVC in the past month to spay and vaccinate this rescue kitten. They made us come back multiple times for the vaccinations of the kitten and charged us an office visit each time. I understand that MRVC has to stay in business but this is absurd, especially when we're trying to save the kitten's life! You try to do something good and get punished for it. This experience really left a bad impression, combined with them charging us $170 to euthanize our old Chihuahua a few months before.

name: Dustin Wilson
text:
This morning we put our dog Fry to sleep.  Its one of the hardest things I've ever had to do after bonding with that pup for almost 14 years.

Never an easy thing to do regardless of circumstance, Dr. Long, showed genuine empathy and compassion to our pain.  He was reassuring, kinda, gentle and even seemed emotionally connected to us and Fry Dog Dog.

I don't suppose its easy for the staff to put an animal to sleep any more than it is for the family to say good bye, but there was some feeling of respect for our dog, and respect for our process.

Fry had been seeing Dr Long for a while and they always treated him with love and happiness and he never was scared or upset to go see any of the people at the office.

This is a practice full of kindness, intelligence, and good people who seem to absolutely take pride in what they do.

text: Dr. Karen Lamb and staff are fantastic.  We are so happy that we brought our Boston Terrier Dolly to Dr. Karen today. She took the time to listen, was not pushy, nor quick to diagnose but gave her a thorough exam.  She even got down on the floor to examine her at her level, and to love on her.  Reasonable pricing as well compared to other vets.  We highly recommend Dr. Lamb.  She is now our vet.  Thank you.  Bob and Cathy

text: Our pups have received wonderful care from Dr. Karen Lamb (and Laura) since 2008. She is calm, caring, and capable, and has always been understanding about our dog’s anxiety issues.

name: R. Fortner
text: We love Karen Lamb!  She has taken the best and most pragmatic approach to our pets' well being. Even when our big dog passed unexpectedly, she stepped up and helped us with the things our family wanted to do to honor our pup. And very importantly, she has never tried to juice us for extra and unnecessary services or procedures so that she can fund an additional annex to facilities like her equals down the street.  We are never on the defense when going to her. We know she is on our team!!

name: Dawn Davis
text: Karen Lamb discharged me from her practice because her employee didn't order my dogs prescription medication.  I called and ordered it at the beginning of the week, called to check on it and they didn't have it.  I asked if I could get it from another vets office and the employee said Dr. Lamb would call me back.  I was at work when she called me back, yelling at me and saying I was a difficult customer.  I was sitting with other nurses, on my lunch, and they could hear her going off.  I asked them if I was at all mean or nasty when I called the office about the medication and they all said not at all. She discharged me and my dog was out of her medication.  Very irresponsible.  I thought she was a great vet until this happened.

name: Dillie Meeks-Alexander
text: Our little poodle, Summer, had been a patient of Dr Lamb for several years, and Summer always received excellent care from Dr Lamb and her staff.  Summer became very ill, very suddenly last week; unfortunately her health issue was beyond treatment at that point; she had to be put down.  Dr. Lamb was so knowledgeable, kind, caring, sympathetic as was everyone at her practice that afternoon and the days following.  The compassion and comfort we received eased the burden of losing our precious baby.  We highly recommend Dr Lamb and Complete Care for your vet needs.

name: Joy Bard
text: Karen Lamb is, hands down, the best vet I have ever had care for my fur baby.  She's  knowledgeable, direct and above all super down to earth.  Take your pets to her, you won't regret it.

name: Leslie Dice
text: I took my Sadie to Complete Care with severe dry eye in one eye (due to previous injury) and severe skin allergies that my previous vet has made 0 progress in treating over multiple visits (and hundreds of dollars) over the last year. They were wonderful about scheduling my appointment around my work hours. Dr Lamb was awesome...understanding of my frustration and taking time to explain possible approaches, timelines, hopeful results and alternatives we would try until we find my girl some relief. I'm so ecstatic to say it has only been one week and Sadie's eye is AMAZINGLY improved and we are following a strict diet in hopes that by the time we go back for a follow up, I'll be able to say the same about her skin. I honestly cannot wait to go back and thank Dr Lamb personally!!! I have found a new vet for life!!

name: Kevin Dowd
text:
My daughter had to bring a 3 mo old Golden retriever in for a major fracture of his right front paw. First of all the staff was extremely professional, polite, and reassuring. Next, we met with Dr Moore. This man was the best vetinarian I've ever come in contact with in my entire life. Compassion towards the animal, compassion towards my daughter, and an explanation of what needed to be done, what should be done, and the outcome expected. There was no condescension, no rushing to the next client, just pure concern and interest for the patient before him.
I know ppl hate being compared to others, but for those of you who watch the Incredible Dr.Pol, I think this is about as close as it gets as in the style, skill, and compassion displayed by Dr. Moore.
Just a huge thank you to the entire staff for taking care of Shadow, and for putting my daughter at ease.

Hi Sandra, Thank you for your feedback. At Bell Veterinary Hospital,

name: Melissa Burton
text: Friendly, but overpriced. They don't accept checks. Rather you pay cash. Will charge you extra if you use a debt card. Make sure you know what you are going to be charged before hand.

resp.text: Hi Melissa: Thank you for bringing your concerns about our hospital to our attention, and we appreciate your acknowledgment of our staff’s friendly client service. Our fees are based on our own costs to provide what we feel is exceptional care. Making sure your pet has the best and most current diagnostics, surgical equipment, and experienced staff ultimately pays off in the long run, because it results in fewer tests and procedures as well as healthier animals. Our policy regarding checks is one we arrived at after long experience and is not intended to be punitive or insulting, but one we had to adopt as a business because checks are no longer a reliable form of payment. We do pass along a small processing fee for credit and debit card use to avoid raising the cost of our veterinary services to cover them. As always, the health and well-being of your pets is our priority, and we hope to have the opportunity to provide care for them in the future. We would also welcome the opportunity to discuss your concerns personally and invite you to contact us at the hospital at (205) 486-4500 if you wish to do so.

text: Dr. Forrest was great when we took our dog there. He is very compassionate. The reason why I will not go back is because of the front desk lady. One charge for my dogs nail trim while he was sedated before a procedure was almost 18.00.  She is the reason we will never step foot back in that clinic.

name: Brandon Arnett
text:
Let me begin by saying the Vet and his assistant were great. They were kind and compassionate and my short experience with them were wonderful. But the lady working the reception...by far the WORST encounter I have ever had.
I am not one to complain, I do not believe "the customer is always right" and I also understand sometimes you just catch people on a bad day, but even on my WORST day I have never treated another person the way this woman treated me.
Long story short, I took a dog in off the street, she turned out to be pregnant and had a litter of 10 puppies. At six weeks old I vaccinated them and de-wormed them, however one was failing to thrive. She quickly became ill and lethargic. I called to get an appointment to have her be seen. (My regular vet was absolute packed out due to the holiday weekend and suggested I call around to try to be seen as quickly as possible) I booked an appointment with Forrest Vet Clinic for later that day. However, the puppy quickly took a turn for the worst and so I rushed her in to be seen early. I knew enough to know it wasn't parvo (and it wasn't) but the dog was definitely suffering from something serious.

The receptionist greeted me with absolute contempt. While the dog convulsed and whimpered she stood there arguing that I never told her the dog was sick (of course I did but I was too polite to argue) she then curls her lip and says "you probably haven't even vaccinated it!" I explained I did and told her the brand used. She goes off on me. Rolled her eyes, told me I wasn't qualified, lectured me about how I had no clue to be buying some shot from a co-op (they were vet recommended and exceptionally reviewed vaccines by the way) all the mean while the dog is suffering terribly and shes too busy rolling her eyes at me to see anything is done about it.
Her terrible behavior continues until I feel about as big as an ant and like I am human garbage. You would of thought I was some back yard breeder who brought in a trash bag of starved puppies and dumped them in her cornflakes.
She continued to roll her eyes and curl her lip and snarl remarks at me until my sobbing 7 yr old whispers to me "mommy why is that lady making mean faces to you?" She announces loudly (but to no one because the place was all but empty) "that dog could have any contagious thing and we don't want it spreading it around. (understandably but come on, have some discreetness)
When the vet saw the pup he was incredibly kind about it, the tech was very compassionate and concerned for my nearly traumatized child who watched the pup convulse and die.
When it was all over I gathered what little nerves I had left and asked through humiliation and tears what the vet would charge to have the puppies de-wormed again at their office. The receptionist snarled yet again and said "Well I don't know. Who knows what you've given them and what you haven't and when!" and huffed at me.
I was tempted to take the remaining 9 (and exceptionally healthy and thriving pups) and dump them in her lap and ask her to so kindly home and feed and medicate and adopt out a group of rescue mutts in the middle of summer.
I was doing everything I could to keep this litter out of the humane society and it's been no easy financial or emotional task, but this cruel ladies absolute lack of compassion and decency had be more humiliated and disgusted then I have ever been. I had to pull over on the way home and just cry from the stress and humiliation of the entire experience.
I am not a breeder, these were rescues, I intend to ask no money for any of these precious puppies, and until I find them safe and loving homes I will be footing the bill for vaccines, food, etc. It's expensive and stressful but I am not some careless human garbage and never should of been spoken to as such.
So beware. It's a shame because the rest of the clinic seemed absolutely lovely, but I would crawl through hot sand and razor blades before I ever faced that woman at the desk again.

name: Heather Marie
text: I brought my cat in for a UTI, and they didn't run any tests. Now, I had to take my cat somewhere else to find out he is too sick. I wasted money in that office, just to have to go somewhere else! If they had done their job my Pepper would be at home sitting in his sunny spot on the back of the couch. I called back and asked for the office manager and was told she was her when i asked to speak to the owner i was told that he was with a client and i left a number and name and when  she asked me what it was in refrence to i told her a pet and and she responded that he would not call me back if i was not a client.  all i could say was WOW.  if they will treat the owner like this you might want to rethink taking your pet because your pet can not let you know that they have been mistreated.

name: Demario Clarke
text: My experience was horrible I took my nine year pitbull in to be  spayed on a Wednesday evening and picked her up on Friday and noticed she was not acting herself. So I told the staff she wasn't acting right and they assured me that she should be ok and she was  just in recovery mode.  With that being said I call the Dr. On Monday and told him that she was  not still progressing the way I thought I she should have being, and again he assured me she should be ok and to bring her in if I seen any problems at the surgery site. Well here it goes I get home from work the next day which is Tuesday and she was bleeding and had herniated at the surgery site so i immediately took her back in. Dr beech immediately noticed that this was bad and she was rushed to the back for surgery. 3 hours later she was gone. Basically  3 days after i picked her up she died from a simple spayed. This has hurt my whole family in ways him any of his staff would ever know as I stated to him it seems like I give him 200 dollars to put him down.😓😓😓😓😓😓😓

text: I took my blue and gold macaw in yesterday for a beak trim and wing trim. He was unbelievably knowledgeable very respectful and great with my bird. text: Best veterinarian office period.  The staff is always friendly and helpful.  I live 45 min away and will still go here. Dr. Bruce is top notch.  Anytime we bring our pets in to see him, he always makes the right call. The man has years of experience and is good for conversation.  If you have an emergency situation, say your dog getting hit by a car like mine did, they will take her in immediately.  I trust my animals in their care.

text: The only vet in town that I trust.  Great staff and Dr. Bruce is great.

name: Gabi Marie
text: I went to OAHC because of the cheaper neutering. My dog seemed well taken care of and surgery went well. They even called me to update me. The girls in the front are always nice and helpful. After this first experience I decided I would probably use them for all my vet needs. So fast forward to the last visit. I brought my dog in because he’s been sneezing AND having breathing problems. I knew the sneezing was probably allergies but the breathing scared me. The girls up front were nice as always. Then it came time to see the vet. He did a quick examination and explained his throat was swollen and that he was going to give him antibiotics. It had bothered me that he didn’t explain what was causing the sneezing and sore throat. When he came back he went straight into talking about the pills. I had to interrupt just to ask questions. He never once asked me if I had any questions or if there was anything else I was concerned with. I still don’t know what my dog is allergic to and the breathing problems were never addressed at all, which is what made me nervous enough to go to the vet in the first place. I feel like being asked “do you have any questions?” Or just pausing to let me talk should’ve been common practice, especially if I’m paying over $100 by the time I’m leaving. And all concerns should’ve been addressed.

Calls were made back and forth about when I could pick him up and finally I was told he was ready at 5:45....15 minutes before they close! I was charged an additional 50 dollars for the extra 2 nights he was in because I couldn't pick him up on the 4th of July. Very unhappy with this place! Not recommended.

text:
I have known Dr. Bruce  my entire life....My parents used him before they passed and I have been taking my animals to Dr. Bruce for 35 years. Years ago I had a dog that was attacked by a pack of dogs and hurt badly.  Dr. Bruce actually stayed several nights at his clinic with my Gus...Gus was there 9 days and survived. Not only is Dr. Bruce , smart he is very honest, a man of the superior integrity, and believes in always doing the right thing  and will work 200% on your pet to save it's life or simply vaccinating.
He always explains the prognosis and his plan to help or save your pet. I highly respected Dr. BRUCE
He IS the best veterinarian bar none. He loves all animals and I have had many he has put down for me over the years....he stays with you and has  so much empathy while you are crying and saying good bye to your beloved!
Dr  Bruce is Awsome as well as his stsff....

.

name: Cherri Thompson
text: On Febuary 12th 2018, after taking our chocolate lab to several other vets, with little hope of keeping my companion alive my husband took him to see Dr. Bruce at Animal Health Center as a walk-in. Without hesitation or questions Dr. Bruce examined Brownie. Other vets told us "this is out of my league" and another commented "we will have to put him to sleep." By this time I had tears streaming down my face, just the thought of no other options broke my heart. Dr. Bruce examined Brownie and told us it was cancer in his tail. His next step was to exray his whole body to see if it spread to other parts. Never uttering the words, "put to sleep" at this time.  After exraying and examining my labrador, Dr. Bruce gave my husband our options. On febuary 13th, Dr. Bruce operated on our lab and saved his life. Now he has a beautiful stump for a tail and is getting stronger every day. There are no words that will express what a genuinely caring, compassionate, and fearless veternarian Dr. Buddy Bruce is today. I want to thank him for giving my family our friend and faithful companion the chance for more time together. It is wonderful to see someone who cares for all animals, and is not afraid to offer other options for treatment. Brownie was the best Valentine gift a person could ask for on this febuary 14th, 2018. Dr. Bruce and his staff were the greatest. I personally want to thank you Dr. Bruce for saving Brownies life. Cherri Thompson and family.

name: Melissa Harville
text: Dr. Hardyman and Dayna are absolutely wonderful. They saved my cat’s life and were both thorough and knowledgeable and took their time explaining everything to us during the weeks we have been working with them to get him well again. They never got in a hurry and went above and beyond to make our experience with them wonderful. The clinic is not a bright shiny new facility, you wouldn’t even know it was there if you weren’t looking for it, but the level of personal care we received was beyond exceptional. They take their time with you at every visit and there is never a line of people waiting to make them rush to get to the next patient. We trust them with all of our pets and will never go anywhere else. I truly can’t thank both of them enough for everything they did for our boy. If you’re looking for a new veterinarian, you can’t find a better one in our area!

text: Very good Dr. Great service

name: Lynn Harrison
text: This small vet clinic off 98 in Daphne, is dedicated to giving the best services for animals for the best cost. Dana, the receptionist and tech helper, is so kind and knowledgeable. Dr. Hardyman and Dana recently helped me through a difficult decision about my best friend of 12 years. Though I am still grieving the loss, I will be forever grateful for the help we received at Daphne Animal Hospital. There could not be a more compassionate animal clinic.

name: Zeadok
text: Fantastic family run practice. Dr Hardyman is very knowledgeable and explains everything very clearly. He was wonderful with my pets and his staff is fantastic!

name: Scott & Debra Henning
text: I took my 4 month old kitten Gracie to be spayed and get her vaccinations and boarded her for a week. They were supposed to call me after her procedure they didn't call so I called them to check on her they said she did well. On Friday when I called to tell them I was on my way to pick her up that's when the young lady told me that she had a couple raw spots on her face from rubbing her face on the cage needless to say when I got there and saw her I was very upset it looked very bad I asked if I needed to put medicine on it the vet told me no that they had put cream on it that it would be fine. She also had a bump the size of my knuckle in between her eyes. Well 3 days later it got progressively worse so I contacted them and I asked them what should I do she said bring her in for a checkup. I asked if there was a charge she said yes 50.00 I said I didn't feel that I should be charged since this happened to my baby on their watch so she said let me ask the vet she came back said no charge I then told her i didn't appreciate the way my kitten was treated that I was going to take her else where.  Her response was oh ok. Today I took Gracie to another vet and they said it's a bacterial infection and gave her antibiotics for a week then want to see her again in a week. I will post this to their FB page as well with a picture of my sweet Gracie

name: Sandi Cushway
text: Great vet and staff

name: Vonemetrica Gordon
text: Great

name: Janet57 Beaches3532
text: Friendly front desk staff.

name: Janis Taylor
text: Standifer has been taking care of my doggos since I moved to Birmingham. They always do whatever I request for grooming and my girls get wonderful vet care as well. The curbside service is so convenient... hope it remains an option even after the pandemic.

name: Teresa Allen
text: Great..everyone was good and easy to talk too..will be back

name: Tammi McClain
text: We love the staff they r the best my puppy is treated very well dr.Houston takes very good care of her

name: Morgan Fortenberry
text: Incredibly kind and helpful group of people who obviously care about the pets and their owners. I had an emergency with my kitty and they were the first animal clinic to show concern for his well being. I am very thankful for their help.

name: Elizabeth C
text: This is the cleanest vet I’ve ever been to. The veterinarians and the techs were amazing. I felt like they genuinely cared about the welfare of my cat. She was sick and needed to be seen ASAP and they squeezed me in same day appointment.

name: Griff Perry
text: Never thought I'd be leaving negative reviews on a business, but here I am. My wife and I had our 2 dogs boarded with Madison Animal Care Hospital over Memorial Day weekend. One thing that bothered me is that even though we were back in town on Monday they were closed so we couldn't pick them up. They still charged us for the day they were closed, but refused to let us pick them up. First red flag. When I picked them up Tuesday I noticed they had a green/yellow discharge coming from their eyes. I took them back to Madison Animal Care Hospital to get them looked at. Turns out they both had eye infections. Best part is they charged me full price for the examinations, tests, and medicine. No discount at all even though the most likely cause was from something they got into while being boarded by the same facility. Seems like this business is a little money hungry and they lack respect towards the people putting money in their pockets.

name: James
text:
Take my Bengal cat Zeus here for his checkups and they are always professional. Zeus is very aggressively to people that he doesn't know and Dr MaGee has been very good about making sure he's comfortable.

I would definitely recommend this place.

name: April Farr
text: Amazing staff and they really take care of all your pets needs and answer questions that you have. They also don't try to sell you unnecessary stuff. Highly recommend this place.

name: Niki Wallwork
text: Let me just say that I was totally impressed with the employees and facility.  The staffed were so very polite, kind, and caring.

name: Jamie Schwab
text: Amazing facility, friendly staff and life saving vets make this a remarkable veterinary hospital.

name: Gina Crumpton
text: This place was amazing with both of my animals & worked to help me get the best treatment fo them on my budget.

name: Ashley Archey
text: Super friendly staff. DVM Brian was very helpful and informative.

name: Marc Harms
text: I've been bringing my puppy here for about 10 months now.  If your only concern is price, you can find cheaper elsewhere, but the quality of care here is wonderful.  I had to board mordecai here for 4 days, and I got him back clean and happy.  He had a blast.

name: Brian Randall
text: Dr. McGee and his staff are great. They were very professional, caring and knowledgeable  from our 1st visit at 6 weeks to Trane's transition 13 and a half years later. I give my highest recommendation to Madison Animal Care. Thanks for everything

name: Becky G
text: I was extremely satisfied with everyone at the facility. The doctor and staff were very helpful and the whole visit from start to finish, was fast and efficient! Will recommend to my friends and family. ❤❤

name: Pat Williams
text: Took my dog here for 15 years for exams, shots, weekly baths, and grooming.  Every experience was top notch.  Now starting again with new puppy.  Highly recommend for professional service, TLC for pet, and friendliness of all staff.

name: lynette Huggins
text: The facility is outstanding. The staff are kind, compassionate and caring. My furr-baby and I will be coming back for "Doggy Day Care" next week🐱🦮

name: Hodges Ingram
text: Rocky loves Madison Animal Hospital they are great!

name: Kyle Griffin
text: They take great care of our dog. They have wonderful employees that love our dog and also have great facilities for them to play in during the day.

name: Kelsey Snyder
text: I’ve been bringing my difficult dog here for boarding and routine vet visits for the past few years and always have positive experiences! My pup isn’t happy when we get there but he’s always happy by the time we leave! Great staff, unlike the place on Hughes rd near Hwy 72. I’m very happy that the MACH staff takes the time to make my not-so-easy keeper feel comfortable, highly recommend this place!

name: Jade Chappell
text: Everyone is always so kind and welcoming when I have to visit. They go to great lengths to make sure that their patients and their parents are well taken care of. Highly recommend!

name: Mallory Dotson
text: Great place to bring my dog for vet care and daycare! The staff loves her as much as she loves them! Everyone is very friendly and accommodating. I would recommend this place for all pet needs!

name: Greg Redic
text: I received an estimate for service for $772 from them to treat a dog that was suspected to have pneumonia (we have another dog that was treat elsewhere a week prior with the same symptoms and the cost was less than $200). I was shocked by their pricing.

name: Eric Tran
text:
I had been taking my pets to this animal hospital for over 5 years. I've never had an issue with them, yet I don't know if the owners change or if it's just the staff.

I took my dog in to get an annual procedure. With the Covid19, everything is curbside now. The person came to the door and asked is this all we're doing or did I want to do blood work as well. I asked how much the blood work was and how much the full total was going to be. She estimated around $250. So I signed off and all was good. I had the vet come out and talk to me about my dogs health and it was all good. She told me someone would call me shortly so I could pay the bill over the phone. When they called, they said I owned $480.80. I asked her what happened to the $250 I was quoted? I completely understand an estimate is just that, an estimate. Yet when you're jumping over 100% over it's ridiculous. She told me someone would call me the next day to discuss.

I get a call from Christy who then tries to inform me that I was quoted $250 for the blood work only. She was very condescending and tried to pin this on me. Lucky for me, I keep a dash cam for insurance reasons and was able to send her the video of the whole conversation.

After they reviewed she calls me back and the first thing she says is "You win, we lose. $250 is the total." She proceeded to speak in a very condescending manner to me. This wasn't about winning or losing. She then tried to tell me that me recording on public property was illegal with a bit more rude attitude. I wonder how'd she feel to know I also record all my phone calls as well.

I say all this to state that I wouldn't go back her. I've been a loyal customer for over 5 years and have spent literally thousands on my animals. I guess $250 is worth more than a loyal customer.

name: Hannah Land
text: We have been taking our pets here for over ten years; the staff are always professional and helpful.

name: Shachar Newton
text: Our dog Kali goes to the daycare here and she seems to like it. The prices are pretty reasonable.

name: J C
text: We have taken our dog here for over 12 years and have had a wonderful experience everytime. They are friendly and caring to our sweet pup each visit.

name: david levine
text:
Dr. McGee and his staff were awesome..
My 1st. Time in for a second opinion on my Ridgeback's back leg which has been troublesome..
I have met plenty of veterinarians throughout my years. Mc Gee took his time examining Kobe.. there is no doubt in my mind he is a straight shooter, and very knowledgeable in regard to his practice. Unlike other vets in the past, he made no attempt to sell me unnecessary procedures. Should either of my dogs ever need further assistance, I will not hesitate  going back to Doctor McGee. The young lady's managing the front desk were absolutely delightful also. Money is not a question when it comes to our loving companions, but I will add, the fees charged are quite reasonable.

name: Jean Jett
text: Fast service. My little Toy Dalnn m Arian did great there.

name: Tuere Kemp
text: Found a puppy that escaped from his home and they helped me return him to his owner

name: Frances Linares
text: WORST PLACE EVER DO NOT TAKE YOIR ANIMALS HERE !!! They will charge you for things that they are not even doing they will not even examine your dog and charge you for it please save yourself before coming here

name: MC Ortiz
text: My girl absolutely loves going! The staff are wonderful with her and she comes home after a long day of playing all tired out.

name: Kay Lamar
text: I have been going here on and off for the last 9 years and the staff and doctors are amazing, caring and so gentle. I appreciate the fact that they understand and consider your feelings when it pertains to your pets. Thank you for always being awesome.

name: Claire Troutman
text: My family has been going here for years and we absolutely love the staff. They're super friendly. With both people and animals! They listen and suggest things that would benefit the health of your furry friends.

name: Myles Boone
text: They refuse to send prescriptions to online pet pharmacies. Clearly a money grab. Take your business somewhere that cares about your pet's health and your convenience than making money.

resp.text: You can request a written prescription to send into any online pharmacy you wish.  There are some online pharmacies who have been found to have fraudulent products by purchasing 3rd party and not directly from the manufacturer (including the "good ones").   There are so many online pharmacies on the market now that you can't keep up with what is what.  By the client getting a written prescription that gives the client the option to research the companies themselves.  We can not approve every online pharmacy anymore since the clinic will become liable of there is an issue.  We want to be sure clients are informed.  Also, you may lose the guarantee on certain products if they are not purchased by a company that gets their products directly from the manufacturer.  For example, heartworm prevention companies offer a guarantee.  If your pet gets heartworms while on their product and you have followed their guidelines and purchased from a company that receives product from the manufacturer (in vets office, some online pharmacies, or vererinarian online pharmacy such as vets first choice or covetrus) the company will pay for treatments.  The clinic is not refusing the prescription,  the client just has to pick up the written prescription themselves and send it in, all we want is the client to be informed.

name: Terri Rose
text: Like family. Great caring and excellent pet care.

name: amy winebarger
text: I took my dog to this animal hospital for several years.  There was always a wait even when we had an appointment.  The reception staff was very nice, but the techs were not always nice or patient, it was really the luck of the draw.  In the end, my dog died while being boarded at this facility after being misdiagnosed.  I would not use them again or recommend them to anyone.

name: Joyce Coleman
text: We have been going to Madison Animal Care for so many years.  Our most recent experience with them was yesterday.    We took our 3 yr old German Shep, Lucy, to be groomed.  We used them many, many times but unfortunately their groomer, which we loved, was no longer there and we went to Pet Paradise in Madison.  Not a good experience.   Madison Animal got a new groomer, Heather, and we used her for the lst time and certainly not the last time, yesterday.    Lucy has never looked so beautiful, smelled so good and the special "no shedding" shampoo is awesome.   After Lucy's bad experience at Pet Paradise I was very nervous about taking her to someone new again.   Heather took the time to talk with me and Lucy came home so happy.    Thank you Heather and everyone else for taking such great care of our baby.  For anyone looking for a vet, stop looking, go to Madison Animal Care.  Everyone there is awesome.    Thank you so very much!

name: J. R.
text: Extremely rude Vet, referred us to a hospital 5 hours away for neurology, called the hospital and they don't even have a neurology center. We informed her of her mistake and not only did she get angry and not help us find a neurologist, she actually said she won't be helping us any further, ever. Very strange woman, seems a bit out of her head, found a wonderful new vet anyway, will not return. Ps. she took a 300$ X-ray without asking us.

name: Joey Rogers
text: There were very helpful and caring when my dog needed a vet and care.  Also, they were they only clinic I could get to see me when the Animal Emergency Clinic kicked me out at 8am when they closed.  Not even my regular vet would see me.  I would definitely recommend Dr. Magee to others.

name: AnnaLee Tillman
text: They are so wonderful to work with and take really good care of our dog.

name: Sharon Wall
text: Excellent care. An appointment is best way to be seen. However they will work you in for urgent care. Treated my 2 dogs, and 17 year old cat that has multiple age related issues. My son in law is a vet in NC. This clinic is my local  choice.  "Just sayin."

name: Ron Willis
text: I simply can't imagine a vet or his staff being any more friendly. They've always gone way above and beyond, even volunteering to pick my dog up from the emergency clinic when I had to be with my wife in the hospital following a stem cell transplant. The dog had to be picked up by 7 am when the emergency clinic closes and a member of Dr. MeGee's staff volunteered to pick her up so I could be with my wife when the transplant surgeon came in that morning. Oh, and there was no charge for their kindness at a difficult point in our life. And, that's just one example of many.

name: Sharon Wall
text: Excellent care. An appointment is best way to be seen. However they will work you in for urgent care. Treated my 2 dogs, and 17 year old cat that has multiple age related issues. My son in law is a vet in NC. This clinic is my local  choice.  "Just sayin."

name: Ron Willis
text: I simply can't imagine a vet or his staff being any more friendly. They've always gone way above and beyond, even volunteering to pick my dog up from the emergency clinic when I had to be with my wife in the hospital following a stem cell transplant. The dog had to be picked up by 7 am when the emergency clinic closes and a member of Dr. MeGee's staff volunteered to pick her up so I could be with my wife when the transplant surgeon came in that morning. Oh, and there was no charge for their kindness at a difficult point in our life. And, that's just one example of many.

name: andra rae
text: The staff was excellent, we had to have our  blind dog of 9 years put down, they helped make the decision as easy as possible.  They even sent a card to us. Thank you!!  Very good place that love animals

name: Shawna Sizemore
text: Very friendly staff and vets! Will do everything they can to take care of your babies and find the problems they’re having! Out of several vets I’ve been to in the area, this is the best one I’ve found

name: Teresa White
text: We have taken out pets to Madison Animal Care since we moved here in 2000 and adopted a puppy from the pound.  They have always been so helpful and caring - and when it was time for one of our pets to be put to rest, they were extremely compassionate and thoughtful.  We will only use Madison Animal Care and recommend them to anyone who asks!!

name: Joe Parker
text: I have been taking my cats to Dr. Magee for around 12 years and I have always been happy with their service. We used their boarding a couple of times as well and I always feel like my animals are well cared for. The staff is always friendly and knowledgeable, and many of them have been there for years and recognize me when I come in, even though I usually bring my cat in only once a year these days.

name: Rosario Miranda
text:
We are new in town and chose this clini because it was near and convenient to our home. Our older dog is so healthy and all we need are usual annual exams. Our new addition is a puppy. We had never owned a puppy since we adopted our older dog at age four. The Vet Tech was so helpful and knowledgeable. She provided good information and the Vet gave us our puppies first flea and heart worm pill for free.

We have not had any problems with the clinic or with our pets and they have a kennel which we have left out dogs. They do a great job of providing care for our animals and we appreciate it.

My only gripe is the prices seem a bit high.

name: Serein Forbes
text: The place gives off a very hospitable and calm environment. The customer service is top tier & the doctors have saved my animals lives many times.

name: Carolyn King
text: They take great care of our dog.

name: Bill Stratman
text: Dr. Magee has been our vet for 14 years.  He not only cares about our pets, he also realizes how much we love our pets.  The girls in the front are great too!  When your pet has a true emergency, they get them in immediately.

name: Kristee Rutland
text:
I just want to say again how amazing these doctors are! They really do care about your babies. I am pet setting 18 year old sweet Millie. When I checked on her this morning she was NOT doing well. They got me right in and worked with me and the owner with her being out of town. I should not be amazed at such wonderful care they give, But every time I go there with my Diva Maggee or someone else they continue to show more and more great Customer Service and just when I think they can't get any better they do!!
THANK YOU AGAIN!!!!

name: Karen Voelker
text:
More than 25 years have passed since we brought our Cocker spaniels to Dr. Brian's the first time.  Since then Madison Animal Care has been our 'go-to' place for all kinds of 'events' from toe nail maintenance to a very panicky event when our little Dachshund sampled rising bread dough and began 'rising' himself.
Always great care, punctual, good to our dogs.  Why go anywhere else????

name: Vic Robertson
text: We have taken our dogs here for 15 years. Great veteranarians and staff. Offers outdoor runs and a green park. They will feed your pet your own food if you bring it with you at check-in. Good prices.

name: Rosario Miranda
text:
We are new in town and chose this clini because it was near and convenient to our home. Our older dog is so healthy and all we need are usual annual exams. Our new addition is a puppy. We had never owned a puppy since we adopted our older dog at age four. The Vet Tech was so helpful and knowledgeable. She provided good information and the Vet gave us our puppies first flea and heart worm pill for free.

We have not had any problems with the clinic or with our pets and they have a kennel which we have left out dogs. They do a great job of providing care for our animals and we appreciate it.

My only gripe is the prices seem a bit high.

name: Bill Stratman
text: Dr. Magee has been our vet for 14 years.  He not only cares about our pets, he also realizes how much we love our pets.  The girls in the front are great too!  When your pet has a true emergency, they get them in immediately.

name: J C
text: I have used these guys for years. Super friendly and always affordable and easy to deal with. My dog Enzo absolutely confirms this since he gets excited when being dropped off here! 5 Stars *****

name: Sarah Holmes
text: When our six-year-old cat was under a lot of stress and pain, Madison Animal Care Hospital took great care of him and put our minds at ease. This high-stress situation was the first time we took him to the vet since we've owned him, and all of the staff were very friendly and reassuring. My only complaint is that our cat isn't used to other animals (and is very timid around them) so he was scared of all the dogs who were excited to play in the doggie daycare. Overall, a great place!

name: Kellie Craig
text: I adopted 2 dogs from Madison Animal Rescue Foundation at Petco.  Madison Animal Care Hospital was one of two vets in Madison that saw both dogs through their visits (initial shots and spay/neuter).  While I live 45 miles away, I have elected to stay with this animal care hospital.  Why - the front desk staff is helpful; I have confidence in both Vets; the vet techs care about their jobs and the animals; the hospital has great hours; the cost is reasonable; and I just generally like the place.  I could have elected to take my dogs to the vets in Athens, but I don't because of the confidence I have in the Vets.

name: Gwen Mier
text: I have gotten very good results at the clinic. although the prices are too high.  I brought my Yorkie in for itching, it was a follow up visit, they charged me for her yearly checkup ($45) which she had just had the month before but she told me it was cheaper that the office visit.  I know Dr. McKee didn't charge office visits for a follow up.  I love my Yorkie and would like to continue there but do not know I can afford it, I am a senior citizen on a fixed income. The visit including the medicine was $79.00.

name: daniel (7anny5up32n0va)
text: I adopted through MARF, and this vet was where the dog had been before. I felt ripped off at my other vet, so I gave Madison Animal Care Hospital a try. Now I take both my dogs there. The vets are great. The staff is friendly. My experience and wallet size post-visit has been much improved over the previous vet. I would definitely recommend Madison Animal Care Hospital.

name: Neil Young
text: This place used to be great. Now they have lost our pets files. Double vaccinated within 3 months. Been rude when questioned and was told to bring our records next time.real professional for a veterinarian facility.

name: Sue
text: Caring people.

name: deborah lacy
text: Very friendly efficient and thorough!

name: zeke aguilera
text: We've been with MACH for years and we love the people!

name: Dustin Bishop
text: This horrific vet refused to see my cat who was sick and they were extremely rude about it! If I could rate them a 0 I would. I do not recommend this vet to anyone!

name: Jackie Byrom
text: Was very helpful

name: Jim Heusel
text: Great care by techs and vets.

name: Angela Thomas
text: I was very pleased with everyone. I will continue to bring our new puppy to them. I truly appreciated them and their love and care for our new baby.

name: Alura Young
text:
These guys are phenomenal! We've been taking our pup, Sam here for all treatments and routine care for about two years now.  The vet techs are very knowledgeable and friendly, as are the doctors and rest of the staff.  When sam had issues with his ears, they did only necessary tests and didn't overcharge.
The staff is not only interested in physical health of your pets, but in the mental/behavioral health.  Sam had fear issues when we adopted him from the shelter and they gave us many tips and forms of contact to help him (by the way, he's doing so much better now)!
Some people don't realize how expensive it is to own and properly take care of their animals; MACH is no more expensive from any other vet clinic in the Huntsville/Madison area.
**Not only is their hospital great, their Doggy Daycare is FANTASTIC.  It's only $10 a day for your pup, and they get to play together outside in the new play area complete with a water fountain. Sam LOVES going there and he especially loves a caretaker, Sal. **  Seriously, this is a great hospital.

name: Jennifer Wilmoth
text: We love Madison Animal Care Hospital! We own a lab mix and a Maine Coon cat.  Our pets have been coming here for a few years now for veteranary care, and for boarding.  Every staff member we have ever spoken with is wonderful.  You can tell every employee loves animals, and loves caring for them.  Everyone always has a smile.  Our dog loves coming here! Our cat is an indoor/spoiled cat, and is always uneasy about leaving the house.  He has always been treated calmly and gently here.  I love that they can perform medical procedures right there if necessary.  They cleaned our cat's teeth last year.  It was done in the morning, and we were able to pick him up that afternoon.  I have never had a complaint, and our animals love them.  They are not the cheapest place in town, but you get what you pay for.  I'm sure you can look around for less expensive places.  However, when it comes to the care of my pets, I would rather spend the money for great care, and know they are well taken care of.

resp.text: Gosh, Thanks!  It's always nice to hear such kind words!  We do love what we do, and we strive to make every interaction with our clients - the people as well as their pets - as pleasant as we possibly can.  While, these days, cost must always be of concern for any type of goods and services, we do our best to contain costs while still providing excellent pet care.  It's good to know we are getting it right, and we'll continue to try hard to do just that.  We love it here - it's a great place to work - and we enjoy seeing our clients each and every day

name: Rhonda Bradford
text: We boarded our dogs here for a week while we went on vacation and had them groomed the day before we picked them up.  One of our dogs contracted a horrible bacterial infection that took two rounds of antibiotics to clear up.  I don't know if the infection came from the kennel or from the groomer - but it was bad.  Our other dog was chipped while there and they never gave us paperwork to have it activated.  They were so hard to work with - they charged us for the vet visit to try and clear up the infection.  We ended up just switching vets completely.  It was the worst experience EVER!!!!!  ...all the way around.

name: Jason Briggs
text: We won't be back. The receptionist with the short blonde hair is extremely unpleasant. I have a pretty thick skin but having a sick pet is stressful. The last thing I need in that situation is to deal with someone who clearly hates her job!

name: Warren Barber
text: Shadow, Buttercup and Leia get good care here.

name: Carol Foster
text: Very caring compassionate staff.  I HIGHLY recommend them for all your veterinary needs!

name: Mikey P
text: Daycare costs are next to nothing, and the person watching them really treats them like their own dogs.  They can usually fit you in if you need to see a vet, and they really do care about every animal they see!

name: Wayne
text: Always kind, even the office worker displays a deep love for animals.  Shots to boarding ~ They do it all.

name: Renz Santos
text: The doctors here are terrific and gave us new pet owners plenty of tips about taking care of our pet.

name: Janet F
text: I have been going to MACH for many years. Dr. Magee has literally saved one dog from bleeding out (in surgery). He has diagnosed or helped diagnose and treat strange problems in several of our cats and dogs. Dr. Grider has gone above and beyond with a very sick dog and other animals as well. The staff is always friendly, helpful, and knowledgeable. I have always been very aware of my options with regard to treatments and costs. I have no idea why anyone has negative remarks or comments regarding this clinic. Right now my husband and I have 4 large dogs and 6 cats. They are a part of our family. We TRUST this vet clinic with our furry family!

name: Dave K
text: Good vets. Always treat our four pets well.

name: Michael Gegogeine
text:
Always great service. I would recommended them to anyone who loves their pet.

Michael Gegogeine
Madison, Alabama

name: Crystal Miller
text: One of the front office girls is just RUDE and unfriendly.  I am new to the area and had to take our dog into see them.  The female vet was rushed and barely looked at my dogs foot and prescribed stuff and was out.  I am used to a follow up call in a few days to check how things are going.  I have gone in numerous times to pick up food and other supplies and still not very friendly.  We will be finding a new vet to use.

name: kim sharp
text: this is a great place they keep both our dogs healthy and clean, and everyone that works there is friendly, as well as knowledgeable.

name: Greg Tilson
text: Hilde and Harding always have fun at Madison Animal Care Hospital.  Great place and nice staff.

name: Mark Weatherwax
text: My wife and i have been going to see Dr. Grider for several years and she has always been very polite and personable. Most important to me is how a vet handles and interacts with my animals. Secondly, i think the people which employed by the vet also speak volumes for the service and quality of care my animals receive. With that said, I have always found Dr. Grider to be a caring and knowledgable vet. She appears to have a good understanding of our needs and provides quality recommendations. As a whole, i believe that the vet techs employed are good and caring. They don't man-handle my animals and are very sensitive to their needs.

name: Robert Mackie
text:
This place is an absolute RIP OFF! They care about one thing and its to take advantage of clients and make money. the doctors here do not care about the animals.

My dog had simple diarrhea and vomiting. I was told they need to do a blood test, pancreas test, this that and the other.  I was handed an estimate of $175.

The vet was not knowledgable and was shooting darts at the sickness.  She was not friendly or sympathetic.  Did not say thank you or you're welcome.

After declining all these unnecessary tests, I was handed prescription pills and a cream to squirt into the mouth.  The doctor left the room.  I asked the nurse how to administer the cream, she had no clue.  I had to read the instructions on the package.

Without even handing a bill, the receptionist said today's visit is $170. I asked for a bill to see the charges.  I was charged $110 just for the medication.  I came home and googled the prices, amazon has all the meds for $40 total.  These people charge more then double the price for meds?

STAY AWAY from this place!  You will end up paying a HIGH amount for nothing.  Much better friendlier vets in town.  These are your typical vets that take advantage and exploit pet owners.

name: Donna Tripp
text: Fast, caring, priced reasonable

resp.text: In today’s economic climate, healthcare costs will always be a concern, for pets as well as people.  In every case, we’ll try our best to contain costs while still providing quality care for your dog or cat.  We will be happy to prepare detailed estimates upon request, and will work hard to craft a treatment plan that is both cost effective and does the most to ensure the best possible outcome for your pet.  We also offer Care Credit for clients that would benefit from a payment plan; this can be very helpful when the unexpected occurs.  We truly wish to partner with pet owners in determining the best way to care for their beloved pet, so it is our hope that all our clients will feel free to ask questions at any time regarding their pet’s care.

name: Charity Rogers
text: If I could give this man more stars I would!!! He safed one of my dog's life when no one else would even look at her. He is helping us through the end stages of cancer with another. He is patient with me when I am overly worried about a third pup. He is caring, the techs are young but good, and the front office staff are amazing. He is usually very VERY very busy, so I do recommend having an appointment. But he is worth the wait!

text: Great first experience at Berry Animal Clinic. I am switching my animals from a different vet and I couldn't be more happy with the service my animals and I have received. Their prices are very affordable, and the staff is very helpful and kind. I recommend this clinic to anyone

name: Michael B
text: I haven’t had a dog in a few years and having recently acquired a new pup for my girls, Dr. Berry was recommend to me. My experience was great as I had to make an appointment with short notice due to the dog having digestive issues shortly after we got her home. The ladies at the desk were super kind and understanding and got us worked right in. Dr. Berry was very informative, explained everything we needed to watch for and promptly treated Millie. I would recommend Berry Animal Clinic to anyone as they are quick, knowledgeable, affordable and very kind. Thanks again!

name: Bailey Berry
text: Super personable and friendly staff,  knowledgeable on wide variety of animals,  effective treatment plans,  and very reasonable prices.  I would recommend this vet to anyone.  It's worth the drive even if youre farther away.  Thank you Zachary Berry & staff!  Can't wait to see y'all again hopefully without a sick and mad kitty!

name: Maria
text: Sam, our 11 year old Chocolate Lab, started behaving and looking odd at us on Thursday evening 02-04-2021. Later in the night he could barely stand. We suspected some type of seizure or stroke. First thing Friday morning we took him to Dr. Berry. He did an x-ray and took blood samples. He told us that Sam had suffered a stroke. Sam could not even stand when we got him to the vet. He stayed at the vet’s Friday through Sunday night. Dr. Berry went in on Saturday & Sunday to check on him and called us with his observations of Sam, even during halftime of the Super Bowl. Monday afternoon we went to get Sam. He could walk but was unsteady on his feet. Dr. Berry and his staff are so considerate of everyone and they love dogs. Very positive experience with them. We have Sam at the house now and his behavior is his usual self as we hope his walking improves.

name: Jenny Berry
text: The dr was great!!!  Dr.  Zachary Berry is the best!  Our problem with our dog occurred at approximately 4:30 in the afternoon.   Our vet of 7 yrs refused to see us because it was their closing time.  I called Dr. Berry's office because he was about 4 minutes away.  Even though  he was in an emergency surgery and close to closing time he told me to bring our baby in.  He took great care of him, explaining everything thoroughly.  His staff is also wonderful.  They are kind, considerate, sympathetic, and very willing to help you! This is not the end of the story.  The next day our older dog became I'll.  I called and they got us right in.  They took of the problem right away.  Berry Animal Clinic is a great addition to our community!

name: Christina Simmons
text: I am sorry to say that I had a bad experience at Berry Animal Clinic.  I brought my cat in with Haws Syndrome and the vet, who didn't introduce himself, treated him by giving him eye ointment and did not even do an exam.  He treated him for worms after I asked about it.  After doing some research myself and reading that Haws Syndrome can be an indicator for any number of issues, but most often gastrointestinal, I took my vet to another vet clinic and they did xrays and found a blockage in his intestines and other gastro issues.  I can't recommend this vet because he was not thorough and only treated my cats symptoms without bothering to find the actual cause of his illness.

name: Greg Patrick
text: Dr Berry and his staff are awesome.  They are very knowledgeable and compassionate.  Their prices are very reasonable and there are “no high pressure sales” of their services (like some vets do).  Plus the clinic and exam rooms are always clean.  Highly recommend them.

text: Dr,Ivey’s, is very rude, and gets mad if you ask a question ,he charged me $80 for a health exam, never wrote anything down, not even the fecal test which was negative for worms,,after he was finished he slammed my pup on the table and pushed her toward me, saying very rudely, that there was nothing wrong with this dog,,when I went back the day after ,He tried to give my pup another exam and charge me again ,he has not refunded my money ,so I paid for nothing this was for a health certificate, which is good for 10 days he knew my pup was leaving within 5 days ,but still insisted on charging me for another exam ,I found a much kinder vet the same day ,that doesn’t even charge you near as much as ivey, and takes time with you ,I love this new vet ,the same day ivey was acting so rudely, childersburg animal pet clinic, with dr Moulin ,did exam and health certificate for only $51 ,I am so glad I will never have to take dr, Ivey’s  intimidation ever again
